Reviews: She is an excellent doctor, who treats her patients at a very personal level Dr Brady took care of us and everything worked great for us The entire team of Dr Brady is very helpful, professional and listens to patient concerns with care and these issues are properly taken care offI wish I could give them more than 5 stars and especially to Dr Brady, who is an excellent consultant and above all a great human being We felt honored to have been her patients She makes you very comfortable during the entire procedure and ensures that you are not stressed during any phase in any way So, when I felt low or felt nervous on some issue, I would contact Dr Brady and she would reply that "it's fine" or "it will get better" or "its pretty normal" made me feel great, even if I were not feeling good earlier These words may seem pretty simple in normal English but believe me, coming from your physician when you are in distress works wonder and Dr Brady is great in communicating them in such a way that these lines would act as healer for meThere aren't enough words to describe how amazing Dr Eric Forman and the staff at Columbia Fertility Center are It felt like everything was done for us Long story short, after several months we had a successful IVF in the first try :) Every doctor we worked with was incredible but our favorite by far was Dr Brady We are definitely coming back for baby #2 :) Dr Brady was incredibly knowledgeable, professional, supportive and super sweet  The staff was so friendly they felt like extended family while going through the ups and downs that can occur with fertility woes  Over the course of two years there were many who I interacted with and I would call out their names but I don't want to leave anyone out! It was a happy day to "graduate" and be released to my ob gyn with hugs and high fives from the staff and Dr Forman!  Fast forward to almost a year later and I'm a first time parent to a happy and healthy baby girl Dr Karipcin was amazing and we were lucky to have her She's a caring and compassionate doctor She was very supportive of me going forward with IVF, so we felt very confident under her care Dr Forman is an open book and has the fastest response rate of pretty much anyone I've ever emailed with, period Columbia really has thought about all of the intricacies and has done a great job making it as streamlined as possible for patients Dr Sinem Karipcin (Dr K) was positive, warm, and laughed with us through the good and bad times! I could not recommend Columbia more Dr Karipcin was our doctor and she was amazing She is a smart, competent, and dedicated professional She is just a wonderfully compassionate and warm person From the very beginning till the end, she was very knowledgeable, attentive and considerate, and she was always easy to talk to and responded to our questions both in person and via emailMy husband and I Dr Forman assisted us through every step of this scary and exciting process He is kind, detailed and always available Dr McConnell is brilliant and also kind and comforting throughout what can be a very anxiety-producing process I mainly see her in the Westchester office, but I have been to the new Manhattan location as well and it's amazing!! I was blown away by the amazing level of care - especially after my husband and I had a negative experience with another fertility clinic Dr Forman was compassionate, informative, and supportive We undertook one round of IVF with Dr Forman and were successful - he helped us beat the odds

Both my husband and I have been very demanding in our attention from the doctor and his team and we got nothing short of it We began our journey nervous and very unsure of what to expect I felt bad emailing him on the weekends because I knew that he would answer within hours and I did not want to take him away from his family Over the course of my journey, I got to know the staff so well that I felt sad leaving to my regular obgyn As a high risk patient, I was very nervous about finding the right doctor who understood my condition and I had the extremely good fortune of being connected with Dr Brady who could not have been more caring and thorough Of course, no one answered the phone upon me calling Yet, every time I see a false bill from them my stress level goes upHe and his team understood that these things mattered and what a difference it makes when your concerns are taken seriously I can not recommend Dr Forman and the entire team - doctors, nurses, techs, etc - highly enough

Dr Forman always took his time explaining, answering our questions, and never made us feel rushed I was able to contact Dr Forman at any time and always received a quick reply whether by email or by phone  Spends a lot of time detailing plans but then doesn't actually follow through Once, when she was done with a procedure with a different patient, she quickly came to see me to personally review my ultrasound and speak to me I was specifically a patient of Dr Forman and his bedside manner is exceptional She was extremely patient with me, answering (in detail) any and numerous questions that crossed my mind He was professional and informative but also explained everything in language that we could understand  I went for a routine visit and had a general question and she went through the history of my chart to respond in a way that was suited for my individual programJessica and Edelith was very polite and sensitive towards me knowing the reason why I am coming to see the doctor I actually teared up when I saw him I rarely find a doctor who I feel is just as invested in my case as I am, and Dr Williams and the group exceeded all of my expectations He always responded to any question or concern I had within a hour or less even when he was on vacation All he doctors in the practice we encountered were just the same She is patient with me and answers all of my questions, and I never feel rushedLet me start off by saying that I'm writing this as my 5 week old son is napping in the other room After seeing many fertility specialists on Long Island and in the city we found Dr Eric Forman

She prepares a road map for a patient and follow it up till the end, which I really liked about her There is nothing ambiguous about her plan, she makes everything simple and clear She is an expert of her field and very knowledgeable care provider in her field of expertise One can be inspired in many ways from herWhile going through all this, you don't only need medications but you also need support and kind words from your medical team as wellIf anyone is considering a fertility program, I would sincerely advise to consult Columbia Fertility and look for Dr Brady as she is the best resource And one last advice, when you become her patient, trust on her judgement and her team and believe me " It will get better"Thank you, Dr Forman, for helping us become parents of an amazing baby boy After such outstanding level of care and professionalism I decide to switch all my doctors to Columbia doctors! We will definitely go back to her if we decide to have a 2nd baby! Dr Forman and the entire Columbia Fertility staff are the nicest people you'll ever come across throughout your fertility journey No question is dumb or too small for him He gets how stressful of a process this is for you and truly does everything he can to make you feel as comfortable and well informed as possible Thank you doctor! In addition he makes it very clear that he cares about your overall health Columbia university fertility center has the most inviting caregivers We are blessed to be associated with them and Dr Forman The best team to go to if you're looking for the right doctor for IVF While he seems a bit quiet and not super warm/fuzzy at first, he clearly cares about his patients--who else calls the evening before a retrieval to check if you have any last questions and wish you luck??--and goes above and beyond to help Dr Forman is everything you could want and more in a doctorDr Rachel McConnell is an outstanding physician She gives you hope and leaves you feeling confident in her capable and caring handsLoved all the staff at Columbia University FertilityI am extremely happy with this center Dr Forman is the best Doctor Thank you Dr Lobo! Nothing was too small for his attention and he's always doing his best for you Peri, the Egg Donor Program Coordinator, is especially great I would highly recommend him and his practice They truly made the experience better as tough as this is experience is Thank you and I hope to see everyone with my double rainbow baby Unsure of where to begin or how to start this daunting process, we decided to meet with a Dr at Columbia and essentially took a leap of faith Completely trust his opinions and have switched to him as a result

I would often bother her with issues, which may not be of great significance but she would always get back very quickly either through email or phoneDoctor was all talk no action I frequently emailed him serious and silly questions and he always answered quickly Even on days he wasn't scheduled to perform certain procedures, he made it a point to be there anyway for his patientsI cannot say enough good things about my experience with Dr Forman and the team at Columbia's fertility centerI cannot say enough great things about this practice He is also very knowledgeable and would not simply just recommend any invasive procedures Save yourself the aggravation, frustration and heartbreak

I would especially mention that even during this stressful Corona pandemic, she really managed everything so well and she ensured that I wasn't effected by it in anyway, for which I am really grateful to her She was always in touch and her entire team was on top of everything She answered all our questions, answered our emails promptly, and was always positive We were so lucky to have worked with her They are great! Dr Rackow and my care team (nurse and care coordinator) were such a pleasure to work with and extremely thorough and informative He was positive and reassuring and was ALWAYS available to answer any and all questions And the staff are equally as caring and helpful From the very first step of receiving information to the end of my process, Dr Brady along with her team, Sherry and Varda, truly made me feel very comfortable and made the journey much easier  The staff are always courteous and Dr Paula Brady is amazing  He's pragmatic, kind,compassionate, so responsive, and super on top of everything Jenny who takes your blood is so kind and skilled and such a pleasure The nurses are great She was incredibly helpful and reliableWe have partnered with Dr Rachel McConnell and so beyond happy with her The morning monitoring was always so prompt in both offices as well He was truly understanding and personable, had amazing communication and response time - no question too inconsequential or too complicated to re-explain and is SUPER informative His nurse Tiffany is the sweetest and most kind and loving person She really taker her time to make you feel safe and taken care of Lastly, the front desk team and Tara, always helpful, friendly and attentiveThis place is wonderful! My husband and I received incredibly personalized care from every member of the team
Words cannot express my gratitude to Jen

We were seen by Dr Paula Brady at the Columbia University Clinic  She answered all my questions and concerns I mean from Antoinette from billing to Katrina and Nicole were just always on point He explained highly complex and technical procedures in plain english

Columbia University Fertility center is an excellent fertility clinic as they have wonderful team of doctorsThe Clinic as a whole is also very good as it is open to patients on holidays, weekends, and even the new year holidayGod has deputed some angels in the form of humans and she is one of those angels working to help distressed people at a very personal levelThe atmosphere at Columbia Fertility Center is warm and welcoming Its the nicest atmosphere I have ever experienced in a doctor's officeWe had an amazing experience First of all the whole place had a positive and light energy The entire stuff was always smiling But honestly it all went so smooth and hustle free I had no confusion I knew what to do next every step of the wayI had a great experience with Columbia Fertility  doctors and staff over a couple of years  All who I interacted with were attentive and responsive- from the front desk staff, nursing staff, back office staff and the doctorsWe had a wonderful experience at Columbia University Fertility Center The office space is bright and clean, the employees are constantly smiling, no matter what time of day it is, and the communication process cannot be beat These are little things, but make a huge difference throughout the experience A million thank you's to every single person we crossed paths with at Columbia- we are forever grateful for all of you and will definitely be back for baby #2! They make you feel welcome, they are fast, and they communicate well Of course there were bad days, hormonal days, sad days, but through it all my care team was supportive! The nurses smile at you and they try to all learn your name The only downside is that I WISH that Dr K could be my OBGYN and deliver my baby! When we arrived at Columbia Fertility, we were impressed with the facility It was welcoming, bright, and new, everything you want from a clinic The receptionists were all nice and pleasant The nurses and technicians became like friends They were supportive and friendly, at a time when you really need to see a smileWe had a wonderful experience here, primarily because of dr BradyThe Columbia Fertility Center has been amazing! I started seeing them less than a year ago for IVF and they have been very helpful every step of the way During the monitoring phases of IVF you may not always see your doctor but that never made me feel uncomfortable because they were all warm and supportive of your concerns We have never met with a more attentive, caring, compassionate and empathic doctor and facilityI had a great experience with Columbia Fertility and would highly recommend to anyone I felt like I was in great hands throughout my entire experience The people at the front desk were always so friendly and helpful Being a teacher, the monitoring hours worked for me and they were able to accommodate me by giving me one of the first appointments I have recommended Columbia fertility to many people and we are eternally grateful for everything they have done for us We have our family thanks to her!! The new Westchester location is beautiful, state of the art, and conveniently located We are forever grateful for their help in growing our family! The Columbia team as a whole has been wonderful - from the front desk, to the nurses, to the staff who coordinate medications, everyone has been professional and sensitive, and things have moved along seamlessly Infertility is physically and emotionally draining, but my husband and I have been able to relax somewhat knowing that they have everything under control here I had a wonderful experience at Columbia Fertility from consultation to conception The office staff, nurses, care coordinators -- they are all so kind and attentive (and the office itself is very relaxing + clean They were very helpful and compassionate  I have been to 3 different centers and this is by far the most thorough, most courteous, caring and treats each patient as though you are their only patient After leaving this agency, I went to New Hope Fertility Center and I'm finally pregnant Incredibly knowledgeable, attentive and warm Every person that works here is truly wonderful The people at the reception desk are amazing They really try to get you in and out as easily as possible I will be forever grateful to all of these people for everything they've done for me These things mean the world to women who have no control over their bad fortune Even the front desk and nurses who draw blood exhibited the same standard of care Her staff In Scarsdale and the city were just the best They always made sure they called/emailed me with any information and results and were very sympathetic They were caring, kind, brilliant, and progressive I previously saw another Dr in Brooklyn, but my experience at Columbia Fertility Clinic was like night and day All the nurses in the center who assisted us and did our Lab work (on what felt almost daily) were so professional and kind I can't say enough wonderful things of this entire practice! I am so happy we chose Columbia University Fertility! We are so blessed that all went perfectly and we are expecting a baby, May 1st! THANK YOU to the fantastic team or caring professionals! The process of scheduling appointments is seamless, and I adore all of the nurses, secretaries, and phlebotomists I have interacted with So grateful for their entire team! Would highly recommend staying away from Columbia

This was probably the most non-overwhelming doctor experience I have ever had The wait time for appointments is either nonexistent or extremely low considering other doctors offices I've been tooMy husband and I came to Columbia Fertility after having a terrible experience with another fertility doctor in Manhattan who made me feel old and defective I never had to wait more than ten minutes for morning monitoring--very important when you're squeezing these many appointments into the early hours before work! IVF is such a stressful experience, and you want to work with experts who will make it as manageable as possible This communication is above and beyond and the whole team at Columbia never made me feel like there was a silly or stupid questionThey have attempted to re-brand themselves with a new office and new Yelp page, but this is the same old crappy CWRC with a new name But, I do blame them for not having their billing situation togetherI've been a patient here for about a year and can't say enough good things It was bittersweet and felt strange as we have bonded and felt at home with everyoneOMG this practice thinks they can get away from all their horrible reviews because they rebranded themselves and got a nice lil makeover but this place is still as crappy as it was before This place sucks

Even when you call them at a very short notice, they get back to you quite quickly Everyone was on point I didn't have to remind or explain anything to anyone We were always updated the same day after our appointment A few specific logistical perks of Columbia are that they make morning monitoring appointments for you (as opposed to first come, first served, walk-in time frames which is how a lot of other places do it) Additionally, procedures are done on-site in the back surgical room (as opposed to going to the corresponding hospital which is also how other places seem to do it) No matter what route you end up taking to get pregnant, there are a ton of appointments involved The wait for appointments and morning monitoring was never long  A lot of women use this center for their fertility and it's incredible how the office is able to manage it I have never sat in the waiting room for a long time, even when it is busy The office also runs smoothly There were some days that I waited longer than usual to be seen but it did not happen often The reviews have proven to be spot on Just got off the phone with their billing person and he couldn't even explain why I was receiving bills and told me to call the fixer or customer service person at ColumbiaI went to this office for the first time mainly due to seeing Jen the pheblemist in the elevator Also the front desk is so professional and resourceful The wait is minimal if at all They are very attentive and available when you need them From the front desk staff, to the billing team, to the clinical team, we were blown away The doctors suck - they don't give a shit and never return your calls There was not one phone call - during or after hours - which was not returned to us outside of 20 min

The way Dr Brady used to say those things made my body believe that "its pretty normal" and it is very important in this treatment Dr Forman broke down the process step by step for each procedure and made sure all was understood No stress no confusion thanks in part to the efforts of the former CWRC aka Columbia University Fertility I'm happy to have chosen Columbia to address my fertility issues years ago! Currently we are expecting a healthy baby!!!!!! I continued my pregnancy with Columbia doctors and continued to have a great experience I don't need any stress in my life during this pregnancy I am so happy thus far I did After more research, we decided to switch to Dr Eric Forman for our first (and successful!!) IVF cycle and SO happy we did So happy I was recommended here!!I am so glad that I chose to use Columbia when my husband and I struggled to conceive We were only given a 20% chance of successfully conceiving

My husband and I have been trying to conceive for years but was not having any luck We've been with Columbia this entire time, and couldn't be happier with our decision We can't recommend her enough Can't recommend Dr Forman highly enough It's really not acceptable The day of the procedure, it wasn't guaranteed that he could make it but he rushed to the clinic and made it happenI can't recommend Columbia University Fertility Center enough I ended up doing two (failed) cycles of IUI last year with the Doctor we had first met with at Columbia I could not recommend Dr Forman enough!Had bad experience that lead to emergent surgery as opposed to semi-urgent surgery if diagnosed earlier

She considers her patients as humans, understands them and design the program accordingly for each patient individually based on the specific requirements of the patients It all changed when we met Dr Forman Overall, the process was lengthy, but we were able to conceive on our first round of IVF We didn't know what to expect when we first decided to go to the fertility center Finally, instead of taking an injection class, we were able to sit down one-on-one with a nurse to go over the processIt took us 45 years to get pregnant! I had some uterus issues, and we did 2 egg retrievals and 3 embryo transfers (3rd one worked!) I write this as my two week old naps Maybe it just wasn't my month After less than a yr with her we are finally pregnant and graduated from the facility Fingers crossed!

I went to Columbia in July 2018, paid over $13K up front for a cycle that ended up not working, and fast forward to Dec 2018/Jan 2019 and I'm still receiving bills from them! It seems like Columbia is trying to double dip! They collected my money up front, and then tried to bill my insurance too On top of  trying to charge me for monitoring services that I previously paid for before the start of the cycle, they are trying to charge me $1200 for frozen embryos that aren't even normal I don't blame Columbia for my cycle not working

No thanks for this place Can't thank you all enough She paid close attention to my body through bloodwork, which directed her to give me an IVF treatment that was catered for my body The billing system is terrible - still receiving bills from 2013

He was always kind, patient and positive, calling me each time he changed the medicine dosage to explain why or when the process did not go according to plan We used a surrogate and Tiffany, like Dr Liu, was a sincere cheerleader I felt taken care of, unlike with other practitioners who saw me with a dollar sign in their eyes and that I was just another battery farm hen I am so grateful to Dr Liu and his team for giving me the best gift of motherhood New Hope Fertility was my answered prayer to starting my family and I'm grateful to be on this journey with such an phenomenal place Just want to thank Dr Liu from new hope fertility who has helped me through this ivf process the last two years He is amazing, patient, supportive, compassionate and took such great care of me We are extremely grateful he has helped bless us with a blessing we thought was never possible When I first met with the doctor she was nice, but talked to me for 5 minutes before doing the ultrasound When she did the ultrasound she said "looks like you may have some endometriosis  I came in with very low expectations for customer service, doctor "bedside manner" and the like, HOWEVER, I was very much blown away by how I was treated  I had my consultation with Dr Olcha who very clearly drew out diagrams on his ipad and explained EVERYTHING to me and my partner  Partner and I really enjoyed our experience with the doctor and team  Nope, I've gone at least a handful of times (even more in the future) and every time had a professional and respectful experience  My emails are promptly responded to and when I email Dr Olcha, he emails me back, right away!  I get a faster response from Dr Olcha than some of my work colleagues, lolz Doctor Zhang is very attentive and passionate about what he does, he is hopeful and realistic at the same time Wish me luck! I am writing​ this review because I would like to express my appreciation​ to Dr Merhi He really is the best doctor I have met in my life He is kind, compassionate, having a ​positive​ vibe and very professional at​​ the same time​​ Long story short, when I had a problem with NHFC, Dr Merhi called me to make sure if everything was okUpdate:I used to recommend this place to everyone but they are really struggling to keep up Dr Zhang is really good at what he does I only had optimism and not really a clear picture on what my issues really wereUpdate Update!!!!I changed my insurance and thanks to Dr Yang and his staff I am 9 weeks pregnant with my twins!! I did one cycle/round of IVF and our dreams are coming true!! We are over the moon happy!! I know this sounds crazy but I am going to miss the staff! They were always so pleasant and positive and that kept me motivated I feel like they treat patient like numberDr Merhi is wonderful  Any time I've wanted to speak to the doctor, he makes time for me He listens to the patient and is not interested in personal results and stats but is genuinely interested in the well being of his patient He makes himself available to answer questions and is very reassuring I am highly impressed with this clinic and unequivocally recommend NHFC and particularly, Dr Merhi  I am so thankful that I did because I found a clinic and doctor who have made the process so much easier by treating me like a human being  Yes we had success and recently delivered a beautiful healthy baby girl, but I felt the whole process was smooth and very attentive It should be noted that we were regularly reminded how poor our odds of success were, and the doctor agreed that stopping made sense We replied that we were asking to be acknowledged in some way and treated like individuals but received no further response The first thing Dr Zhang told us was that "there is no problem with you, tests are all good, all you need to do is to nourish your body and get ready" Hey, we made it after all these years of pain and desperation, and we are really proud of ourselves and our 2 kids!In a nutshell, we are very grateful to Dr Zhang who made our dream come true, and to his conviction of combining Western technology with Chinese cultivation/nourishment methodology I feel like the nurses really handled my care this time without consulting with doctors I ended up seeing Dr Olcha who was great and held my hand through the whole process!Dr Merhi was lovely He was very straightforward, and gave practical advice for our situation, which we followed and had a successful natural IUI at our first try!  He was very nice on the phone and asked us to try again  The doctor admitted that another doctor looked our case while he was on vacation  Though our journey was very long and difficult, the door at NHFC never closed,  Dr Zhang recommended mini IVFs with much less medications and my body and mind were peaceful and comfortable with cycles  With great thanks to Dr Zhang, Dr Lui, Joanna (nurse) and Chisa (embryologist) who supported us thru this difficulty journey, our life changed with this miracle baby o(^-^)oDr Merhi at the New Hope Fertility Center was referred to me for fertility treatment From our initial visit, we fell in love with Dr Merhi He is very attentive to his patients, caring, comforting, personable and has a great sense of humor Dr Merhi was amazing through it all! After 7 years of going to my OBGYN feeling broken and helpless, being diagnosed with PCOS doing the timed intercourse, being given Clomid and Metformin, using OPKs, getting an HSG and being told that it would happen if I gave it time saying they could not physically ever find anything wrong with me I was finally referred to New Hope Fertility center After 5 IUIs at Weill Cornell, 3 IVF cycles at RMA NY (horrible horrible!) and then finally 2 rounds at NHFC, we are blessed with a beautiful baby girlThis was one of the worst doctor experiences I've ever had  We were told the prospect looked dismal, and we should think about donor eggs, surrogacy or adoptionAt the time of hopelessness, we came across New Hope and Dr Zhang Now that my cycle failed nurses advised that I meet with Dr Zhang for my next steps In spite of repeated calls and pleading that someone call me back about some time sensitive issues and questions its been silence from NHFC My husband and I had some difficulty during our process, as this is not a simple process to go through  No one ever sat down with me and went over a schedule Empty apologies and misinformation were all we received in our lengthy wait Any office - let alone a medical office - that manages itself in such a terrible, disorganized way instills very little confidence in what goes on beyond the waiting room But unfortunately I have not seen or heard from the man since my first consultation We never felt like a priority to them After the IVF failed, Dr Zhang didn't call, not even to encourage me to do a 2nd roundAfter trying several other NYC fertility clinics where we had very negative experiences, we finally went to New Hope I have never been treated so poorly by a medical professional  Messy treatment procedure  My wife was asked by the doctor to have her 4th IUI and they collected my specimen only to find they messed up my wife's ovation date and need to reschedule to two days later We had gone to several centers and were extremely disappointed  No other doctor took the time to do this; Dr Merhi listened when I voiced my concerns of the medications were affecting my body Therefore, presented here is a critique of their manuscript and of uncontrolled clinical use of LI-IVF, in general He seemed rushed and the billing department made numerous mistakes causing us a lot of un-needed hassle especially during a sensitive time My Hormone levels indicated some issues and my current/new RE is questioning them and wondering why no one - no Doctor at NHFC has brought this up with me and still went through with my first IUI (which was unsuccessful; as was the subsequent)PREPARE TO BE IGNORED BY NHFC!I never write reviews, but felt compelled to write one about this careless, useless & hopeless place!  DO NOT get suckered into going here for fertility treatment  Someone within this company NEEDS TO TAKE A SERIOUS  LOOK AT THE BILLING PROCESS AND PROCEDURES!!!We went through a crisis while we were being treated there and their response was negligent and appalling  My experience was horrendous  He avoided and skirted our questions when we him asked why we would do IVF when there was no clear diagnosis  Dr Zhang was the worst because he did not care to ever have a conversation  No kidding - after my last IVF failed, the nurses (not Dr Zhang) called to say, "Come on in when your cycle starts so we can schedule your next IVF

They sat down with me and my husband and spoke to us about what we've done and what we should do Finally, when my husband went up and spoke to someone after 2 hours we were taken in to see the doctor about the genetic results She then told me, "oh, don't listen to her She then told me I was just "uneducated," but said that they would still be able to perform this test today magically The doctor sat with us for 45 minutes to go over our history in detail and now I'm waiting to get help for my endometriosis which they think is the problem before we start fertility treatments5 hours of a full blown sales pitch), her immediate question was "What should I put you down for? IVF treatments?" When I first got to New hope I was impressed by the facility It was clean and the staff was friendly The most impressive thing was how thorough they were I thought it was all over but the clinic stays open and checks our temperature at the door, has a nurse pumping hand sanitizer into our hands, the whole staff began wearing face masks and shields, the seats are separated for social distancing Needless to say I felt safe Thank you everyone at New Hope!! You're angels and I'll always appreciate you all The aquarium in the waiting area is so soothing! It's somewhat surreal I read some of the reviews of others who gave them a 1 Star review and I'm like how?! Why?! Nothing is perfect, but New Hope is perfect for me; the same day NYC officially re-opened and I think it's quite cool to tell my future kids about the day they were conceived The procedure was pain free thanks to a wonderful  anesthesiologist and the pain afterwards was tolerable Also, I'm 39 & went through the Mini-IVF treatment which no one else in the city is capable of providing you with such a treatment besides the experts at New Hope Fertility I liked the center's philosophy on trying to get quality ovums and blastocysts over quantity to better your chances But it turns out that I got pregnant on the first try! Enough saidMy husband and I have been to a number of fertility clinics trying to conceive and finally at the first try at New hope we are expecting our little girl in a couple of weeks  New hope is a very professional clinic with very respectable nurses and staff  While it was a rocky road from beginning to end we finally were blessed with a successful pregnancy The clinic is clean, organized, and as relaxing as a fertility clinic could be Just one word of advice, they get many clients so it helps to be on top of your own baby "game" For the most part, all the nurses are  very nice and so are the doctors when you actually with them When I call in to speak to a nurse, the receptionist will take my name and phone number, and I will get a call back near the end of the day, which in my opinion is not right It seems like they don't have a system to properly file faxes as they come in I called them and I brought it to their attention and they agreed I was right Till today, they have not owned up to their mistake and apologized to us As a matter of fact they have corrected themselves and are making me believe that I was the one who misunderstood them! It's a joke It feels like a farm - you come in, your name appears, sees someone (not even a nurse) in 30 seconds and you are done To make it worse, the last straw that broke our hope with "New Hope" was they asked my wife to use an injection that's not covered by insurance without any prior discussion of the necessity or reason why it's not covered or our consent based on our financial condition  I will strongly recommend not to use their serviceFeel like a very small, tiny Chinese restaurant with one employee takes million orders I have filed a complaint with the Better Business Bureau and I'm considering suing them I don't understand how people can be so cruel to patients BEWARE of this place, and if you have the means do yourself a favor and go to a reputable clinic attached to a proper medical center  As soon as we enter the center we knew we were at the right place and we literally said we have "new hope"  I never felt as calm as I did at New Hope  Everyone from the front desk, to the nurse and finance department are so caring and welcoming None would ever compare to New Hope and the wonderful staffMy husband and I are immensely grateful to the doctors, nurses and administrative staff at NHFC! Dealing with infertility is an intensely draining and bewildering experience We really appreciated the clarity and efficiency of the New Hope system (the waiting room, with its WiFi, big windows overlooking Columbus Circle, soothing aquarium, and screens telling you where to go when your name is called during monitoring hours is an especially welcome change from other practices), as well as the friendliness and compassion of all of the staff More than anything, we are thrilled to have achieved a healthy pregnancy and to have welcomed a beautiful baby girl! I recommend them without hesitation First of all, their monitoring hours are until 2:00pm, which is a huge relieve if you work  Second, I felt all the staffs to be warm and cordial This sounds like a small issue, but when you are in taking hormones and the level of anxiety is high, a nice word or a nice gesture makes a whole differenceIn 2013 my husband and I joined the New Hope Fertility Center IVF trial Additionally, the center has top notch equipment and great installations Plus, being in New York we had lots of fun there when we had to travel for the treatment One star is to its embryology lab, which is top notchI don't think a billing department like New Hope's can be any worse They agreed to review my bill on the call, but then I continue getting bills from them and was then never able to get a hold of them I then wrote a complaint to Better Business Bureau and even them were not able to get in contact with New Hope  Turns out that they have published only 1 study on mini-IVF before, and they have funding to test whether mini-IVF works as well as regular IVF in a new group of patients  I was surprised to read that at the same time that they are studying whether mini-IVF works --- and it might, who knows? --- they are taking people's money to treat them with mini-IVF  The materials on their website say that mini-IVF works as well as regular IVF, and yet there really isn't evidence for that, something that they have been called out for in the medical literature (Gleicher N, Weghofer A, Barad DH This was extremely stressful and required quite a bit of energy to resolve There are many other clinics where you can find success The 2nd issue is that NHFC no longer takes my insurance, so I have been paying out of pocket - and of course it's insanely expensive; exceptionally more expensive than my new center, and if there are hormonal issues, isn't it a moot point to go through with an IUI? Or are you just doing it so you can charge me for it willy nilly?  I really like the staff: nurses, front desk, bloodwork - but in 8 months, I have only seen Dr Zhang once for an initial consultation, and then some random doctors who performed the IUI - in & out (literally - haha) And no followup except via nurses, a quick call, or email Their systems are efficient; somewhat cattle call-ish, as they move you through fast and thoroughly, but their lack of personal interaction or empathy and care and individualized attention is disconcerting I'm a pretty independent, low maintenance, easy going person, and even I feel that there could be alot more individualized attention to patients aside from a "patient liason" I observe wandering around sometimes They will be very nice to you, but it won't seem genuine You'll be escorted throughout the office to have an ultrasound, blood work, meet with the doctor, who will recommend mini-IVF and PGD You are sure you've finally found the right place!  An answer to your prayers You will call New Hope and get to a voicemail box for the nurses  Just as I thought the billing process was beginning to work itself out, we have taken 10 steps backward away from progress Even my INS advised me to look for a clinic with better financial  communicationNew Hope likes to advertise that they have helped women over 45 with IVF We would recommend using CHR in New York if you like personal attention and a friendly staffI have tried to come twice for a consultation on freezing my eggs--each time, I was early for my appointment time and each time, I waited over an hour to be seen, giving up at about 1 1/2 hours to get back to businessI had a very positive experience at New Hope Fertility Center that culminated in a successful and healthy pregnancy The practice is very busy so there are times where patients may need to follow up aggressively and the nature of fertility treatment does require patience and managing expectations but overall I found the staff and quality of care to be excellent Although you may experience issues, they are truly interested in improving their business, based on complaints and feedback If you are deciding on fertility clinic, my advice is this is number one placeI can honestly say New Hope Fertility is God-sent fertility center I am so grateful that I found this clinic You don't see him often after your first appointment, but who cares, they have an amazing staff of nurses The billing team can be all over the place, but I will take it any day if this clinic gave me the most precious gift of life, my baby girl!!! They let me know that we would be trying again next cycle I also got pregnant that round My egg retrieval took place today at 8:30aI went to NHFC because after doing some research on doctors in Manhattan, I decided to go with Dr Jennifer MakarovI went there for an embryo transfer I was planning to have in the coming month Long story short I ovulated to early and they couldn't retrieve any eggs, so I went for another roundI was against the genetic testing and was pushed  to do it I had to come back for a saline test and I spoke with the nurse who told me to come in before my test results They made me wait over 2 hours to get a saline test before I had to come in to read my genetic test results They all confirmed and stated that it would only be a few more minutes She replied, "The ultrasound??" to which I said  She let me know that I had come in "much too late" for that and that I did not follow the instructions that were provided to meI met with Dr Jackman a couple of weeks ago for an initial consultation We haven't even gone through initial fertility testing to see if that is even necessaryPlanned on writing this review AFTER my procedures, however, decided to do it early quantity" philosophy  I originally was going to do the IUI route, however, will now be doing IVF And now I am going back to Dr Merhi for #2 I've done a half dozen rounds at this point, so I've learned a few things about my body  Let's not even go there with my PCOSI gave 2 two stars because of I got pregnant I am now 9 weeks pregnant at 45 with my own egg (after having been told by others that I would have go with ovo donation) I plan on returning to Dr Merhi for my second child  In the meantime, I was to start bloodwork and monitoring  Not pregnant so far  We did try donor eggs, had 20 embryos and transfers, but ended up in miscarriages one after the other Where was a doc when I needed one? This was my last viable embryoOne setback is the anesthesiaFed up with this place  We just finished our 4th cycle  We took a break to mentally prepare ourselves  In our  4th cycle experience we had to restart our cycle 2 times  We requested the same doctor after every monitoring We were then ask to take clomid  After the following monitoring we were told the follicles were gone  We were told from that monitor to continue to take  birth control pills via email instructions Where is my doctor?Part two of 4th cycle We took the birth control pills  Follicle recruitment as expected  We asked for our doctor to follow up The following instructions were to take clomid and gonal  We were very stern - why are we taking these medications  Part three of 4th cycle The end result  We all came here to start a family or grow our family I went with my husband for a consultation in the spring of 2018 and we decided to move forward with our IVF procedure a few months later, in the summer He did not rush any component of the procedure, even though it took us a little longer than expectedI was followed by Dr Zaher Merhi First visit - ultrasound and blood test Nurse tells me i don't need any pills Bc i was ovulatingMy thoughts and advice:1 All the protocols are personalized and Dr Yang follows through with his patients from the beginning to the end I had visited many fertility doctors and most of them told me I'd need to use donor egg given my age and egg quality Previous ivf cycles had not rendered me any eggs It took some banking but I eventually got myself a viable embryo I did not get any response from them I worked with Drs Liu and Merhi He also acknowledged a mistake made during one of my cycles which had to be cancelled and gave me a free cycle  This had nothing to do with timing my hormone cycles - they were controlling them with Birth Control  My cycle hadn't even started yet  I underwent a similar procedure in another state  I was able to produce 14 follicles naturally (with proper stimulation, given my fertility history and hormone panels, I should have been able to produce considerably more with stimulation  The average clinic is able to retrieve (statistical averages) 70 % of the eggsAn update to my last review They sent us a form to fill up which we did It was exactly the right approach, worked for us and we now we have a 1month old baby boy  He told me I needed to do IVF right away because statistically my fertility was falling off a cliff although I explained that my husband and I had only been trying to conceive for just over 3 months and I'd gotten naturally pregnant and had a miscarriage in that timeUpdate, three years after settling my account, I started receiving bills again I started fertility treatments at NHFC in May 2015 with 2 cycles of IUI and 3 cycles of IVF My IVF cycles took longer because I have two retrievals each cycle None of the other fertility centers do that However, I've gone back a few times to build my egg bank and I will continue to do soThe reason I chose this place is because of Dr Zhang However, I saw 3 doctors while I was having IVF We had a long consultation with Dr Zhang We're all on hormones This past January, we transferred the two 3 day embryos we were able to get over the past yearuntil our first ultrasound Having gone through this, I now know that I have done everything I can to try to conceive using my eggs That's all that matters - the result!Hello All!  I started this review in 2014 and made it a point to complete it todayMy husband and I were 40 when we got married and we tried having children right away I had tried 3 other times previously in another country and didn't get pregnant At th end of hte day, though fertile, I was anyways 43, so ivf was done for both reasons  I am almost 40 and conceived naturally with my first  So we decided to give it a try  I had all previous test results from other fertility clinic which showed my infertility is unexplained age, egg quality, other conditions  We decided to follow Dr Zhang's recommendation and proceed with IUI and I am now 13 weeks pregnant with the first IUI I can go on and on  When we went back two days later, they ran another test and told my wife, the egg is gone  But still tried to continue with IVF until they kept asking us to fill medications on a very short notice period After few tries it did happen and now I have a baby girl But it was too late to try for another one after that birthMy husband and I have tried for many years to conceived From that moment Dr Merhi spent quality time on my case Just as an example, he prescribed me 1/3 the amount of hormones and injections I was taking at RMA, and the end result in the first cycle was the same I was getting at RMA  If I knew all of these since the beginning, I would never had gone through 4 conventional IVF cycles at RMA I did one round of IVF, but ended up getting pregnant naturally after I had surgery Five stars through and through! Epub 2011 Jun 26  "A recent publication in this journal strongly advocated low-intensity IVF (LI-IVF) after presenting the authors' experience with minimal ovarian stimulation (mini-IVF) Contrary to Dr Zhang, I did not need IVF to have a baby However after being there for one cycle they quickly started pushing donor eggs  We did the sonogram after our "lecture  It didn't work right away, so Dr Zhang and his team worked with us to "bank" embryos in order to send them out for PGD testingIn my 20's, I got pregnant but had an eptopic pregnancy Since then, I had 2 more and it was suggested to remove my right tube and do an invitro The 2nd one was at Cornell, which also worked but we found out the baby had down syndrome (due to my age now) at 10 weeks The 3rd one didn't work I had 7 and it turns out only 1 was normal I was 36 when I got pregnant They're a younger, smaller institution  I only needed to wait 15 minutes before I went in to consult with Dr ZhangI've been undergoing fertility treatments for over two years He must have hired a coach because he said all the right things but did not do anythingFrankly, I am only working with them because they have 3 of my embryos  I have not had to wait very long The embryology dept

The only thing I that kind of broke my heart was the fact that my health insurance duped me and I'll have to pay all my expenses out of pocket They are so upfront and honest with you about each step and this includes billing The next thing I know I was on different type of hormones and was pushed to accept a genetic testing that cost 750 and was not covered by the insurance Before the procedure I have asked the billing department of everything was ok and if they received the pre authorization They received the pre authorization 6 days after and the cryopreservation WAS NOT covered and I have know to pay out of pocket About billing department, I did not have a big issue or cost as I expected the cost as well as I got handout about the fee at the first consultation Thus for a long time, I did not know how much I was paying Overall, I definitely​ recommend​ NHFC especially​ they have wonderful​ doctors such as​ Dr Merhi And I'm covered under insurance! Their job should be to make it as easy as possible (and do everything they can to work with insurance) to get people in there They also work with you regarding the NYS Infertility grant program  We decided to try reproductive assistance since our insurance also covered this kind of service  What I liked about NHFC is NHFC doctors listen to you and work with patients together I want to say it was a long journey almost a year, very expensive but well worth it I am 9 weeks pregnant and this part made us feel more comfortable as we paid out of pocket  When I reached out to the billing department to ask for an itemized bill explaining what I was being charged for, they told me my bill would be forgiven  Thats nice but Thanks NHF for a great job!!! The price from the other places are way more expensive compare to New Hope The staff over the past year has mainly been excellent We had some minor issues with billing, but I am extremely lucky that insurance covered the bulk of my treatment I can't say enough about the care I received at New HopeCame to NHFC for a second opinion and ended up sticking to their care Their billing representative admitted that they should have told us, but still refused to reduce the amount of the bill to what they would've accepted from our insurance company under the circumstances It was a financial sacrifice, but worth every pennyGood service until transfer I was never told that these would not be destroyed after we terminated our relationship and they refunded our money It was New Hope's misinformation that misled us thinking our treatment (embryo banking) would be coveredEverything is good besides the billing department Well, I went to Zhang *after* going to that doctor (he's definitely skilled & the best doc at NYU-FC) & after that guy's institution took nearly six-figures worth of our money -- our savings -- how much of savings does that NYU guy have? Meanwhile that NYU doc gets paid a seven-figure salary from NYU plus doing glamour stints on TV shows, etc  They are basically their to make sure you pay  i should have listened to the reviews and saved my time and money i went there for the embryology dept and under the false promises of Dr Zhang that he would pay attention to my case for the cycle

They do not care However, there are many hidden fees ( which were mostly covered by my insurance so no so big deal) They don't care I know this bc they have been a major barrier as to why I haven't come in for more rounds of freezing Its cost is cheaper compared to other IVF clinic but it is still not worthy it It wasn't until I really sat down and read about my coverage that I realized they were wrong How did I pay for this?  I entirely drained my 401k accountVery bad treatment and financial planning The process for getting our account cleared and our biological material destroyed has been HELL Fourth, the price you pay for the mini cycle is a lot less than the conventional IVF They gave out wrong insurance coverage information and charged us back when my insurance company has denied coverage I basically used up my insurance coverage for IVFs because of their misinformation The staff asked for my insurance info even though we were cash paying clients We soon found out they charged our insurance for things we paid cash for You will have a billing question and leave a voicemail for the billing departmentAll we want to do is forget our experience there, but on top of everything, we have been battling the billing department for a year now  No one could explain why to costs an additional charge when it was included in my consultation  Their billing department is not there to help you understand your insurance  I also put a stop payment on my Am Ex  They don't care about about you as a person

They discussed the cost before even doing any work What I did not know is that the cryopreservation was not covered either and costs 1250! I was never mentioned 1) the cryopreservation 2) the cost or even the eventuality it won't be covered She said not yet but everything should be covered except the testing What started out as an "educational session" turned into a full blown sales pitch for IVF treatments is their billing department Their ineptitude has cost the company a lot of money That's how revenue is generated after all I would give 5 stars if not for the billing team  This process was actually affordable too believe it or not  After my blood was taken, I was ushered to "billing" where I was asked to set up a payment plan for IVF  I was incredibly put offI have to update my initial reviewMy rating is a zero  We purchased the gonal which is expensive  NHFC may be working for a lot of couples today  NHFC is not working for us In the end, I gave up and went to another service provider  All the services rendered were in June 2014 and included one doctors consultation and some minor lab workI'd already settled my account I know I will be back for my second babymedicallawperspectives Since day 1 and including up until last month, 3 different staff members here misinformed about my insurance coverage I started at NHFC in Janary 2015 at 44 years old  I did 5 mini IVF cycles at a fraction of the cost of my 2 conventional IVF cycles My insurance covered nothing  This is the reporting organization for assisted reproductive technologiesI have never been there yet However, it's been two weeks and over 50 calls to find out whether my insurance can cover the first visit or not I was able to retrieve 10 eggs, which was the average I retrieved at RMA, but with much less medication You will talk to the billing department You will cringe at the cost of this supposed more affordable treatment option, but you will mentally justify the cost Of course, go "Straight to IVF"  because it costs $33,000!
