Feels terrible going to a place where the people who are supposed to care for you at such an important time just want to take your money and remind you of this fact in their medical neglect and alternately omnipresent collections Having a fancy office in a fancy Manhattan location does not make for a good practice This practice did not send any records after multiple requests over the phone and in writing! Comically, a large packet showed up almost a YEAR later when we'd forgotten everything about it along with a bill for $79 We declined to pay saying that at that point there was no need for the records, we had to repeat several tests and they had been woefully inadequate in responding to our original request  BUT there is no excuse for the staff's cold demeanor and their failure to treat patients as a human being I have found that every woman is pushed through the same process, given the same advice and has the same plan, regardless of the fact that many of us are there in the first place because we have serious medical issues that demand attentionI also find it enraging that they cannot print and mail me an itemized bill like a human being, and instead announce in front of the entire waiting room how much I owe To date I have had the nurses forget to refer my follow-up questions to the doctor on four separate occasions, give me contrary instructions about when to have intercourse after taking FSH drugs, and screw up an important prescription (first forgot to call it in and then, because it was after hours and I needed the injection that night, made me race around town to get to a pharmacy that has the drug and pay out of pocket, because that pharmacy was not within my insurance's coverage, but it was the only place I could get the drug, or I would have had to waste another cycle of eggs) The doctors who see you when you come in for monitoring are just rushing to get to the next patient, so they offer little to no information unless you ask a million questions and even then, will try very hard to palm you off on the nurse if they canIt is unbelievable how bad the white plains office is being run They are unorganized, no customer service They have good and bad days but mostly bad Walking through such an emotional, physical, and financial process is really difficultI understand why people would write negative reviews because it really isn't a place where you get your hand held Yes, if you are JUST finding out about your infertility and want a place where you can cry it out after a failed attempt (believe me, I've been there) - this won't be the perfect place  Later, when I spoke with the nurse and told her that there had been multiple screw-ups with sending my Rx to my insurance company to get filled, she hands me a new Rx and tells me "why don't you just take it to a local pharmacy and if you have to just pay out of pocket, it's not going to break the bank, it's only $128I have NO stars to give this doctor office Unfortunately I have nothing good to say For a practice that handles such sensitive work I am SO disappointed with the lack of compassion in the receptionists and the whole office There is no follow up, there is no returned calls Completely ignoring me as if they were a clerk in a supermarket Just awful! And to get your medical records forwarded I would live to speak with a supervisor of the NYC location and notify the doctors of my disappointment in the way that the office is run

Don't let that full waiting room turn you off, there are so many of us in the same boat They move through the crowd rather quickly Before discovering RMA, we were at another fertility clinic Our old place also chewed up hours of my busy work schedule The convenience of monitoring hours and their fast paced staff, makes RMA seamless We were a teamother times they were notWhen I arrived for my scans and blood work, often times a doctor would come in, state their name and immediately begin the ultrasoundFor over the 10 years I have been trying to have children with several failed IVF, I pray that God answer my prayer through RMA The receptionists do the work of finding your orders, informing the medical staff, and printing your labels so that you should never have to explain "why you're in today" All you do is print your first name on a sheet at the front desk and wait to be called Results from the morning are provided by 3 p every afternoon clinic hours I feel that shouldn't be available for all their staff to see when you call etc, and Florence M I was able to voice any feelings, concerns and questions and anything I needed was provided Nurses who seemed really overworked since they would only talk for moments at a time, literally MOMENTS at a time They would tell me, "come in for ultrasound" or "get this drug", "have sex tomorrow" This is the only interaction I had with people I had started getting information by reading the websites of other fertility clinics I called and the appointment was scheduled for within the week (rare for specialists) He ordered a million tests first and the nurse walked me through how to schedule and when I had an appointment with her on April 17, 2019 She was 45 minutes late for the appointment  My experience at other clinics is that they just kept trying more of the same even when things weren't workingRMA also has seamless coordination with its lab, which I did not find to be the case at other centers  I called the pharmacy twice that day to see if they sent the clomid  I sent a version of this letter to ALL of the other doctors at RMA and have never received a response  The rest of their staff however, specifically billing is below standard  They also hardly answer their phoneThis place caused many sleepless nights  I later found out that Dr Copperman fought for my insurance company which represents city workers (teachers, firefighters, police officers) because he believed that those people deserved the support Because they have several offices, I was able to go to a more convenient location except for when I needed to see my specific doctor which is a major plus for me They are some of the most sought after doctors and staff in the New York metro area  We were probably there for 2 hours It was only after going to another clinic that we found out ivf was indeed covered by our insurance and that all I needed was a letter of medical necessity due to male infertility This place is a factory, move onIn the past two years, on  at least three different occasions they billed me for services and fertility treatments I never had on dates I never even went to their office But RMA can bill for them- so they advocate for them and do them And they have done the same thing to many other patients (read the other reviews on yelp) Drs are good but the staff is irresponsible, often overbook appointments and you end up waiting forever  I felt they were rooting for me every step of the way  Every dr has a different doctoring style, so some personalities and styles meshed more with my needs Very organized and professional Was on upper east side but I went to Soho office for daily monitoring Also, Saturday monitoring wait is a bit long and I don't think I needed as many blood test as I did  They are not accommodating and overcrowded  DO NOT GO  Every single phone call of mine was returned promptly by the nurses the same day that I called, even on the weekends"  I was pregnant within 10 weeks of my first appointment  It wasn't a particularly touchy-feely experience, but I wasn't looking for touchy-feely, I was looking to get pregnant They said I needed a referral from my doctor and blood tests for infectious diseases  I called over and they said they never received them Called me own doctor who confirmed they were faxed Called them back and they said they didn't have them  They did and found the fax So when I came in for an IUI, they didn't tell the nurse that I was there and I had the sample for a LONG timeWhen working with the team at RMA, I found that I always received prompt attention, whether that be on the phone (weekday and even on weekends), when speaking with nurses and being seen They were always reliable in calling back with results when they said they wouldThis  review is only for the office staff not the physicansI went here last week for a consultation and it was truly  an awful experience Very confidentialoh they also made a women with a child move to a different waiting room simply bcs she had a child and it wasn't rght to be around people without any After  a 45 minute wait I saw dr grunfeld If u want to feel like ur in a factory and don't want personal care, then by all means go here I have never seen such attentive medical stuff elsewhere Have to wait weeks for simple lab results email All you are is a person with a dollar sign attached and they will find ways to maximize whatever money they can get out of you From the nurse to the receptionist to billing They can't handle the patients they have now  There was one nurse I found cold, but she was absolutely the exception You're in and out and are not always seen by the doctor (although you are still largely seen by the same 3-4 people) The office is unorganized and it's impossible to get someone on the phone I have NEVER even posted a review on yelp

Dr Stein and his practice came highly recommended from my husband's (MD) colleagues- and it's hard to argue with his amazing success rates! After months of trying to conceive unsuccessfully, and in light of my husband beginning chemotherapy and my history of endometriosis, Dr Stein went over all of our options in great detailWe are so grateful for Dr Flisser, Ariel Schnur, and the team at RMA for our healthy pregnancy - due May 2020 We thankfully had success in our second round of IVFChose RMA after researching their high success rates & we had success after one IVF cycle (about 5 months total start to finish) with Dr Stein After my egg retrieval, I was informed that all of my eggs had been fertilized because the sperm seemed good (even though it had yet to be examined) They used completely different medications, timing, etc and she had great results (8 eggs)I had 19 eggs under treatment, and was initially excited  We highly recommend Dr Stein and RMANY!!! I'm so happy that we went to RMA I can not recommend them enough I'm 41 and we where successful on our first IVF attempt with Dr Lekovich We are so glad we were recommended and chose Dr Lekovich I should have seen the warning signs when after my first successful IVF, he told me not to implant the embryo but to do a second round of IVF so I could bank embryos and freeze them (paying even more money to RMA)Is this a pill mill, but for fertility drugs?I didn't have a known fertility issue but was ready to start planning to conceive and was open to taking a treatment of some sort to speed things up I ended up getting pregnant on my own shortly after I left there, likely because I had a better sense of my ovulation cycle for which I can thank them I never felt pressured to do anything I did not want to do I highly recommend it! She overlooked measles and rubella bloodwork as well as hormones day 3 which i brought and that bloodwork was made on actual day 3 and on another day right before the appointment Back in 2015 he helped me conceive my first baby (which I'm very thankful ) This morning I went to RMA for an ultrasound because I'm currently having an ectopic pregnancy (from a frozen transfer with Dr Stein)  I highly recommend going to this practice!  While IVF is highly scientific, there is also an art/skill in the protocol and timings, and I felt that Dr Copperman took all of my history into regard and adjusted the protocols etc as we went through to try to deliver the best outcome, and even listened to my input The nurse told me over the phone she would send clomid to my pharmacy and I had to go the next day for bloodwork  to make sure my thyroid levels dropped She got pregnant with twins on the first try there, didn't have to lose weight (shes heavier than me) and has alot of medical issuesI am not writing this because I am unhappy with the unsuccessful results of my treatment over two IVF cycles; I came into the IVF process at almost 40 years old eyes wide open that it very well could not work Fast forward to almost a year later, when I received a voicemail from RMA letting me know that "my free year of cryo preserve was up  I would highly recommend RMANY and Dr Flisser He saw us through a chemical pregnancy, an ectopic pregnancy, a break because of that ectopic pregnancy, and finally another pregnancy this past March! I am currently 26 weeks pregnant with a healthy baby boy  After 1 year of being bedridden and 2 surgeries my body was finally ready to have have kids Dr Klein who did my embryo transfer was also great I also froze my eggs so i will definitely go back for my second baby  I only used the service once (March 2013-May 2013), and we were very lucky to have a baby boy (now he is 9 months old and very healthy) I really wish I had known to cancel that cycle My TSH ideally would be below 2 We found a great IVF doc through Cornell and sticking with him  However, as I continued my treatment, I began to realize it is actually a well oiled machine  I truly believe I would not have babies right now had it not been for him and his expertise When we wanted the dr Overall I recommend to use them On the second IUI, we got a POSITIVE pregnancy result for the first time ever!!!!! I am only 4 weeks pregnant, but all seems to be going well I'm so happy that I was able to conceive!  I'm now in my second trimester and wouldn't hesitate to return if and when I decide to have more children I contacted them in order to have my sperm frozen (cryopreservation) for use with a donated egg & surrogate I almost did IVF and I'm so glad I didn't I'm glad I didn't They have done this 1 million times and this is why they have the success that they do After a year of IUIs, we ended up doing IVF and have been successful after the first try - hooray! There were some bumps in the road however The IVF coordinator was nice, but needed a lesson in controlled expectations: she told us three separate times that we were "ready to go" only to be told that day that our insurance hadn't approved us, or that the IVF lab was closed during the month that we were supposed to go through the process  After a recommendation from my friend and then another random recommendation from my mother's coworker   Their "one size fits all" approach to fertility patients probably cost me a pregnancy"  Oh, the one that I specifically ASKED about removing BEFORE we DID the embryo transfer?  Then, the IVF coordinator was basically like "OK, time to try again, let's start getting you ready!"  No, thank you I wish that these doctors saw me as more than a uterus and a checkbook But after over a year of ttc and learning every possible treatment available for my condition (PCOS), I no longer needed my hand held  Also include acupuncture as well along with any fertility treatment

My pregnancy and baby has been healthy every step of the way and we couldn't be happier, or more grateful and we can't wait to meet our little oneI had ordered donor sperm and talked with the nurses and the Dr about fertilizing half of my eggs and then pausing to see how they developed (because we were unsure of the sperm quality)" We hadn't been consulted before this decision was made and I'm still disappointed that this occurred One of my girlfriends who went to you for egg storage had terrible results of 1 egguntil I did further reading and found out that that number was considered a stretch for my age, and a less aggressive protocol may have produced fewer, but healthier eggsLastly, I have had both a pain and numbness in my right hip ever since the prescribed intramuscular self injections Self administered injections are stressful enough This was in my opinion, bad practice He was able to get me pregnant after 5 1/2 years of trying with no success We used Dr Copperman and I can't recommend him enough If I had practiced the same, I would have no patients I ended up going here for a couple of months and then stopped  I suffer from PCOS and have been struggling to get pregnant for a few years I guess I do not look like $$$$$$$$ sign anymore  I had!  Over the next months, Dr Flisser tailored my fertility plan both to minimize my chronic pain, and to prepare for a healthy baby They ran blood test and put me on thyroid medication and told me to contact them when I lost the 16 pounds I lost the weight in 1 monthRound 1 of IVF at RMA in January 2017 was unsuccessful"   I am sure that you can imagine my confusion since as far as I was concerned there was no viable embryo and nothing to freeze    What a horrible thing to do to someone who still three years later has not gotten pregnant   I asked multiple other physicians and not one agreed with what he was doing  If  I had not been lucky enough to switch to Dr Copperman, I might have given up and not have had the most perfect baby boy Didn't push IVF right away since we had no known issue but instead tried other methods first that were less invasive I had suffered from pcos and on my first try I achieved a pregnancy I feel frustrated a year later after going through all this, but I've come out an expert and will not be taking any more fertility meds which seem to cause stress to my thyroid No explanation providedI'm not even bitter at the fact that all three IVF's were unsuccessful, just bitter that no one told us what was REALLY going on Furthermore there is no evidence behind doing these procedures and they can potentially harm the embryos I've heard that for IVF they take things more seriously as the other preliminary treatmentsI can't recommend RMA, and specifically Dr Copperman, highly enough  No one at RMA told me that The stress the latter two cause is enough to keep you from getting pregnant I stopped going for a few months and have been so much less stressed that I would never go back A fight erupted It costed me quiet some neuronal tissue, but that was the only problem  Regretted my decision too far in to the process to changeAfter 2 years of dealing with infertility, 5 IUI's, 2 miscarriages and a million tears "  After so many disappointments with IUI's we decided to start immediately with IVF The practice is a pain to deal with  After two miscarriages with my A+++ embryos, they weren't even going to explore why and try to identify the problem before moving on with the next procedure  I just signed my consent forms to destroy my remaining embryos Full disclosure, after multiple cycles, I am not pregnant, and I'm sure that that colors my opinion Unfortunately, I want a baby so badly that I will probably continue to subject myself to this When I was discharged, it was bittersweet, as I was pregnant with twins, but this meant my time here was done  I was specifically told to inject for 3 nights in a row, and on the 5th day (ie: no injection the night prior) to come in for ultrasound and labwork, which was today  Then I am told after the fact that I shouldv'e injected last night and then told it was MY "misinterpretation" that screwed up the schedule  I stopped going back But after multiple disappointments I have decided to make my first review because I feel so strongly about this

As per his recommendation, we decided to pursue IVFI'm at 36 weeks of pregnancy from an IVF embryo and transfer, all done at RMA NY We had to do three rounds of retrieval cycles before we could move forward with an embryo transplant, so I was there on and off for about 6 months  I am now 25 weeks pregnant with a baby girl due July 2020  Once I got my thyroid levels under control, I was put on letrozole and got a shot of Ovidrel, and it worked!  I did not go through IUI or IVF We our persistence & Dr Grunfeld expertise, we got pregnant and had twin girls  We plan to use RMA when we try for a second child in the future Dr Bar-Chama spent months with my husband, evaluating multiple sperm samples, taking multiple ultrasounds of his testes, putting him on months of expensive medication She then examined my husband and immediately found varicocoele, which had resulted in a shrinking of the testes and therefore greatly reduced fertility We spent nearly a year at RMA trying to understand the infertility issues and were never given a reason At the doctor's the other day, I learned that I have hit the sciatic nerve I was on the thyroid medication on recommendation from Dr Flisser when we got pregnant with our first baby (after an earlier miscarriage a year prior)We went through three rounds of IUI and one round of IVF with Dr Stein this year Bull, RN, BSN We had our initial consultation with Dr Kimberley Thornton at the Soho clinic and subsequent visits at the Eastside location for blood-work, ultrasounds, and intrauterine inseminationAfter 3 miscarriages, I decided that it was time to see a fertility doctor In the first set of tests they found out I had a thyroid issue, sent me a prescription and referred me to an endocrinologist I did not pursue further testing and shortly after my thyroid got to normal levels I was able to get pregnant and stay pregnant I give this place an A++ She explained that her first patient took longer than she expected and she was late all day long  I went through an IVF cycle and on the first transfer got pregnant I contacted RMA on CD1  Round 2 of IVF at RMA was in May of 2017 we had one embryo which would be sent for genetic testingAt this point I knew that regardless of the disappointing results, clearly RMA was not the right practice for meAfter finalizing the cryo preserve issue I thought the RMA nightmare was over I have PCOS and my husband also has some male factor issues We started with non medicated IUIs and eventually moved to medicated IUIs  My last straw was him telling me to get a gastric bypass after saying my blood and hormone levels were normal My TSH was 37 before triggering & later I read that it is very unlikely to get pregnant with such a TSH TSH can take weeks to get back under control Since he had a vasectomy from a previous marriage we needed to get around a roadblock, as it were why we couldn't get pregnant)I am a patient of Dr Sandler I went for my second ultrasound and saw Dr Jovana Lekovich I am new to fertility treatments  2 years later, I get a third bill when I have moved on to another doctor and have vowed never to use this practice againI've gone to six infertility institutions At almost 42 I had 2 high grade embryos after 1 cycle of IVF We had also tried NYC IVF (Dr Azim) & his Gramercy IVF lab This is actually the reason why we ended up having subpar thawed sperm for our first IUI at SHER (b/c it had been stored at Gramercy IVF before being transferred to Sher A year later and a baby later! I will be working with him again  Then when I spoke with someone she told me that any sperm I donated that day couldn't be used for the egg/surrogate because I needed a physical first, which they couldn't do that day I knew that IUI was not going to take and I was totally right I'm talking boobs out and skirts raised high I decided to switch Fertility doctors I met with Dr Sandler in January  I My husband and I both went through a lot of tests (tests that hadn't been preformed for the past 2 years at another "replicable nyc fertility clinic  We started with the IVF classes in January PCOS, Ovulation issues, etc 5 days later my transfer  And after I miscarried twice with donor eggs, I simply couldn't believe the response:  "it's probably the adenomyosis you have My husband and I are now pushing $25,000 as we look to start our third cycle, all out-of-pocketFinally, I am taking injection meds this round  I did just that, and when the nurse called me just now to tell me to continue my current dose,  i asked "wait, i was only instructed to take it for 3 nights  The way this med works is that its a daily injection  We are both in our mid 40s and the chances of conceiving were and are very low  Fingers crossed

Thank you for helping us start our family And very kind We did get some wildly incorrect information about our out-of-pocket costs from the young woman we spoke to in the finance department (she told us everything would be covered but we ended up owing about $8,000 per cycle for drug costs), but it seems she was let go soon after our conversation (unrelated to us, but I am guessing she did this to others) and the finance supervisor was really great about working with us to come up with a payment plan I asked for a Temporary # and it was fine thereafter Dr Thornton is kind and was upfront with us Her absent mindness caused billing my fertility benefits for the same procedure on top of that, i received a bill for 10% of what my insurance paid  I had been recommended to RMA by my doctor and others originally, but at the time they did not accept my insurance Since we didn't have 25k lying around, and RMA kept adding charges to our total that weren't told to us up front (despite repeatedly asking what our end total would be so we could plan), we put off the process for about 3 months while we tried to figure out what to do We haven't paid anything this second round  RMA is basically a corporation that just wants money  I recommend Neway They were clear with expenses and protocol The staff pays attention, and the follow up is great The doctors were so rude & they treated us like cattle! Stay away from RMA!!! Sher institute takes GHI IN NETWORK!!!! We only had to pay a copay for IUI & had we needed to do an IVF, it would have been covered except for $1,500 upfront They couldn't tell me how much it would cost,  I had a great deal covered by insurance, but when I kept asking questions it turned out that it could still turn out to be quite expensive" So we got emergency help from a family friendAgree with everything said about it being all about the $$$ she saved me thousands upon thousands of dollars by finding an alternative to Follistim that was covered by my insuranceHad a great experience with RMAI cannot agree more with the other review about the HORRID customer service

They will call and make sure they get paid and threaten to cancel everything  unless they are paid in full My insurance paid generously for this horrible service that i received  Firstly, I know most reviews cannot help but be influenced by the outcome, and I am the sameI went to NYC RMA last month and saw DrFlisser who told me I had to lose 16 pounds before he would start treatment I said well Drflisser told me I needed to lose 16 pounds to start treatment My insurance covers EVEYTHING, and I refuse to have my money given to a practice that deceives patients   Low and behold my husband and I just received a notice from our insurance company regarding a claim submitted from RMA for $10k for my first round of IVF in January of 2017   Of course, this had been paid long ago but the RMA billing office resubmitted it a second time  RMA decided that my insurance plan would no longer be In Network, yet never notified me  I have been on this scary fertility roller coaster for about three years now I believe they didn't want to go through insurance so they could get all of the money up front from usTerrible service and dubious business practices! They sent me bills for things I had already paid for Customer service sucks It was dropped by my insurance, so I have since stopped going to this doctor RMA was the last and worst The billing is beyond terrible They did unnecessary procedures on my embryos (like genetic testing and ICSI) which were denied by the insurance company because I am low risk and never needed these  Nurses have not compassion and booking charges you and if you don't pay attention you would pay the bill without realizing that it should have been covered by insurance Avoid RMA at all costs The woman from there called me and talked that my insurance won't cover medicines, and it would cost me over 8K to pay them myself And no I wasn't in for fertility issues just routine (and paid in cash) egg freezing The billing staff made mistake after mistake with insurance  For a year and a half I paid out of pocket for an injection that was covered under a different name the whole time!In February, I had my first IVF retrieval It gives medicine and healthcare a bad name  Tens of thousands of dollars wasted  I was surprised by all the negative reviews"  Actually, paying $128 for an Rx that I will need on a monthly basis IS a big deal, especially if it is covered by my insurance and the reason Im not getting it is because this office is not thorough and hasn't mailed the Rx after repeated requests "Oh sorry it was our mistake" is what I was told Forget about it

We had access to a nutritionist and a counselorI write as an IVF donor I've spent 45 minutes max and 20 at the least here (** in total, which includes wait times for gynecologists post bloodwork and any Q&A) He ordered a series of expensive tests which were not covered by insurance and kept asking me to use donor eggs even though I produced Grade AA embryos  When we first came to RMA, my insurance was In-Network  Fast forward 6 months later and my bills from RMA were much higher than before  I've also been seen with Dr Joshua U  They only see you as a cash cow!! GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!! Then we sat down with the finance person who told us bc my husband had been voluntarily sterilized insurance wouldn't cover anything Not one test or anything was ever submitted to insurance to even see if this was confirmedIf there was an option for ZERO stars that is what I would give RMA  After a year and a half of IUIs and IVF, I finally left 2 years ago) Therefore, stay away from storing specimens at Gramercy IVF  Nor did they tell me about myriad other costs that would have been involved in terms of genetic testing, etc I am STILL getting bills for random items, dating all the way back to Feb "Insurance won't cover the visit Everything has a system and it works He was all over the placeanywhere else after two months of making payments! Literally The next thing we get is a collections notice I have been charged twice for the supposedly yearly fee of freezing the embryos ($1,000, so no small amount), and because my insurance does not cover everything that they do, they don't submit ANYTHING to my insurance, even bills for those procedures that are clearly medically necessary and would be covered I can't believe it  It worked for us In fact I was sent a bill and had to call to inquire as to why and to find out that they did not apply my insurance Nor do I read reviews
No Reviews

Clinic_name: Weill Cornell Medicine - Center for Reproductive Medicine
Reviews: Not only is he empirically and statistically successful in what he does, he is kind, caring, patient, respectful, trustworthy, incredibly empathetic and is exactly who you want to care for you during this highly complicated and emotional processI have yet to be successful in my IVF journey and am going in for my 3rd round, Dr Chung is the only reason I continue to have optimism for this process  He and his team are so wonderful that I truly look forward to my appointments Dr Schattman was AMAZING I was really nervous, but had the absolutely best outcome I explained my situation and said they would need to get special approval from the doctor himself OMG - was he unfamiliar with the meaning of "second opinion"? If he didn't want to accept a patient looking for a second opinion, he could have a) said so to begin with, or b) said so at the first totally unnecessary sales pitch meeting, or c) not suggested making an appointment for the exam, or EVEN d) expressed his so very helpful post-exam opinion before doing the exam! What is this, a used car lot?5 But as long as my needs are met then I'm satisfied   By contrast, I went to Johns Hopkins reproductive endrocrinology for several months, never had to wait an hour for an appointment, never had other patients' birthdates revealed to me, had my blood taken when fully dressed, and billing was extremely clear I went ahead to other doctors in NYC like Sher Fertility, but friend recommended New Hope fertility clinic and I was successful on the 1st try!

Clinic_name: Weill Cornell Medicine - Center for Reproductive Medicine
Reviews: Appointments were rushed and felt impersonal, the doctors failed to diagnose us correctly and I experienced a terrible medical mishap which could have been avoided  At one point we changed our insurance during treatment and decided to use a different doctor who is in network, we were told if we make this change we can never go back to the previous doctor which was strange and felt like a threat Since I stopped seeing them I've gone to another clinic (Sher fertility! You don't need to PM me! I'm telling you right here!), had two rounds of IVF, gotten pregnant, HAD A BABY, and begun to raise him My doctor was always rushed; I never felt comfortable asking questions b/c he was literally always running out the door (probably to deal with the 100+ women sitting in the waiting room) I also ran into him outside the office on the street, he had no idea what my name was after seeing me that long However had one of the worst experiencesThe whole experience with Weil Cornell was terrible , unfortunately

Clinic_name: Weill Cornell Medicine - Center for Reproductive Medicine
Reviews: But women's health care needs to advance so that the patients pain level is taken into considerationDr Chung also manages a team who carries his same philosophy throughout every step of the process Never a smile, completely ignoring questions and acting as if they do not hear you, talking down at patients and made me feel like I was interrupting their day with my appointment and am a huge inconvenience A year of treatment and I found myself having to remind him about specifics of my case I get there and the doctor basically starts doing intake as if I was going to do IVF with him I stopped him mid-way and said I'm here for this second opinion, and he said well of course he can give a second opinion, but he has nothing to look at Note this is AFTER I told him what day in the cycle I was At my "regular" reproductive endo, I've never waited longer than about 20 minutes, and that was once or twice out of many many visits

Clinic_name: Weill Cornell Medicine - Center for Reproductive Medicine
Reviews: All I know is I won't be going back for any reason and  if you are willing to endure this then it is  a clean prestigious medical facilityDr Pak Chung at Weill Cornell Reproductive Center is hands down the best fertility doctor in NYC  He is immensely patient and will answer all of your questions with pure medical objectivity, no matter how small or redundant, until you are satisfied  Or find a good malpractice attorney because you probably will have some use for one These are the same people who stick a needle into you so I never said anything, but I regret it and I hope someone from Weill Cornell reads my review Please save yourself the heartache and just don't go here I review them on Yelp as well I know how tough it is finding a good clinic, and I wish you all the luck in the world  Don't expect to get personalized care and attention hereWonderful experience Treated youlike a person and not a patient They are one of the best in the world, if not the best They said I should keep the appointment because the doctor would want to have background I tell him what day I am in the cycle, and he says well, let's take a look - and then after the exam, he says he couldn't see anything because it's the wrong part of the cycle So then I go back (why? why?) at the right part of the cycle, and he says "why are you here if you're not doing IVF with me?" and I'm like because I asked you for an opinion on this growth, and you said to come back and you would do the exam?!?  He then goes, of course, I'm a doctor and I can give you an opinion on this - and then AFTER he does the exam says, practically anyone can look at this thing and remove it if it needs to be removed, so you should just go back to your doctor So try a few places and see what's best  NPs or PAs  will do your iuis  Doctors are so rush, hey have basically 3 minututes to measure your follicules and just want to have this quickly done and go to the next patient without explaining if they have the time As stated before, you won't see your Dr as much as you hope; so the nurse attending you can make this a good or terrible experience  Invoices mixing dates, then cancelled, then active again and the treat to send you to collection even discussing the same date the invoices are processed Don't waste your time like me  So single women beware: Cornell Reproductive Medicine thinks that if you are single, you are more likely to be (1) a drug addict; (2) of low moral character; (3) indigent; and/or (4) psychologically unbalanced due to the mere fact that you seek to do the most natural thing in the world - conceive your own biological child without being married or in a relationship at that moment in time

Clinic_name: Weill Cornell Medicine - Center for Reproductive Medicine
Reviews: I asked if it would hurt  He is so hands on that he will personally call you at every pivotal step of your process and will continue to call if he cannot get ahold of you, which surprisingly isn't standard protocol  I have never been rushed out of his care nor encouraged to make a decision that is not the best for me emotionally or financially  No one should endure this process without a doctor like Dr ChungCouldn't agree more with what Anna said- her review is spot on It's a tough place to be when you have to pursue this type of treatment Incredibly emotional, draining (mentally, physically and financially) and dealing with Cornell just makes an already difficult and stressful process even more difficult and stressful Unfortunately they refused to see me stating if I wasn't trying to get pregnant I can't come to the office It's a little tough to get a hold of a doctor  No case is alike Way too many patients Go to RMANY I switched and couldn't be happier  In the meantime, my other treatments are postponed because I can't bring the medical records If I missed the call, forget it  That's a HIPAA violation, I'm fairly certainThe place is a "hit or miss" but sooner or later the anguish is so real I went to see doctor Glenn Schattman after unsuccessful IVF with other clinic"  If you answer "no," you are required to see a staff psychiatrist/psychologist at your own expense before proceeding with any type of attempts to get pregnant at Cornell  Of course when you meet with the psychiatrist/psychologist she pretends that's not the reason, and to "reassure" you states that she is not there to determine if you will be a good parent, but rather, to veto your attempt to conceive at Cornell only if she learns you are a drug addict or of similar bad moral character  In addition, all forms you fill out next to your name list "male partner" or "partner", including legal forms that require you to decide what to do with your sperm vials if you die - the choices are to give them to your spouse / partner or medical research

Clinic_name: Weill Cornell Medicine - Center for Reproductive Medicine
Reviews: ( I thought it might be like a pap smear or a cervical biopsy which is quick and it is only mildly painful if you get a good doctor But since it is my experience with this I need to post it so you will know what you are getting yourself intoIf I could give them zero stars I would  Find someone else for your healthcare needsI spent a year at Cornell doing various procedures You can never reach your doctor Don't expect to get a lot of stats If you go on BBC, you'll see you don't have information that other women going through cycles have  Stay away!!! And complications are rare I pointed out I wouldn't have anything for him to look at - they said go ahead and keep the appointment Are you kidding me Not a doctor 2- You can't set up an appointment digitally, you can't communicate via email and you can't receive your medical results onlinePlease avoid  At the end of the appointment, the computer screen next to the examining table showed a list of 10 patients and their birth dates We will never use Cornell for anything else in our lifeMoney hungry doctors! Enough said  Fast forward to 2013: even though you are required to designate your marital status on the intake form, the doctor still asks you if you are in a "long-term relationship" or "relationship  the majority of clients are white due to population demographics, however they don't list "white male partner" just to be representative of the majority

Clinic_name: Weill Cornell Medicine - Center for Reproductive Medicine
Reviews: But they said I could not! So much of women's health care is behind the times and lacks any direct care of the woman as a feeling whole individual  Every single person on his staff from his nurses (Juliana), to his billing dept (Arlene), to his assistants (Joy & Alice), are smart, helpful, diligent and always have a positive attitude The nurses were great  Our nurse (Jackie) was fantastic

Clinic_name: Weill Cornell Medicine - Center for Reproductive Medicine
Reviews: Call in all meds at start of cycle and my Ivf coordinator, the billing department AND doctor responded to all my questions via email or phone within hours! Way less stressful, which is what you need during this very difficult process! For those of us with demanding jobs, not fun at all

Clinic_name: Weill Cornell Medicine - Center for Reproductive Medicine
Reviews: One week I called 15 times and received little response

Clinic_name: Weill Cornell Medicine - Center for Reproductive Medicine
Reviews: ) (because otherwise why don't they give pain killers?)The doctor who performed it said it only feels like "a pinch", you don't need anesthesia Maybe all medical centers who do this biopsy do it without pain killers It is probably the best of it's kind  I can't tell you how nice it is to be surrounded by people who actually want to be helpful in this process!  This, in any industry, is highly abnormal  Their OR facilities look like a bus stop that hasn't been updated in 50 years I am not sure where they came from but they acted more like drill sergeants rather than health care professionals They definitely need sensitivity training or a punch in the face[Just gonna put this up at the top here because I keep getting PMs about it: the clinic that eventually helped me have a baby was Sher Institute They are very nice there and never made me cry Seriously, avoid!(And, for a third time, the clinic where I later had success was Sher Institute of Reproductive Medicine You're just a number It's absurd they still operate like this when any other clinic supports electronic communication Sure, they have good stats, but it's just not worth it ALL of the nurses were super kind and caring I have an amazing baby boy and we owe it all to CRM!Everyone I worked with was caring and compassionate The upside of them treating a lot of women is that they have seen it all and likely know exactly which protocol is best for you Good at making you feel stupid and like a trespasser It was a misery all around, which came as a surprise because I know several women who had successful pregnancies here I said to the ladies behind the desk, is this normal for appointments to run late, and they said, yes - totally normal to wait up to a *couple* hours I have friends who went to other places that's also "the best" and did not get pregnant Went here because they are rated one of the best in the country Like other reviews I was referred to a collection agency because i had not paid a bill I had literally called 6 times about! They billed me for an out of doctor and no one could give me an answer just "we are not sure where the mistake occurred" they said they would investigate and call me back but never did! I'm still getting new bills from August and it is now mid May -You can't reach your doctor by phone; you can only leave a message to an assistant and, if you called early morning and if you are lucky enough, you may receive a call back from a nurse or an assistant the same day but never from a doctor I had about 10 tests within a month and, eventually had to pay $300 our of my pocket (while it would have been free at many other places)- Two times they made a mistake in taking the right blood test First, my primary care doctor sent a request (mid-June), then I did it on 7/15 Twice they told me that a person responsible for my request was not in the office and asked to call back the next dayThere is clearly a big miscommunication among the staff, nurses and doctors Overall, the place need a much better training among their staffsThey are good only for research, not to treat a real time patient, plus you will never get A doctor, instead will be seen by everybody, which will

Clinic_name: Weill Cornell Medicine - Center for Reproductive Medicine
Reviews: Well if someone "pinched" the doctor who said that in the same way with the same amount of pain he would be screaming in pain and crying for it to stop! Infertile women are sometimes willing to endure whatever torture they have to to get that coveted baby prizeWeill Cornell Reproductive Center was the worst decision my husband and I ever made Staff was downright rude and even aggressive definitely making a stressful situation even more stressful Meanwhile I was still getting mail from Weill Cornell asking me to donate money to their Reproductive Center, patheticTheir billing department is a mess and their nurses don't reply your callsThey are thieves and crooks and, even worse, ineffective You can only call and leave a message and you better be waiting by your phone (I literally took my phone into bathroom stalls like a freak for fear of missing calls with follow up instructions) - because you will never get anyone to call you back The worst aspect is their billing department They are totally incompetent and ruthless vulturesUnfortunately we have to Echo the comments of  the other reviewersCame here because of the doctor rating (the doctors are very good) but the staff seems to be skilled at finding new ways to make a stressful process even more nerve rackingI can't say that there has been poor communication as there really has not been any! What's  the point of a coordinator who never reaches out,  helps you with next steps, etc Oh, and some of them are also rude,  so there's that tooA waste of time and money on all fronts!- Always long lines- You can't reach your doctor even if you have an emergency- My insurance covers lab tests, but their blood tests were not covered because they don't send your tests to a lab - they do them in-house! Nobody ever explained me that They have a poor customer service and they don't care about their patients at all I really like the doctors (hence 2 stars), but dealing with their incompetent administrative assistants is a grueling experience and causes all sorts of problems in actually getting treated No one would call me with the results of procedures and next steps I would call and leave messages and then maybe a day or two later they would call me back I personally will choose a more profesional and experienced place as people in cornell just dont really care about personal situation Also you do feel like a big factory, nurses are ok, assistant nurses doing the daily blood IV seems to hate their job and looked in a bad mood all the times Reception at persons were clearly the worse ( one named Rose was extremely rude)Just a place that makes a lot of mistakes that will cost you money and time, which sometimes the infertility patients font have much leftThey seem highly competent, but their practice epitomizes everything wrong with American medicine  No one could tell me what the implications were Their billing department is THE WORST; an incompetent money machine who will charge you several times for the same procedures/visits then mixing and matching dates and creating more stress than even the actual proceduresCornell Center for Reproductive Medicine are stuck in the 1980s' mentality when according to them single women were mostly poor, drug addicts, or out of their mind  Apparently, single women don't have parents / siblings or other significant persons who they could designate to make these decisions for them in the event of their death  Again, Cornell Reproductive Medicine pretends single women are not its clients (while 36% of all births are by single women in the U in 2012), discriminates against those single women that are its clients, and makes them feel unwelcome and abnormal by designing forms as if single women or lesbian women do not exist and are never their clients  That's how you know it's insensitivity, exclusionary, and discriminatory

Clinic_name: Weill Cornell Medicine - Center for Reproductive Medicine
Reviews: I was sent here by my doctor for a biopsy This is a very prestigious medical center with the highest level of technology and the most educated physicians They also do the most complete job of testing that I have had at any hospital! The tests they did were very extensive and complete They rule out everything so you will get a diagnosis here if you need  one So it is not unique to this center There was a new batch of nurses who started working there a few months into our treatment They seemed unhappy at their job and definitely took it out on the patients We waited to start our treatment with the new doctor at Weill Cornell based on the insurance information which was provided to us by the Reproductive Center, only to find out that the new doctor doesn't take our insurance after all and is out of network However, they are still a fertility clinic so they will still send you giant billsUnlike most clinics, they don't do anything electronically, hence why you have to stalk your phone Or call them repeatedly There is not a lot of transparency in their processes After going to another center for a while I finally came across CRM Can't rave enough about them and I have other places to compare them tooMy doctor in Florida used to work at this office They said they would call me back It's been about 5 months and I haven't heard back I've decided I'll just see someone else When I got the EOB and bill, it said that the doctor was not an in-network doctor In all of this, the wait time at the place was an hour each time They call you everyday and write back immediately when you have questions  Everyone has their own experiences , and everyone is different  Not until I switched to RMA and a coordinator sat with me and I found out I just had to do mail away3 They took it once, and then a  few minutes later (while I was still there waiting for the u/s), said they had to take more blood They do not use Weil Connect (the rest of the Medical center does)- It's been a month since I'm waiting for my medical records Now they are saying they are waiting for a doctor's signature to release the recordsI had the same experience as the other reviewers I have given up on this place and am now looking for a different doctor You can only call between 9 and mid-afternoon for the assistants, otherwise it goes to the on-call answering service  My appointment was at 9:30 am, so first thing in the morning, but I sat in the waiting room until 10:30 am  When they finally called me, they gave no apology or explanation They do have state of the art facility and all ultrasounds are done by doctors

Clinic_name: Weill Cornell Medicine - Center for Reproductive Medicine
Reviews: There was no cancer Since this is one of the top in the country I suspect they all do it without pain killersI went to Weil Cornell because wanted to get a second opinion on whether a polyp was worth removing before having IVFI got pregnant here on the first try and thought the experience was just fine  He was good, but definitely didn't remember me  Even if I called straight back 1min later, I wouldn't be able to reach anyone for another couple of days Boy, I did my research and thought they are the best He did analysis of my blood work and fallopian tubes confirming I am healthy 35 year old women Later, he said that I have low ovarian reserve and on the second attempt, he wants to put 4 eggs! I can't even imagine how dangerous it probably would have been if all would took My husband is 28 and we are both healthy

Clinic_name: Weill Cornell Medicine - Center for Reproductive Medicine
Reviews: org/wiki/En…Mine was to evaluate a suspected cancer However the biopsy was given to me without pain killers! I asked for pain killers they said no we don't give them for this procedure At that point we realized we were making a big mistake and we were just wasting our precious time and money, did our research and based on national SART information decided to go with RMA for further treatment We could not be happier with that decision, we were diagnosed a few weeks after our first visit to RMA and conceived a few months later  During my IVF cycle, I passed hands frequently to the point of receiving conflicting information on numerous occasions So for us we will switch to a place that doesn't waste our precious time I missed my window for getting the images I needed to take with me for the 2nd opinion, so I called to cancel the appointment I just have to circle back to #1 at this point - because it really came as adding insult to injury when I got the bill, showing that he's not even an in-network doctor  I'll only give 4 low-points  Everything in the middle showed that same low level of consideration, coming down to them asking me to take off my pants and cover myself with a flimsy paper sheet before taking my blood the anguish started After 3 months fights, we finally correct all with the "representative", now at the 4th month, they sent us another bill

Clinic_name: Weill Cornell Medicine - Center for Reproductive Medicine
Reviews: I need to start off by saying that I am not infertile and never was and did not  go here because of that He suggested when I move to the upper east side that I should come start seeing his old colleagues there Says to come back at the right part of the cycle In the second one, once we were done and pregnant However, he called me later and still suggested I do IVF! Why? I listen and went ahead spending thousands of dollars on medicines They retrieved 9 eggs and he suggested we put 3, but none of those took He also said that we probably need to go ahead with donor eggs  Why?  Because they cannot imagine how any single woman in her right mind would willingly attempt to conceive a child while she was single

Clinic_name: Weill Cornell Medicine - Center for Reproductive Medicine
Reviews: Juliana would go out of her way to help me find the best prices for my drugs and Arlene went above and beyond to help me sort out my billing with my insurance company I encountered every issue possible there - overpaying out of pocket, being double billed when I changed plans, being over treated (which resulted in excessive costs), misquoted prices, bills sent to collections when I had outstanding credit balances with them (for being overcharged for services insurance covered) I'm surprised I didn't get billed for the toilet paper I used when I peed there Seriously??? Luckily, my insurance denied this year and a half old claim At the time of appointment, they said they accepted my insurance What kind of gotcha is that, to say you take the insurance because technically, you can bill the insurance, but you're not actually an in-network provider?2

Clinic_name: Weill Cornell Medicine - Center for Reproductive Medicine
Reviews: But I have no such issue and this was unbearably painful!I would have gladly paid for some pain killers with cash  These clowns sent a debt collector after me for an $8 bill that I paid!   What they do is criminal  What a bunch of low life's Worst services ever! Don't ever go there!] Downgrading to one star because, more than a year after I stopped going there, I am STILL receiving bills from these jerksand these jerks are still sending me bills for tests they performed 16 months ago, that they claim my insurance wouldn't cover  I was already billed for this procedure and my insurance  paid the claim last June Worst place ever They will NOT help you out at all with insurance I paid out of pocket for many meds that were actually covered They made a mistake twice on ordering the incorrect quantity of medicines, which were cover by my insurances Because of their mistake, i had to pay an extra 500 usd at the pharmacy  for medicines that will have cost me 50 usd if ordered properly We had two IVFs, the first paid by the insurance while the second was paid by us (with some stuff paid by insurance)

Clinic_name: Weill Cornell Medicine - Center for Reproductive Medicine
Reviews: I don't know In April I am now receiving bills for services in NovemberI have not been to this clinic since June 2016 Just received an EOB from my insurance saying Cornell submitted a claim in October 2017 for $1500 for my HCG Billing is beyond a nightmare  Only one star for dr  So transparent about billing and potential costs   My insurance covers the doctor's services, but not the Center for Reproductive Medicine

As pleasant as fertility treatment can be: an opinion shared by my wife and me Dr Knopman treated us thoughtfully, explaining things clearly and tweaking things as needed to make sure we had the best results She is warm, caring and so positive He explained things in great detail and at no point, I felt confused about the process or about the next steps As an academic myself, this was very important to me, as I knew I didn't have time to read all the relevant scientific literature on the protocols and procedures we were about to experienceDr Levine is very well connected and has amazing contacts in the NYC area I recommended Dr Levine to everything I knew was struggling with fertility (at other clinics)Dr Choi reviewI found Dr Choi through a friend's rave recommendation, and I echo them after our experience We had been through a lot by the time we came to CCRM, as I'm sure is true for many fertility patients But not only was she sympathetic to our situation and history, what hit me most was her determination to get to the bottom of it and optimism for putting us in the best possible position for a success But we always found comfort in her straight-forward way of explaining things, and felt empowered because we were getting all the facts And I am happy to report we are well into a healthy pregnancy (fingers crossed)! I can't say enough about the staff, who was so prompt answering our many many questions Dr Levine's approach is based on the individual needs of each patient not the standard cookie cutter protocol not to mention the lab quality is the absolute best Even though we were not living locally, we experienced the excellent communication from the entire staff and amazing support from Dr Levine himself We were able to achieve success in his care After 2 unsuccessful cycle with another facility I reached out to Dr Choi she is the best,  kind, compassionate and she take her time to listen and is very theral which we loved First try with her and here i am 12 weeks pregnant! Am so happy we have you in the infertility world It started out great, I met with Dr Levine in their beautiful office after being referred by one of his friends who he went to medical school with My initial  impression was that he was slightly arrogant but maybe he was entitled to be- I mean this guy has a really impressive background and I wanted him to be my doctor I reiterated the importance of me not being able to miss a meeting with my CEO and asked if she could at least find out what Dr Levine needed, if it was urgent or if there was anyone else, (perhaps a nurse) that I could speak to instead There are no words to express my gratitude to Dr Knopman She was truly amazing; a true expert in her field, took her time explaining every single detail Having a tight work schedule myself, I appreciated the fact that CCRM always took me in on time; that rarely happens in other practicesApologies in advance for the long review, but my experience with Dr Levine and CCRM was so wonderful it deserves an essay: I can't express exactly how nervous I was to begin fertility treatment with a specialist He treated me warmly and compassionately from the moment I stepped into his office He spent over an hour with me discussing not only my case history, but who I was a person, what I liked to do during my free time, how I had been feeling about my fertility issues, etc However, the point of this post is to emphasize how wonderful my experience was throughout my journey at CCRM (which I know would have continued to be wonderful if that first IUI had not been successful, and I needed to proceed to more invasive procedures): Let's start with Dr Levine, who is honestly the BEST He takes the time to chat and catch up, and we spent just as much time talking about different exercise classes we liked, restaurant recommendations, and LIFE as we did my fertility issues This may seem silly, but it really changed the dynamic of my treatment from negative to positive I looked forward to my appointments with Dr Levine because they were so fun, and I left feeling happy, confident, and taken care of as an individual I remember receiving a call from him at 8pm, 2 minutes after I had e-mailed, when he was clearly in the middle of a family dinner I will also never forget receiving a call from Dr Levine at 1pm on a Saturday, in between cycles, just to say "Hey, how are you feeling about everything?" Even better than Dr Levine? His nursing staff I know CCRM sees a lot of patients, but I was floored every time they recognized me and greeted me by name When I found out I was pregnant, everyone at CCRM was so genuinely happy for me, and I got so many different forms of congratulationsThank you, Dr Levine and CCRM for everything! The incredible, compassionate work you do is so important and means the world to patients like me Our doctor, Dr Levine was incredible throughout the whole process, answering all of our many questions, being accessible via email and phone, and explaining everything (which i wanted)  Throughout the process i  met all of the other doctors (Dr Choi, Dr Knopman, and Dr Talebian) and they were all wonderful and kind! Instantly impressed at our first appointment, Dr Levine had already thoroughly researched , highlighted and took notes on our case Before even talking with us, he'd already discovered i was misdiagnosed previously and didn't take lightly how easy my case looked on paper being "young and healthy" He makes you feel comfortable every step of the way Also, to note, while Dr Talebian was not the Doctor I met with on day one, she took great care in my case as well and treated me as one of her own  Dr Levine was always praising his team, because they deserve it! We don't know how we could've done this without them THANK YOU TO THE VERY BEST THERE IS!  Dr Levine is the kindest, most caring doctor I have meet with He truly treats you like a human being and not another number  Dr Levine truly GETS how hard this journey is and is emphatic and human to guide you not just through the medical but also the emotional and mental aspects We were treated with love and respect at every visit and each appointment was timely and accommodating  Dr Levine made miracles happen and we are so grateful for him and his staff I went from feeling like cattle at a fertility farm to customized personal attention, and most importantly, problem solving Most of all, Dr Choi is brilliant, willing to take the time to understand your medical history and answer every question you have, and genuinely cares about her patients She is hands down the best doctor I have ever had CCRM certainly deserves one and I am so surprised I am the first one I am a 35 year old woman that began thinking about freezing my eggs this summer I made an appointment at CCRM NY as a friend who visited their Colorado branch recommended it to me My friend insisted that the place really has to make me feel good and at ease, if I was going to choose it for this procedure Dr Talabean did my retrieval and I trust her implicitly She was extremely honest and also prepared me for the recovery I am a very "difficult case" infertility-wise, and my doctor (Dr Brian Levine) was incredibly persistent and attentive and kept trying different protocols until we finally started getting good results  After speaking with friends who had gone through the IVF process, I was advised how important it was to find a lab and doctor with the data to back up their results  My blood pressure was sky high!  But within minutes Dr Levine and his ENTIRE staff put me and my mother at ease  I could simply go on and on about the care and medical attention I received by Dr Levine and his team  What was one of the most anxiety filled experience of my life actually ended up being one filled with true warmth and caring and honestly I sort of miss going there and seeing everyone everyday :)  The last bit I want to mention is that if it were not for this experience I also would not have discovered another medical situation and with Dr Levine's care I have been able to get treatment and feel SO fortunate that to this day I can still email him DIRECTLY and he will get back to me with either a phone call or email within hours  Never in my life have I received the attention and care that Dr Levine and CCRM's entire staff providesI wish I could more emphatically recommend Dr Levine because honestly my experience at CCRM and the practice he runs has been life changing for me Everyone from the front desk receptionists, to the nurses, to Dr Levine, made you feel like you were entering their living room rather than a doctor's office He is extremely intelligent (goes without saying), caring, compassionate and highly invested in his patients One of the BEST things about Dr Levine is how incredibly communicative he is When our time was up with Dr Levine I was truly saddened! I strongly urge anyone seeking fertility treatment to see Dr Levine  Ultimately, I felt like CCRM treated me like a walking blank check, bolstering a fear of the unknown to get me to opt into an expensive, out of pocket elective procedure I simply wanted to learn more about (and would have agreed to if I felt they actually cared about me)  I waited over 30 minutes to meet with the doctor, who was curt, a little vague on why certain tests were needed but very decisive that the elective procedure was a must, and quick to shuttle me off to the start of at least 5 staff members I would meet during my time there  Cost aside, while I applaud CCRM's efficiency, the lack of given time to process, understand my options and why certain things were needed, and digest what was happening felt very wrong There was not a single instance where I doubted Dr Choi's skills: her medical care was considered, skillful, and assured  And while incredibly impressive, it is the kindness, care, decency, and humanity of how she does what she does that sets Dr Choi apart from her peers Dr Choi, the healer, is a sterling human being whose ability to gently explain every aspect of the fertility process to her patients; to soothe and sympathize with her patients; to take care of her patients' emotions as much as their bodies, is deeply moving She is also incredibly attentive, following up consistently throughout the entire process and making sure I didn't have any questions and that everything was ok and that I had everything I needDr Brian Levine is responsible for my 3 1/2 year old daughter Willa, and after trying for almost 2 years at Cornell, luck found me in his capable hands again!I can not explain how discouraged, frustrated and just down I felt after my experience at Cornell ( if I was lucky I saw my dr once or twice a cycle) (He even gave me his cell phone number) We saw Dr Levine and he was able to diagnose our issues and set a clear course of action He was always incredibly personable, energetic and available for any and all questions that arose And he was able to help us get pregnant, which is of course the reason we were there in the first place! The entire staff is amazing -- everyone was warm, welcoming and very attentive to your personal situation Dr Choi did numerous tests, she leaves no stone unturned, and helped us decided on the best possible plan of action to reach our goals After our first appointment, we left feeling calm and excited about the path we had chosen It is very clear that everyone at CCRM is passionate about helping people, no is ever in a bad mood! Dr Choi was always available to us whenever we had questions or concerns and truly enjoys her work She is honest but optimistic, which we found very refreshing Dr Janet Choi is professional, thorough, compassionate, patient and kind -- all the key ingredients to help hormonal women going through a process that is putting our most treasured organs at possible risk They made me feel known and cared for every step of the way My results were very successful and I believe it was due to the thoughtful care and great communication of the entire staff, led by Dr Choi Dr Levine was my doctor but all of the staff and doctors knew me by first name and always showed a genuine interest in my progress and care Even after being discharged to an OB, Dr Levine continued to answer my questions without hesitation and in a very timely fashion It clearly shows that he loves his job and is very passionate about his workDr Levine has been absolutely wonderful to work with (he's kind, funny, patient and wise beyond his years, he remembers very detail and always makes time for me when I need to ask him something, I feel safe under his care and blessed to have found him), as is Amanda in billing (helpful and full of knowledge, answering my endless questions and helping me understand both insurance and self-pay matters to figure out what's best for me), Plus all of the nurses (especially Ali who has been supportive and nurturing like a sister), and the receptionists (Stephanie's/Kate who brighten up the phone lines and office)There are no words to express how lucky I feel to have been a patient of Dr Knopman and at CCRM Although I was at CCRM during a very difficult time in my life, the optimism, patience, compassion and kindness expressed by everyone there helped get me through it In particular, Dr Knopman was truly amazing and went above and beyond what I could expect from any doctor  At each step along the way, Dr Knopman was there to help me and to guide me through  Dr Knopman shows extraordinary attention to each patient and provides tailored and individualized care  He is extremely responsive to e-mails, phone calls, etc Egg freezing is a daunting and arduous process but he made it more than worthwhile, I felt completely supported throughout and I walked away with an even better result than I had expectedCCRM NY, and Dr Levine, in particular, have changed the way I think about my healthcare in general, and I will truly never be the same He was truly my advocate and we were partnered in my care Everything, absolutely everything, was customized to me as an individual human, from the protocols to the way we made decisions about my care He even considered psychological and emotional effects of certain decisions, and not just treatment by the numbers Even when another doctor (Dr Levine) was filling in to keep us on schedule, it was obvious they were in communication with each other and checking in behind the scenes Today is February 5th (over a month later) and I have yet to hear back from anyone at CCRM In my experience, CCRM's main concern is money, not their patients Everyone knew my name the second I entered their office All the nurses knew me and were kept informed as to where I was in the process Needless to say, I walked into CCRM in August and didn't check out any other hospital after that visit I got 24 and I was monitored the entire process  To summarize my situation, as a 36 year woman, I had seen an advertisement from a clinic (with reputable doctors) who catered primarily to women looking to preserve their fertility versus going through the full IVF process  The first step was to get some bloodwork done Sometimes, it all works out; sometimes, it doesn't You are in and out of there! Communication is a breeze with them It's the same thing with the nurses Being a patient at CCRM was a whole new game Each person at CCRM - from the doctors to the nurses to the technicians to the staff - is absolutely incredibleI first used another fertility clinic in NYC, but when I heard that CCRM was opening an office here, I switched immediately This place stands out above all the others that I researched

Because it was our first time seeing a RE, he started with a very thorough diagnosis procedure and recommended that we attempt IUI first, explaining to us the success rate of this procedure compared to the slightly more invasive IVF procedure After a few IUI attempts that were not working for us, he recommended that we move on to IVF, which we did, ultimately achieving success on our first embryo transferDr Levine performed my egg retrieval procedure, which was flawless As I developed thyroid issues early in my pregnancy he recommended a great list of endocrinologists that I could choose from, based on my health insurance coverage and preference He also recommended a long list of great OBGYNs at graduation and made sure I checked out to an OBGYN he trusted upon graduation (Take a pad and pen with you for notes!)I appreciated her thorough approach especially when it led to a discovery of a small growth in my pituitary  CCRM gave us hope that we had all but lost I don't blame CCRM for this outcome and I don't and didn't expect CCRM to work miracles They clearly know that I am no longer a viable IVF patient (their money-maker) I could provide other examples of why I believe this is true but it's not the point of my reviewMost importantly I got pregnant with the first IVF Cycle I left my first appointment with a clear plan: we would start as non-invasively as possible, with a timed intercourse cycle (including Letrazole and an Ovidrel trigger shot, to maximize our chances) Our first IUI was successful, and I am now 4 months pregnant with a baby girl!I was obviously thrilled with the outcome We were successful in our first ivf cycle at ccrm and are now 18 weeks pregnant Freezing my eggs and choosing CCRM is one of the best decisions I have ever made! Since I had so many eggs, my recovery was a bit more intense than if someone had only a few We now are 14 weeks pregnant, with additional healthy tested embryos preserved  While I had not yet made any decisions and was clear that I would not do so that day or be rushed into a commitment, most of the staff who met with me still assumed I was all in and tried to get treatments started and tests run, including ones I didn't understand the rationale behind I first met Dr Choi at Columbia a couple years ago when I had my eggs frozen I decided to stop moving forward with the process until I found a doctor and a place that I liked I can not stress this enough She couldn't be at my egg retrieval but called the night before to check in and then again on the day of retrieval to make sure I was feeling ok Our experience with them includes both an IVF freezing cycle as well as an ovulation induction and IUI cycle After having gone to a different clinic with two failed retrievals, I was successful with Dr Levine on my first retrieval and first transfer I froze eggs in nov and going back to do another round next month What started off as consultation regarding ovulation ended up in a 9 month journey and a successful IVF transfer Dr Levine went above and beyond to make sure everything went as smoothly as possible

We came to Dr Levine after trying to conceive for several years without much success After my 2 failed IVF's Dr Levine suggested I try taking Clomid and either doing timed intercourse or an IUI After our first meeting, we were sure we were moving forward with our second IVF cycle and we couldn't have been happier from day oneI spent a couple of years going to Cornell Reproductive Medicine and I finally walked away from them earlier this year after complete frustration When I went to do IVF last year, she was no longer there

I won't get too much into what happened specifically with my IVF's because in both cycles, my embryos were abnormal I tried this in the month of November, 2018 Over the next four months, my husband and I did three cycles of timed intercourse and then ramped up to an IUI at Dr Levine's suggestion Dr Levine explains everything extremely thoroughly and on repeat Everything went exactly as planned from that moment to put it lightly Dr Choi, the physician, is, as I said earlier, a master of the physical processes of reproductive medicine Dr Choi is incredibly patient, explaining different options again and again until I understandI can't speak highly enough of CCRM

I have been extremely pleased with CCRM But the team (especially Stephanie) helped us understand costs and commitments upfront, always with patience, and even helped navigate billing with our insuranceI am beyond happy CCRM is now in NYC! I don't know where to begin They don't mess up bills, forget to prescribe drugs I need (like CCRM did for me twice) and my new doctor cares about me- not just taking my money  The very last meeting was to walk through cost, so, I would have opted into all manner of procedures and drugs and only known the impact to my financial situation after I'd mentally committed I drained any coverage I had with Cornell and when I realized I was going to be paying for this out of my own pocket, I went looking for the best and CCRM is definitely that!! Dr Choi is AMAZING (I agree with the previous reviews) It may be a little more expensive than Columbia but WELL worth it White glove service without a doubt They're worth every penny!
