Like I said I keep going back for my doctor and my nurse, Annie Chan, but the rest of the staff be warned  IVF is a tough process to go through, and I was hoping for a more pleasant, cared for, connected experience  Bushra, the nurse, who showed me how to use the injections buzzed through the instructions like she had to be elsewhere, I felt so rushed and felt like such a number not a human  No one was there to see me out, to give me some instructions, I left feeling very confused and hoped that someone would contact me later She is warm and professional and her expertise helped us conceive our little miracle The doctor's office is run like a well-oiled machine, but with good bedside manner I am grateful to have her help me through this journey and I would highly recommend her for IVF and fertility issuesI truly cannot thank Dr Dicken and the staff of SIRM enough for their hard work and support After 5 years of fertility treatments, my husband and I welcomed our daughter into the world on 2/7/18 Although it did take some time for us to find the protocols and treatments that ultimately worked (I have a fairly complicated medical history), I was continually amazed by the dedication Dr Dicken exhibited toward my case She was there at every turn -- from recommending different tests and treatment options along the way to returning panicked emails promptly to lending a compassionate ear when I needed it most Highly, highly recommend I literally just cleared my tubes two weeks ago and I found out I was pregnant today!!!! She is an awesome person! I'm soooooo glad I sought her help! She's not just about money, she REALLY CARED!!! She's the best Dr I've EVER had  :) Dr Dicken was on maternity leave for the first IUI, so Dr T performed the 1st one and Dr Wang did my second IUI, both were great!!!! Dr Dicken is amazing, as are Dr T & Dr Wang! Dr Dicken sat with us for over an hour in the initial consultation and revamped my medication regiment to focus on egg quality rather than quantity Not only is he intelligent, but also kind, extremely calm (which is something I needed!), and honest (he tells you how it is, so don't expect sugar coating)Dr Wang is the BEST--he's gotten me successfully pregnant twice I was given Sher Institutes name from a friend and calling them was the best decision ever  Dr Dicken was the most caring, empathetic and approachable doctor I've seen She provided so much calmness to me and I couldn't have done it without her Unlike our previous experience  in which we felt we were being treated like cattle, over at the Sher institute we felt like everyone there knew our situation and were there to help us make it happen  However, when I approached Dr T to explain this (a problem with signaling from my pituitary that only started when I was 20 yrs old), he had a plan in mind for my treatment and it worked! Throughout the process Dr T was so calm, positive and reassuring He took my preferences into account and was always flexible with appointments regarding my work schedule I had the sinking sense that he was just trying to get rid of me because I had a complicated fertility profile and he didn't want to mess up his excellent success rates When I went to see Dr Tortoriello I immediately felt that I could trust him He is one of the most balanced, caring and intelligent doctors I have ever had You really feel like he is plugged into your case You know that feeling, when you are sitting across from a doctor and he is giving you these canned answers, like he is reading from a script or has said this to so many people that he is bored of hearing it himself? Dr T is the exact opposite of that

I was never just a number After I was devastated the second time it did not work, I emailed Dr Dicken, she responded with one line and repeated that I need to have surgery to remove my fibroids  Not only is the staff remarkable, but from an operational aspect, Sher also kick-a** My case was not easy for her, and she tried her best to adjust my protocol but that is all she could do No one ever came back and I had to climb down  I had to email the doctor and he said, no one talked to you after?  No She made a very stressful process with high emotions something that was optimistic and manageable Sher is not a factory like the other clinics (ie Cornell, RMA) He doesn't make huge promises (read: sales pitches) but he is more focused on his patients and designing custom protocols for them than any of the other seven doctors I have seen at those five top facilities

you get the less good eggs you have Like they think patients don't know anything Wish me good luckThe two stars are because I have a beautiful daughter that wouldn't have been possible without the Again she didn't give me a time just told me they would call and confirm the time After a procedure I was told they would be back in 10 minutes to help me down from the table People in the office have been really helpful  For those who don't know, SHER doesnt have 'cattle calls' like many other clinics doWe are not medical experts, but the constant stream  of small errors gave us little confidence in the process or the personnel  I did not feel like I was well taken care of  This was absolutely a horrible way to treat a patient who paid good money for this procedure and now who is walking out the door having had the transfer only to feel like they were 'done' with me Office hours are the most flexible I've ever seen, I never had to wait more than a minute upon arrival to be seen, often I'd even arrive early and would be out before my scheduled appointment time I went to Cornell thinking they are the best, but we were again not blessed with the babyThis facility is not closed, however, I had the WORST experience with it just like the first reviewer You need to chase down the phone line to get a simple straight answer  The doctors and nurses are all so warm & make you feel so comfortable The doctors answer your emails even on the weekends and in the evenings!!  The front staff are great too Dr Azim was great BUT the lab that he uses (Gramercy IVF) has freezers that ruined our sperm quality which was excellent quality from a sperm bank I can't say I was a very complicated case, but even so, my husband and I were always treated as if we were the only patients there All the receptionists and nurses came to know us by name and were genuinely always happy to help Also, the new offices are beautiful! If you are unsure of which clinic in NYC to choose, this next part is for you But I've later realized it's because they actually go by appts and honor the appts; you will not be 1 of 10 patients scheduled at 2pmI only have positive things to say  I would recommend this group to anyone who has been told what I was, or if you are just starting off on your IVF journey Definitely, the best fertility clinic out there This is the most responsive and caring group of medical professionals I have EVER experienced When you get off the elevator the receptionists greet you by your first name (the opposite of making you feel like a number, which I felt so many times at other facilities) I have only ever heard them say good things about this facility and Dr TThis office is not closed but is absolutely TERRIBLE in their communication Medically they are OK but they are rude, unhelpful, and treat you like just another #

will see YOUR dr Not just a nurse or whoever is there that dayMy condition was highly unusual, they don't have a name form to as it is very rareThis facility is absolutely NOT CLOSED and it is first When I asked why I wasn't informed that the biopsy was no longer usable I received the reply "people don't usually wait that long" To be specific, I waited 3 years to do the PGD because I thankfully had a successful cycle at Cornell After going through 6 cycles of IVF, yes you read that right 6 cycles, I only wish I switched to Cornell sooner and saved myself a lot of heartache and despairI went to an other practice (RMA NY ) 30 eggs, 29 fertilized, no medication after the retrieval, no blooding, shorter cycle! - I was running out of medication, they was nice enough to help me until i received by meds with EXPIRED MEDICATION I am sure they took the money and didn't test the embryo  You are not another patient in a factor setting like you would be at the big academic institutions (where I got my BFN with a PGS normal embryo) And the best part is that for the transfer he allowed my husband to come into the room with me! He was able to see the transfer and the embryo go into my uterus live I was told by my doctor that I had 2 frozen embryos for my next transfer They transferred 2 fresh and froze another 2 The most important thing, of course, is that I have my babyI've been waiting to write my review until after I delivered my beautiful healthy baby girl, which I did a couple of weeks ago And I have additional frozen embryos from my IVF cycles, which I'll transfer in hopes of bringing my daughter a sibling Also, for the record, I got pregnant at SHER, so I am not bitter I have since found out that not only is this not true but that if an egg is genetically determined to be a good egg, a woman in her 40s is almost as likely to get pregnant as a woman in her 20s The egg retrieval is reasonably easy, 2 weeks of tiny under the skin injections, but the transfer is far more intense with months of bigger injections into the muscle (Caused by them) and then was told instead of doing a fresh transfer I should wait a few cycles and do a frozen transfer SHER knew this and recommended a protocol, which I followed to a T After two years of trying, my husband and I almost gave up to have a baby, but we wanted to try once more at Sher with Dr Tortoriello, and miracle happened!! AMAZING!! I got pregnant I am at 11 weeks of my pregnancy and still have long way to go, but I am very happy and appreciate Sher and Dr Tortoriello  They also wanted 50,000 for their donor egg program I now have a beautiful seven month old son, which I conceived by going to Cornell I had enough eggs and that was not a problem We went through a process of trial and error figuring out which treatment was best for me and ultimately I got pregnant My first appointment with Dr Dicken went well, and I decided to continue my treatments with her I had to be very proactive and be involved in every single step and know every single detail to make sure that I am being treated properlyI wish I had found Sher first In the end, I had my fibroids removed and got pregnant with New Hope Fertility  Its okay to do this  but they have ostensibly dropped all further 'care' now that they have my money I highly recommend Sher and specifically under Dr O'Shaughnessy for any and all fertility needs I recently had a hysteroscopy performed by DrDicken and my uterus looks so much better after she removed all of the scar tissueDr Wang is very nice and that is the sole reason I decided to try thereSher is the best!!! At the age of 36 and after trying for over a year and a half and after 2 IVFs, 1 FET transfer, & 4 IUIs, we finally discovered Dr Dicken and this clinic On the second IUI, we got a POSITIVE pregnancy result for the first time ever!!!!! I am only 4 weeks pregnant, but all seems to be going wellSher Fertility and Dr T are the absolute best And, the best part - he was successful with us on our first IVF cycle! I can't recommend Sher and Dr T and his team enough I wish I had known of them sooner! He didn't want to just pump large quantities of drugs and getting a large amount of eggs, but he cared more about getting quality eggs He decided to use a different mixture of drugs that helped us produce quality eggs and he made it count as promised Just wish we had gone there in the first place It took three rounds of treatment with IUI and I now have a beautiful healthy baby boy thanks to Dr T and his team! Dr Tortoriello is aces! The RE before him was recommending surrogacy or adoption He was resisting doing an embryo transfer even though we had frozen embryos

After 4 rounds of IUI and 2 IVF with no results I did one IUI with gen next and GOT PREGNANT! There labs are old and can cause many issues within the processI hardly ever YELP but I am doing an update to say that I tried to send out the biopsy of my only surviving embryo at SIRM for PGD after three years of it being frozen and was told by Carey Dicken and the office manager that I no longer had the option to do PGD because the biopsy is now too old - They obviously failed at an other transfer I did with themAfter two previously failed IVF treatments by two different RE I chose to go to Dr T because he looks into immune issues I suffered 2 miscarriages as a result of their negligent practices Another huge problem with this clinic is that for the first embryo transfer they took far too long to transfer the embryo into my body The final issue I will share with you is that they told me that the genetic sequencing of the embryo is a waste of money I agree with the negative review on this page She messed up with my IUI timing Everyone knows that IUI is time critical I was so disappointed that I tried timed intercourse and it workedDrTortoriello made me pregnant!! I had developed Asherman syndrome after I lost my identical twin girls at 17 weeks of my pregnancy, and I had three uterus surgeries to remove my scar tissue I also tried north shore in manhasset and after a surgery, 4 iuis and a failed ivf nothing I did two rounds of unsuccessful IVF (two rounds of retrieval and two rounds of transfers) I wasted more that a year at Sher with no results and I am so sorry about it Mostly because my dad died and I would have wanted him to meet my son He said that he proposes we only transfer one embryo (we had talked about transferring two) and that there are risks associated with carrying twins at my age, etc I have never received a well formulated answer from her for the reasons of my multiple failures (I do get pregnant easily though, but always miscarry) Would give no stars but that is not an option  Coming to SHER for my IVF was a mistake  After my transfer, I was given NO instructions  Unfortunately, I had a chemical pregnancy and was not able to keep the pregnancy I was not impressed as I was looking for much thorough doctors since we were young and healthy couple trying to conceive after already unsuccessful IVF I had an HSG done and the result was both tubes were blockedWe came to the Sher institute after failed attempts at Cornell and Columbia clinics We went through 2 failed IVFs and one IUI and our attempt with Sher institute was our last try covered by our insurance Over the last six years I have met a lot of women struggling with IF

After multiple IUI's and miscarriage, we decided to do IVF Why didn't I use my embryo in the first place you might wonder? Because I was down to the last of my savings and it would've cost almost as much to transfer that embryo at SIRM as it would to do a full donor cycle at Cornell - the Dr are not reliable I had to take medication during one week after the retrieval ( additional cost 1500$) to decrease the blooding, only 19 fertilized I noticed that 3 days after!!!!! Can you believe that, they gave me expired medication!- I got one of the eggs they retrieved transfered by RMA I was pregnant for 10 weeks Then we discovered the embryo has some genetic default which should have been discovered during the genetic testing they have done (very expensive)Dr T made it possible for me to get pregnant We did IVF with PGS and on my first attempt I got a BFP Now just waiting for my ultrasound i went to the Westchester office which closed down while under treatment Which at the day of my transfer we discovered I did not have 2 embryos but a morula and and early stage blast  Both which are unlikely to result in pregnancy  I wonder if I would have stayed with sher if they would have continued to lie to me about the quality of my embryos I had a professional doctor review my embryo results and NONE were considered to be viable for transfer  In other words, the don't comply with industry standards on viable embryos So I figured I will go back to Sher since I know how they operate The only place I used this card was at SIRM The embryo should not be outside of storage or the body for more than a few seconds, 30 seconds is a long time for this process, and for my first transfer it took a few minutes I don't know why they missled us? IVF is split into 2 halves, egg retrieval (out of you to be fertilized) and then the fertilized egg is transferred back into you However, next time I realized they did a genetic test through other company, about if my babies are going to have any genetic issues I was overstimulated and there for had fluid in my uterus (which would be another $5000 and the money shouldn't be my deciding factor) I said I believed in my body and why wouldn't we try the transfer because there was a possibility it would work I did the fresh transfer with another dr and the fluid was no longer present Dr Wang was the complete opposite My baby is almost one year old I did two IUIs and one timed intercourse with injectable cycle TI worked for me Then gave me lecture that how my egg will wait for 24 hours after ovulation so they can slide my appointment of IUI She also told me that ivf patients are priority for egg retrieval and my egg can wait Treatments were chosen based on their findings and now we have our son Because of my uterus condition, I was told to give up getting pregnant by many doctors at NYU and CHR  I had done several yrs of acupuncture, herbs and nothing before I came to Sher My first round of IVF ended in a chemical pregnancy after which the doctor came up with a new strategy that made all the differenceI should have written this a long time ago I had fibroids and Sher doctors were insisting that I have to have a surgery I even scheduled my surgery to remove fibroids but decided to get other opinions I went to NYU and Cornell and both doctors told me that they do not see any reason that the fibroids are causing infertility When I switched to Cornell, I realized that much higher standards exist I got pregnant with the first attempt at Cornel and with transferring only ONE embryo At Sher, the first round they transferred  one embryo and the second round two embryos So 1/1 at Cornell and 0/3 at Sher I am the same person with the same eggs and same husband and the same fibroids I went to Dr T when I was 38 after many rounds of IUI and two IVF with another clinicAfter two months on the waiting list, we got our appointment with Dr T I was told later by multiple Doctors that the fertility Dr should never have taken my money because I could not hold a pregnancy with my fibroids Night and day Never happened and it slipped my mind to follow up  Let me say that again He suggests right away the IVF and assumes various scenarios without any analysis I finally consulted with Dr Dicken and went thru 2 egg retrievals and several transfers at SIRM She insisted I have another done this time with canalization Even though it was a short period of time I'm now PREGNANT =-) This is actually the reason why we ended up having subpar thawed sperm for our first IUI at SHER (b/c it had been stored at Gramercy IVF before being transferred to Sher Dr Tortoriello understood our situation and decided to make it count His exact words 'You deserve at least one transfer if not more before going to surrogacy' I got pregnant on my first FET with him

Well, turned out our anesthesia was one of the few things that could be covered by our insurance and the anesthesiologist was indeed in network They just care about the money  The only issue has been with the finance team -- they do not provide details invoices and very casually ask for a lot of money, without back-up documentation Well, RMA had a very complicated payment options  My husband and I met with Dr Dicken multiple times to strategize the best IVF plan for us given our medical issues, the cost our health insurance would cover, and what we could afford That said I know we would have had the same luck with any clinic Then to top it all off they just decided to start charging more money out of the blue for our embryo storage When certain medications wouldn't be covered by my insurance, they worked to see if there was an alternative that would beOh yeah, and it worked My husband and I were ready to give up after 3 years over thereI don't have anything bad to say about this place If your insurance covers some of the charge, make sure you are not being double charged by the insurance covered portion The doctors were so rude & they treated us like cattle! Stay away from RMA!!! Sher institute takes GHI IN NETWORK!!!! We only had to pay a copay for IUI & had we needed to do an IVF, it would have been covered except for $1,500 upfront

I SWEAR I would think it was just me if I had not read the other reviews Well the damn specimen would've died by then They charge a ridiculous fee just for consultation You Basically had to pay for everything in front and then if you didn't have any fertilized eggs for example they would somehow refund you a percentage for what would have been a transfer At cornell, although I brought in all of my medical records, they made me do an ultrasound and pay for out-of-pocket $900 We started with 11 and ended up with 3, so losing 1 through carelessness is pretty epic I booked this place because I had some emergency issue about my health and it was the only place was available near my work So I went in for the following visit and was asked to pay more money No notification that things were changing just a bill saying we owe them more money for something we set up a monthly autopay for This wasted my whole cycle  Outrageous, and the insurance company and I are still fighting it  That included no pic of the donor I had fraudulent charges for check fees on dates where checks were never sent  I just don't care enough to do it We spent over $7k at RMA even though they had claimed to be in network!!! What a waste of $! We had also tried NYC IVF (Dr Azim) & his Gramercy IVF lab

My husband and I have been trying to have baby for many years Month after month I was billed incorrectly Them comes to anesthesiologist which SHER hires for your procedures and it is SHER whom receives the payment I had 36 eggs retrieved- They charge you for everything None of the other places I've been to have such system Couple of times I ran out of medications and they would actually give me meds to cover me until I got my meds shipped I authorized a payment of $2,000, and a couple of days later there were a few charges to restaurants and Pro Flowers But billing?  Perhaps because if we had determined that more eggs were not viable they would not have been able to charge us for as many transfers and they would have made less money?My advice is to find a clinic that has not been bought as a commercial enterprise and is not run as a business So I obviously thought it was for my health issue I never asked for it or knew the blood test was for that Plus, I wasn't there for pregnancy!! Now this genetic testing company asks $1000 for this test What kinda response is that?! Then I was told the overcharge would be kept on file for future charges I said is there a balance on the accountThen I received a check in the mail with an arbitrary amount as a "refund" for being overchargedThen I got a bill for charges that would have been covered by the overpayment And back payments for an amount that doesn't even add upI've never had any issues with billing  That was the only way i opened up tp other possibilites  I was 1 of a million other patients  I was passed around between 7 or so doctors The Westchester location had a staff member attempt to put my signature on an insurance form  About anything  I don't know what the deal is because they have called me about other mattersDr Dickens is an angel!!! I have been ttc for five years) Therefore, stay away from storing specimens at Gramercy IVF I never waited for more than 10-15 min to be seen by my dr

The office is conveniently located, the nurses get you in and out of the appointments fairly quickly (lots of blood tests and ultrasounds!), and both of the doctors I met with (Dr Klein and Dr Guarnaccia) were great  Dr Klein met with me for the consultation and I was impressed by how much time he spent with me going through the details of the process and answering all my questions He has the best bedside manners and always thoughtful as he explains everything that he's doing I'm a very detail oriented person and he was great with providing information without my having to ask Yamice would always recognize my voice when I called and greet me by name when I would come in for my appointments Dr Toledo was kind to schedule a call with me so that I could ask her questions about embryology Maha was always kind to confirm with me when she received my deliveries  ( based on my three times egg freezing experiences)Dont take me wrong, Dr Klein is very nice  And the result was better  I was single, and pretty ambivalent about having children, and found that I was pretty stressed about the prospect of having to worry about this as I potentially started a new relationship (after all, I didn't intend to be single my entire life!)  But overall, I was really happy with my results (turns out having PCOS made me produce a lot of eggs!)In January of 2018, I was diagnosed with some adenomyosis and possibly some endometriosis and I was like "Well at least I have my eggs frozen"  I had met with one of the best doctors at NYU (and he was fantastic, nothing against him), but the overall experience at NYU felt very complicated Highly, highly recommend!! I have low AMH and DOR, and I was treated with the best care during the highs and the lows of my treatment I never felt like a number, and my doctor's and nurses actually cared about my outcomes--and did everything they could to support my success, even more so as an out-of-state patient
I never felt like he was condescending and he never scoffed at what I had to say

He also made himself available via email throughout the process, and he responded right away any time I emailed him a question Through it all, Dr Klein has been extremely patient with my numerous questions He's also very open minded to hear about my findings on the internet and discuss the subject matter Each one has been integral during my journey She followed up a couple of more times afterwards A few articles/videos were done about my experience There is also very little feedback about individual test results

Dr Guarnaccia (Dr "G") is wonderful In 2019, I became an Expect Fertility client, as I was ready to begin my road to motherhood He truly listens to his patients And he always had hope As a patient, it's always nice when after given all of the ratios and numbers (which is a huge dream zapper), the doctor ends it with- it only takes one! It allowed me to keep the faith and stay optimistic She was very responsive and extremely helpful She truly cared  Don't get fooled by their promotions and sales pitch   They try to pump as much medication into you as possible, hoping to get the best results  So I just want to share the experience here   I hope it will help someone who is going through the same situation-- egg freezing I recommend Extend Fertility and Dr Klein to everyone, who would like an "insurance policy" for having children later in life  Conceiving natural was seeming pretty much 100% out of reach and whatever you do- don't go on the internet when stuff like that gets told to you  Feel free to check them out!fortuneIt's amazing how Extend manages to make this not-so-pleasant process such an empowering one Extend trusts that you have made the right decision for yourself, and even works with your health insurance for you! I cannot say enough good things I feel that egg freezing is a smart choice for any woman over 30, and Extend Fertility prices make this choice much easier I conducted a lot of research prior to choosing Extend, and Extend exceeds all expectations in regards to what one should be looking for when searching for the right fertility clinic I have already recommended Extend Fertility to friends who have asked me about my experience, and will continue to do so and share my positive experience with others Only positive comments to say - the entire team is extremely professional, candid, and accessible If you are looking to freeze your eggs, I would highly recommend attending one of their open house workshops and seeing for yourself Extend is one of the most affordable way to freeze eggs in the U I will recommend Extend to any woman I know who is interested in freezing I recommend giving Extend Fertility a try if you are thinking that egg freezing may be an option that you'd like to take I am a huge advocate for educating women about this option; having done this procedure at this incredible clinic makes it even easier to recommend

This journey was long and hard and it was sometimes difficult to think that I would ever reach my end goal New hope is not the bestFreezing one's eggs can be a physically challenging experience as well as an emotionally difficult journey

Where do I start? It's been such a long journey for me I understand that in this industry, the doctor has to be data and statistics driven She would always respond quickly via email to any question or concern that I had She always made me believe that I would  (Dr G is a different story This, in my opinion, is an extraordinary accomplishment This practice fully understands the process and walks you through each step in the exact way they should, without foregoing quality (don't go to a "trendy" clicic that offers champagne, hashtags and no actual endocrinologists--OBYN's are not specialized enough)

Crystal, Christina and Brenda were the best as they always provided moral support/ advice as well as finding a viable vein before pricking me! Ana and Thalia were thorough and would always remember my allergy Jordana was super organized and made sure I understood what was going on and what each procedure entailed She provided me with so much emotional support She was always so positive and helped fuel my "hope" tank The extend sells them well for all the charts and statistic based result oredicatjoBut at New Hope, they customize the medication for you I would like to thank Dr Klein, Dayna, Ilaina, Leslie, Jordana, the procedure room nurse Daniella and the entire incredible team for being so positive, welcoming, flexible, professional, organized, hard-working and nice The staff took great care of me, answered all of my questions, and made it a pleasurable experience Others required more commitment upfront, were more expensive overall, and specialized more in INfertility issues than someone who wanted to simply preserve her fertility
When I had a situation happen- Valerie was calm while I was frantic
To the nurses: Molly, Stephanie and Valerie They never seem exasperated with me She said that she would call me in 30 minutes to check on my symptoms- and she called in exactly 30 min

The entire team at extend is just lovely They made the process so easy  Extend is very transparent and provides several sheets of take home paperwork answering a lot of common questions, detailing the pricing, etc Demet always greeted me with a hug even though all my 2019 appointments were with Expect and not Extend They made me feel like all of my questions and concerns were valid to them Thank you so much to everyone at Extend and Expect Fertility!  As attentive as they can be at the beginning, what really matters to us in the end is their method and the result it delivers  The clinic is pretty well organized  They are very rigid with statics, and treat every patient like how a textbook would instructI have had an incredible experience with Extend Fertility  I am from Austin, TX and did some shopping around in my local area, but didn't find any facility as well-oiled and competent as Extend Fertility (and the price was better than what I was finding around here)  And I went through the extra steps to go through the screening so if my two best friends need eggs, they are there for them too  Extend Fertility is fantastic and I highly recommend The doctors are incredibly knowledgeable and honest, and the nurses are your own army of cheerleaders I came to Extend after consultations with a fertility specialist that demanded a psych visit before I could start, and would have charged three times what Extend chargesExtend Fertility truly does give women access to latest reproductive technology at about half the cost All that said, Extend Fertility is a place that offers great price by cutting out everything that does not relate directly to the outcome of the process Despite the temporary side effects and communication issues, the outcome is well worth it From the first time I came into the office, I felt confident and comfortable with the decision to go through with everything I appreciated that the red tape/endless departments etc of a large hospital system was also taken out of the equation, and it was never a problem or hassle to get a question answered Overall I can't recommend them enough! I've sent a few friends their way alreadyI had the best experience from start to finish working with Extend Fertility Everyone was so kind, professional, friendly, knowledgable and respectful and made the entire process extremely easy! Working with Extend to complete an egg freezing cycle was a very positive and productive experience for me All of the doctors, nurses and advisors were so transparent, kind, attentive and made the process as smooth and easy as it could have possibly been The facility is very clean and aesthetically pleasing as well, which also adds to the ease and comfort of the process I want to sincerely thank everyone at Extend Fertility for making the whole process such a positive one and for providing such excellent care and service! From the moment I stepped foot into the clinic, Extend Fertility staff eased both of those experiences From the Drs, to the nurses, to the support staff, the entire extend fertility family was patient and dedicated to me as an individual person and not just as another case walking through the door They patiently explained each step of the process and made it as easy as possibleThere were so many things I loved about my experience at Extend I went to several clinics before deciding where to freeze and am happy I chose Extend for a few reasons: (1) I really appreciated that I could go in for a consultation at Extend without paying anything(2) Extend only treats egg freezing patients, so in contrast to other fertility clinics where most of their patients are couples that are trying to get pregnant, when you are at Extend, everyone who is undergoing treatment is just like you It makes a huge difference But Extend did a great job of getting preferred pricing at two local pharmacies, and the long-term egg storage facility they work with is one of the cheaper ones too The first blood test AND the first preliminary appointment were totally free, requiring zero financial commitment until I made my decision I travel for a living, so my main concern was how to schedule my monthly cycle around my travel work schedule! The entire staff at Extend, from the receptionists to the nurses and doctors, understood my situation and adapted around it

I can't say enough great things about them! Very rude and impatient )But the methods they use are so aggressive and ineffective  And the results are so poor They don't time well the ovulation Window  They just rigidly go by the 36 hours rule  I even got yelled by doctor G for asking about the reason )I only found out how these things are wrong after I went to New Hope for my third cycle this month  For example, they could have given me the wrong trigger shot medication if I didn't triple check with the nurse The nurses and doctors are always rushed and not easily accessible (only through the answering service)I can't say enough good things about Extend FertilityExtremely rude staff specifically a fertility specialist name Cara, although they are less expensive than RMA it isnt worth it with what you have to deal with , with the unprofessional ignorant staff there I was also nervous about the shots, so they let me come in for a second instructional session with one of the nurses

They had the most patience with me I had SO many questions  But it turned out to be very counterproductive and I am afraid its harmful to my body in the long run The procedure itself was a breeze The doctors are board certified, knowledgeable and experienced, and the nurses are professional Everyone I worked with from the first consultation to the retrieval date, provided incredible serviceThis is an incredible practice and facility Not only are they affordable, they're incredible people They went above and beyond, gave tips on how to minimize the cost of medicine, and FaceTime'd with me after hours when I needed a refresher on how to inject my medicine

I highly highly recommend this practiceOverall very happy with the Extend Fertility process  I recently completed an egg freezing cycle with Extend and all went smoothly It started off in 2017 when I went through two rounds of egg freezing cycles at Extend Finally, my number one cheerleader through it allI wish someone had shared their experiences with Extend, so I could have skipped the 2 cycles with them, and saved my ovaries  I only got 50% of mature eggs the first time, and the second time half of the eggs magically disappeared ( I think they ovulated earlier) They use manupor unnecessarily  I was pretty skeptical about them at the beginning, and even wanted to go back to the extend The process that led to the procedure lasted for about 10 days and during that period of time I felt really well taken care ofI froze my eggs in August of 2016 and was very happy with my experience  So I decided to take all my savings and freeze my eggs with Extend Fertility  I was able to retrieve 30 eggs, 20 of which were viable/mature enough to freeze and the retrieval process was pretty painless (I couldn't laugh or cough without a little pain for the next couple of days) and flew back to Austin, TX with no issues a couple days after the procedure  I think freezing my eggs allowed me to relax and not worry so much of my impending infertility  It also allows me to have 33-year-old eggs if I ever have the desire to put myself through another pregnancy (as of right now, no thanks)  I'm happy I froze my eggs and it was well worth the investment, even though I happened to conceive naturally (they say this is NOT uncommon)An important thing to know is that egg freezing fertility medications carry significant short term side effects for some women I wish I was better prepared for this - my "Fertility Specialist" (initial sale / coordinator) downplayed the fact that it might be "normal" for me to throw up multiple times per day during the treatment The whole setup caters to women looking to freeze their eggs, as opposed to most places which have traditionally only focused on infertilityChoosing Extended Fertility was one of the best decisions of my life If I had to do it all over again: I would choose Extend hands down

Their method will not only hurt your body, but also render the worst results  (I strongly suspect in the second cycle, the missed the ovulation window, and lost half counts of my eggs   just for the full disclosure But if I could have done it again, I wouldn't have gone to the extend at all  But it's my fault that I didn't do a thorough research first  According to the internet, I was basically barren and destined to live my life childless and in pain Because of the procedure, I went off birth control, and wouldn't you know it, it only took one time of not being too careful and I conceived naturallyI traveled to NYC five times and underwent five egg freezing cycles over the last 3 years to meet my banking goals (32-35 years old)

They ask you to inject full dose of ganerilx every shot  But the doctor can't tell me why  I didn't have to use manupor They minimize both the ganerilx and trigger shots  I felt less influenced by the drug during the whole cycle  I was 33 at the time and when I was 30 years old, was diagnosed with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) and had a lot of hormonal complications with that  The narrative around PCOS for a single woman in her mid-30s was that infertility was highly possible and interventions to conceive were likely  So I flew up to NYC for two weeks and did my cycle  Fast forward to today, and I am now 6 months pregnant (unintentionally) with my first child and all my eggs sit cozily on ice in a cryobank in Boston So I tabled my decision for a few months I was able to complete one cycle and retrieved 13 eggs

EF didn't pay me or anything to do them- I just really believe in what they are doing Then I was served an Instagram ad for EF, and figured it was worth a look Conservatively estimating, I saved $50k in total, or 10k per cycle over the course of five cycles compared to my local options in SeattleI completed 2 cycles w/ Extend Fertility In addition to appreciating not being charged for the initial consult, I also really appreciated how the pricing was all-inclusive and didn't include hidden fees all over the place (you paid one price at the beginning, and that was it)Don't forget that you do still have to buy medications and pay for storage of your eggs At Extend, I felt supported and understood
I feel really regretted, not for the money,  but worried about how all the cycles might have impacted my health

They are also known as being a slightly cheaper option than some of the other providers here in NYC I could write a paragraph for EACH staff member  Because the count of eggs was only half of what the unltrasound indicated  The medications were expensive of course, so I'm not going to lie, be prepared for thatcom/2016/08/10/e…theguardiancom/business…nbcnewyorkcom/news/loca… This is the place for such a procedure! Most other clinics were charging several hundred dollars just to go in for a consult(3) The pricing was so much more affordable than all of the other clinics I visited I had researched several other clinics in other cities, and in NYC

Clinic_name: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey RMANJ
Reviews: Dr Kaser did an excellent job of managing my care, patiently explaining that my willingness to risk OHSS to have enough eggs wasn't going to be a part of my treatment plan, and implemented a much safer protocol   I don't need to talk to my doctor specifically constantly -- instead I have a entire team of people who seem to be fully able to give me great care One- this whole process and concept is difficult and emotional however, I personally didn't want someone being overly emotional or giving me false hope  I took half of her suggestions and had success with input from another professional  The doctor and anesthesiologist attended to me right away, got me comfortable and got my eggs out  When it's all said and done I missed way more days of work than I planned because of RMA overbooking and I having literally nothing to show for it except a lower life savings and a casual doctor recommendation to "try again" like I was sampling ice cream at frickin' Baskin Robbins!  NopeWe cannot begin to thank Dr Forman for the gift he brought to our lives His calm and confident demeanor helped us understand that, although nothing was guaranteed, we were also not alone  Dr Forman and the staff were there again to inform us of our best options to succeed and help us continue on Because of the commitment to us, on February 1, 2016 we welcomed our little miracle into this world, our precious daughter We wanted to thank the entire RMA staff, your team of doctors, and especially Dr Forman for making our dream come trueMy experience with RMA was a very good oneWhile our nurse was very competent our doctor we feel was notWas very helpful  in my conceiving my 4 year old son  We usually feel as though we are treated like lab values on a piece of paper instead of human beings in need of medical care She talks to you like she's giving the services out for free, she forgets that we are paying customers Not because we couldn't get pregnant but for the inconsiderate demeanor of Dr Berg himself I enjoyed reading these since it gave me insights into my own clinical care But surprisingly, the politeness and warmth of the staff if very good Clearly the partners -- Scott, Drewes and Berg -- care a lot about patient experience and someone is ensuring that patients are always treated kindly I saw Dr Bohrer and liked him very much Humble, humorous, kind

Clinic_name: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey RMANJ
Reviews: I met with the nutritionist in the office and this was my only gripe- I didn't agree with some of what she was saying   I had a traumatic egg retrieval (a cyst burst and blood pooled in my abdomen- SOOO painful!!)  At first the nurse told me it was okay to be uncomfortable but she also sprang into action when I told her it was comfort it was pain Suffering multiple miscarriages is very difficult for any couple It was mostly me, my behavior and my expectations from them and with how I was feeling about my own situation at any given time through out any given day, not them as much as my need to do my part and calm down under this stressful situation of having trouble conceiving Robin Odom is rude and condescending

Clinic_name: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey RMANJ
Reviews: My doctor always called me back quickly to answer my questions when he received email      Dr Michael Bohrer performed a pre IVF surgery and Marcy Maguire was my main Dr  The Doctor that did my transfer was Dr Molinaro They went to the back to speak to my doctor ( She was too busy to see me as usual) and she told them I was to be chargedMy wife was referred to Dr Paul Berg of RMA in Basking Ridge, NJ

Clinic_name: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey RMANJ
Reviews: RMA's strong research guides treatment, saving you from having to research options such as embryo glue or assistive hatching But you'll save yourself a lot of stress if you double-check your drugs immediately You can't return online meds, so please check prescriptions prior to ordering Another option is to contact daycares in Basking Ridge to see if any accept children for drop in care   Doctors perform monitoring ultrasounds, which is extremely helpful if you have any questions during IVF     RMA has excellent success rates, and I didn't write this review to discourage you from choosing them Best of luck to you!   It's just that it's not worth wasting time (especially over 35) with other things because time is ticking and the best shot is IVF   So my concern was not finding a doctor that would help us conceive naturally - my only concern was finding the best IVF clinic I could afford   RMA had a financing option that helped make it doable, and after much research on the SART website, the CDC website, and the Fertility Authority website, we were confident that RMA-NJ was the best clinic in our area for freeze-all IVF cycles   And I do believe I am getting great care  I'm not sure why the one reviewer was surprised at a message being left- you were allowed to choose whether or not to have messages left (regardless of their news)  This is NOT a waste of money or time if you are realistic  As much as I wish it was a perfect happy outcome for everyone, it's not  You can't blame everyone who's trying to help it's called the  RMANJ will help you along that pathIt was wonderful experience, I would do it again Dr Eli Rybak is Friendly and caring I suggest you definitely pay the extra $$$ on getting the eggs tested or there's a good chance you will have a miscarriage and have to go through the entire ordeal over which sucks If you have any questions please contact me and I'll let you know what I went through :)Note: I have 250 unit of Gonal-F that is useless for me now, if anyone needs plz feel free to contact I live in NJ, PiscatawayHi, I am not writing the review out of frustration, it's just a feedback You are truly a number They are so concerned about patient care that some "nurse" you don't even know leaves you messages that both your tubes are blockednow that's great bedside mannerand don't be fooled And I believe it all comes down to the following: If you feel more comfortable with your doctor calling you and interacting only with you at most of your appointments through your ivf journey, then you need a smaller fertility office In terms of doctors, I dealt with a few of them and I clicked with some of them better than with others, especially Marcy Maguire, my doctor I have a beautiful healthy daughter who is soon turning 3 years old And they certainly try to do a good job for all What matters is that they do a good job Can they improve I'm some aspects, of course Not only is it difficult to get a hold of anyone who knows anything (you'll wait on hold, then wait with a nurse to get a hold of someone who knows anything and then you'll end up just leaving a message after all this--what should have been a 2 minute call takes 10) but they are incredibly inept/disorganized  Even though I want to get pregnant, ironically I hope that I don't as I don't trust their competence and fear that any child created would have development issues because of what RMA did  We'll be going back for sure  I am writing this review about my experience, not out of frustration for lack of success (although that is true), but out of frustration for how my husband and I are treated by RMA  We aren't looking for a best friend but we are looking to be treated like human beings with feelings, questions and concerns Don't warn you of procedure expectations I am not bitter, I am pregnant but just don't want to see others go through what I did with RMA Go elsewhere where you are treated better and not as a number!RMA is one of the top IVF practices in the country It's pretty much them, CCRM in Colorado and a handful of others leading the major developments in the field So you are getting the most advanced care you can get, probably anywhere Always a pleasure to deal with him, even during morning monitoring when you know he's busy But that's with the clarity of hindsight They want to give you all this stuff because it MIGHT help

Clinic_name: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey RMANJ
Reviews: This is a very reasonable policy, given how difficult it might be for some patients to see children You might want to check with your insurance carrier ahead of time to avoid an unexpected expense   If you're not sure if you need IVF, if want to conceive naturally or with IUI, I don't know if RMA-NJ is what you need or notWhat a waste of $30k I would give them no stars if it was an option They don't listen to your input and want to do everything their way However, I have read some reviews that seem very disturbing to me The customize your treatment according to your blood work, your health status, and they carefully assess your emotional state, and your expectations However, it is a difficult thing to tell some of us things we are sometimes not prepared to hear But this was not the general experience with RMA, these were isolated experiences I have a full time job, did not want another!  When you ask questions they get frustrated and become very short with you  Crazy! Every (and I mean every) interaction with RMA is infuriatingPlease don't get me wrong, it's clear that they know what they are doing when it comes to fertility, but we don't feel like they treat the person  Unfortunately I will not be returningSurprised by all the negative reviews Barely return your calls/no communication4 On 3 separate occasions either he or a staff MD, suggested to my wife that if IVF didn't succeed for us, to take our funds to go on vacation & try on our own to conceive Bad experience

Clinic_name: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey RMANJ
Reviews: Try to take your medication during their on call hours in case you have any questions  Ask RMA to draw on your body with a marker so you know exactly where to inject the PIO shots IVF is an extremely stressful process, and it is my hope that if you have more understanding of how this practice runs it will save you stress during your treatmentI am a patient at RMABut I will say this:  if you know you need IVF, if IVF is what you are looking for, RMA-NJ is the place to go   The people who say you never see your doctor are mostly right -- you might see your doctor once in a while, but in general, you don't  But what I like about this place is what people are complaining about  In short- if you want someone to hold your hand,  blow smoke up your ass and beat around the bush- just keep trying on your own What happens in our life is destiny But we expected a detailing of billing and more explanationDo your research before starting treatment with RMANJ   To make a very long story short I can't wait to be done with them They will only do what's necessary so that you spend the most money with them Do not use these people Do not do it to yourself and your spouse  Personally, I preferred the nurses at West Orange Personally,  I have learned that us the patients, the doctors, and the nurses all deal with this process differently and you can not be all tuned in with each other at all times I will go try ivf one more time with RMAIf I could give zero stars I would  (You'll see that as you work with them you'll find that its all about them and nothing about you)You rarely meet with your 'doctor', you meet with a rotation of medical students and then you will later find out that you need to go to the Basking Ridge office to do the retrievals and insertions by another rotation of people you've never met with  They provide minimal information about what's happening, why you are doing such actions, and what you can expect in the future Working with them vs  I go to the Basking Ridge office You hardly ever see your actual doctor They don't educate you on how to administer the shots So today I go in, wait an hour, for the woman again to tell me I owe them $35 and $35 for each additional shot My suggestion is to seek out a practice that can provide a more individualized approach to medicine If you search for Scott on Google Scholar you'll see on their latest publicationsFinally, a word of caution: by default, RMA gives nearly all the interventions to everyone, even if you might not need it Everyone gets drugged up with many medications All I'm saying here is that you should question them about every intervention You can decline ICSI You can decline the antibiotic

Clinic_name: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey RMANJ
Reviews: She was the one who called me after many months to deliver the good news as well and I will be forever grateful for her professionalism and directness  Good vibes to all the want to be moms and dads!  They tried to convince her that at 37 she was already too brokenbut she always called back and helped me out and answered any questions that I've had We are both so much in love with our little girl that has changed our lives forever They do a great job for many But I literally could not hear a word she was saying and she then told me to find the number of the pharmacy I needed to go to get more Endometrium, which I still needed for two more days, and had ran out of  Our interactions were great and thankfully everything worked out  The nurses in IVF recovery are wonderful The front desk staff is unfailingly kind, especially Miss Harriet in the Somerset office

Clinic_name: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey RMANJ
Reviews: I'll be having my baby any day now! Thank you so much to Dr Shastri!!! Christine Helbo was my nurse and I spoke to her prob everyday and I think she got sick of me asking questions I had a weekend nurse told me how my beta markers were negative and while I was trying to get a grasp of this terrible news, she was telling me I still needed to get back for one more blood test

Clinic_name: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey RMANJ
Reviews: My nurse, Patrice always called with whatever the blood results were and the next step Especially, My nurse, Lynette and My doctor Dr Shastri are two angels Had procedure at RMA Somerset surgical office, Nurse Josephine was prompt, explained post instructionsIf we are available to answer the phone when the nurse calls (which is always while we are working at our busy, fast paced jobs) we both feel as though we are rushed off of the phone  My nurse coordinator returns my calls with questions very quickly and always keeps me informed They will never call you back and she always says she has SO MANY clients she doesn't remember who your I told her my nurse spoke to the doctor and that it was waived You are assigned a nurse coordinator who is your primary contact throughout and a financial counselor

Clinic_name: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey RMANJ
Reviews: It would help to closely supervise medication orders My stim prescriptions were initially sent to Freedom Fertility, and I called and scheduled delivery Since the drug companies ship overnight this shouldn't be a problem  They promised to send the prescription first thing next day Some online pharmacies have pharmacists on call during certain hoursPlease note that children are not allowed in RMA buildings The earliest daycare started at 7, so we could easily be there at 8 With the transfer, I realized we might be better off calling the Basking Ridge clinic directly to ask for the earliest time so we could pick our kids up from school (retrievals are done in the morning; transfers in the afternoon)      RMA allows outside monitoring (my nurse told me it wasn't allowed but my doctor said it's fine Their monitoring and bloodwork is extremely quick and efficient, but there is only one doctor at the satellite offices, so it can get backed up if a lot of people arrive at the same time)So, RMA is indeed like a smooth, polished factory system  Your doctor is behind the scenes constantly checking your lab results and ultrasound results, but mostly you get calls and emails from nurses relaying the doctor's instructions to you -- this is true  Every appointment I have a chance to ask a doc any questions I want to, and they have my entire record in front of them due to RMA's seemingly awesome technological record keeping and great organizational setup Every employee - every doctor -- every nurse -- that I have talked to has been patient, respectful, informative, and caring   Their success rate in some age groups is almost double the national average  I love that this place is crowded- have you seen their success rates, no wonder?!  I knew right after meeting with Dr Dougherty that I was in good hands and have trusted everything they have told me  The convenience of morning bloodwork/ultrasounds allowed me to never be late for work  My specific doctor also called me later that day to check up on me as well as the following day  This place is amazing and I will be forever grateful to them  You have to trust that their treatment plan is individualized to you based on their recommendations But they were always available to me and helped me with care They took utmost care of me As long as they are doing everything in their capacity, we shouldbe thankful to them Our heartful thanks to the everyone from this place  Pick a less crowded clinic and get better care Anistologyst did a great job, I was ready to go as soon as I opened my eyes This Place is wonderful  They have too many patients and u are treated as a number The doctors were very nice and very convincing that they only wanted the best for meI switched to another doctor at another fertility center (Dr Nasseri at Valley Fertility Center) They listened to what I wanted You really are just a number to them I would advise you to go to a smaller clinic where you are treated like a human being All the money that is spent there they should have more respect for their patients Never acknowledged their mistake You may have an appointment or two close to home, but for the important stuff like egg retrieval, etc Find someplace where they treat you like a human and not a lab rat The staff at RMA, from the wonderful team of nurses to Sonia (will always have a spot in our hearts) at the front desk, were always so encouraging every step of the way It made us feel like everyone was in our corner and pulling for a positive outcome It got even more difficult watching multiple new classes of hopeful parents in the waiting rooms with us All of the hardship, the emotions, and the sacrifice that felt like they would never end are now replaced by laughter, hugs, kisses, and the love of our little girl Like any big office running a large complex operation, they have a system to get things running smoothly and you, as a patient, are part of the system They have the resources, and the results to prove that they have indeed helped a lot of people Some nurses are sweeter than others, some are more experienced in dealing with human emotions during this difficult process some of us have to go through They are there to help us conceive Some nurses express empathy better than others They have managed to streamline this ivf process in a way that provides the best results for the biggest number of peopleTo make a VERY long story short, do yourself a favor and avoid RMA (specifically the West Orange office) at all costs I've now switched practices and it's a world of difference to deal with people you can easily reach, who want to handle everything for you and have it done so properly so that you don't have to do their job for them  Then at the end of the conversations will say that they care and only want what's best for you   It's frustrating to feel like you are playing a game of telephone when it comes to your medical care  I have started asking around, and have been told that it's more typical to be able to call a clinic and actually speak to someone as well as to have a way to communicate with your doctor (ex: by email) RMA is like night and day  They are professional, empathetic, communicative, consistent and reliableI am a patient with RMA-NJ and love the attention and care that they give  I may have had a positive experience because it ended with a baby, however during the whole process I thought they were extremely organized considering the amount of patients  I originally went to them because their reputation as "the best" and I was never disappointedbut I also felt that if I didn't understand something, there were approachable nurses that could help either by phone or in personAll Doctor's were very professional!!!  I can't remember my main nurse's name, I don't think she is there anymore because the names on the website don't look familiar, but I remember the nurses in the recovery room in Morristown were very pleasant!  If I was a little younger, I would go back and try for a second!!! The next day I went in and the lady exclaimed to the entire waiting room that I " left without paying for my progesterone shot" REALLY?Hello HIPA? I was never told it was a charge

Clinic_name: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey RMANJ
Reviews: At 3 I called again, and was told I'd been given the wrong information and the prescription arrived too late since the deadline was 2:30, not 3:30 We had to leave at 6:30 to arrive at 7:30 in Basking Ridge It was January and my kids were 6 and 2 so this wasn't going to work well  We finally hired a babysitter we didn't know very well, who kindly agreed to start work at 6:30) It might be difficult to find somewhere that can perform both an ultrasound and bloodwork, but a few appointments are just bloodwork, which can be done at quest to avoid RMAs normal monitoring hours (6-7:30 am) You should try to direct all questions to your nurse, but if you are absolutely panicking (and I panicked over nothing at least once) you can call the office and request that they email your doctorI am amazed at the number of bad reviews here, but as I read through them, I see most of the bad reviews fall into two categories:1) People upset at the efficient yet somewhat detached system that RMA uses and2) People upset that IVF was recommended or "pushed" on them when they felt they didn't need itThere are a few negative reviews that are other than this, but this seems to be the gist of most of them   No, they don't all exude warm fuzzies, but they do all exude professionalism and give me what I need   There's only one thing I don't like about RMA and that is how early their monitoring hours are   I don't like having to be at an office between 6 and 730 every other day, particularly considering that i live really far away  I'm surprised at the poor reviews but again- they can be labeledAbsolutely terrible they caused a nightmare situation that has caused me to be depressed and anxious stay away from this fertility factory if you don't want to end up in a psych wardMy wife came home sobbing from her first (and only) appointment with these people  It was totally clear that RMA is just a high-pressure boiler room selling IVF and preying on women's fears  I personally did not have good experience, nurse was good but their doctors, staff, financial coordinators not good long waits during monitoring, no personal care, and they do not have individual treatment plan for sure!I would never recommend RMA to anyone! You are just another patient on a conveyor belt to them They are at fault and spending $50 co-pay on everyday ultra sound is no joke besides the emotional torture that resulted in simply cancelling my cycle worrying about multiple pregnancyThe place if horrible Like most of the patients we were already very frustrated, and quite hopeless when we first walked into RMA office in Morristown There are many people there going through the same troubles as you And some nurses and doctors are better than others at relaying messages over the phone about lab results that are sadly negative I was a wreck and she seem to feel this was the right moment to send me off to find some number to some pharmacy, etc etc Some doctors walk in and are all focused on your transfer and don't really smile, and some treat you very attentively and are very sweet But how you can control every staff member's reaction and way of communicating at all times any facility is a bit tricky I would tell every patient the following, for me the worst part to control through this journey was my emotions, my anxiety, and my stress They have misfiled codes with my insurance company causing me to have to sort everything out for them, it now appears they've lost blood tests and all the while they've been incredibly inefficient on other fronts   And when I say negative, they would say that your going to have a miscarriage  They stink!  There are no redeeming qualities for RMA  I should have immediately looked elsewhere when my first experience with RMA was them threatening to cancel my appointment if they didn't receive about 10 pages of personal information before the first appointment  They are rude and will bully you by saying that if you deviate from their recommended procedures they will stop working with you  There are some hiccups that I can warn against, but was a smooth practice for nearly of it  We are still patients there but are seriously considering other clinics It only makes RMA look worse in my eyes and any recommendations I would ever give would be to go to IRMS at St Are only in it for the MONEY! You are nothing but a number they can care less about I called my nurse, and they apologized and said she spoke to my doctor and they were shocked they did that and that for now on the $35 fee was waived I called my nurse in charge , no answer, still no call back There is NO COMMUNICATION! This is just one of many stories Our experience was awful I could go on with other examples of our concerns but this place has taken too much of our time & hard earned money already Not surprisingly, they are one of the highest volume clinics in the country, over 3,000 IVF cycles a year when I went there It doesn't feel like a factory even though they are dealing with vast numbers of patients If it is ever discovered that these interventions are hazardous to the offspring -- and some such as CCS are so new they haven't been studied much -- I will feel terrible

Clinic_name: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey RMANJ
Reviews: RMA rescinded the prescription, and sent it to a different pharmacy I insisted on speaking to a supervisor, who checked and saw that the deliveries hadn't been picked up yet The RMA offices open earlier than 6, so if you get there earlier you can be the first patient in line when monitoring starts at 6Most of the nurses I dealt with seemed extremely knowledgeable, and can answer most of your questions  Every ultrasound is done by a doctor, not a nurse   They know what they are doing They are very knowledgeable and they know what they are doing Their staff, doctors and nurses are very cordial The staff if very cordial  Spent months waiting in line for everything from blood draws to saline sonograms Now they are trying again to upsell me the IVF I don't know what on Earth they were thinking! They are butchersyou'll have to face going up and down deadly 287 early in the morning to wait for hours Going to our first meeting was a big step RMA is simply too big But because of this very reason, you have an assigned nurse that follows you case, calls you almost every other days, a computerized system that gives everyone involved instant access to detailed records, and several doctors putting their brains together to discuss your case However, for me, all the doctors I dealt with were extremely focused on their jobs, and on what they were doing I went back to RMA to try to have a second baby and this time it simply did not work RMA is a reputable business   They say to stay positive when almost all interaction with them was negativeYou have to know how each part of the RMA organization works as well as the lingo as RMA takes no accountability and will have you driving the process instead of them   Our experience has been that we can only communicate with nursing via voicemail and can never actually get someone on the phone  I felt that online training for the shots was sufficient My nurse in charge told me to go to the office where they would do it for me Why would you ever say that to a woman who tied her tubes ? Maybe they should actually prepare for the consult by reading the file ?!?! A factory in every sense of the word

Clinic_name: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey RMANJ
Reviews: I was quite fortunate to be successful on my first round of IVF at the age of 40 They kindly moved our transfer up to the earliest possible time, so we didn't have to worry about our kids   I have not yet attempted to get pregnant, as I am only in the middle of my second freeze-all IVF cycle at the moment (a strategy that I and my doctor agreed on  It's not that women don't have any chance of conceiving after that without IVF  (And, freeze-all is much better than fresh cycles for older women especially, and I'm over 35   But I'm willing to roll with their system -- why?Because they treat more IVF patients in a month than most clinics see in a yearI agree with previous reviewer Heather  I like realistic expectations and matter of fact data We can't blame a center  I did and I wish I knew this from the start  They tried to convince her that she was too old to conceive naturally and that she absolutely 100% needed to start on IVF immediately I told them from the very beginning that I wanted to try IVF no matter what because I know IUI does not work for our situation They said okay, as long as I have 2-3 follicles showing We ended up doing IVF and now we have two very healthy baby girls! If we had stayed with RMA, we would never have been blessed with our two little angels I've had problems staying pregnant and it turned out that I definitely needed to do IVF in order to have a healthy baby I was 38 when I first went in, now I'm 39 when I'll be giving birth The entire process was very tiring, taking shots in your stomach and giving blood almost every other day and popping pills and having my husband put a needle in my back every night for months was definitely draining But worth it :) we got lucky with the first batch of eggs they took out of methey took out 23 eggs (which is a lot) and when fertilized only 2 of those eggs were good We still have another boy embryo waiting for us when or if we're ever ready for another child They merged with IVFNJ and I had a better time dealing with them From our first discussion, Dr Forman educated us on all of the risk factors that we faced and helped us weigh the best way to achieve parenthood Unlike the lucky couples that were successful the first try we had a few more stumbles IVF seemed to be the most thoughtful approach considering her tubes tied & now age 43 & very healthy Dr Berg came very highly recommended I would've preferred to have more discussions of the latest research with him but I was still very happy I also negotiated with them to do a more natural-style cycle that wouldn't involve any medication after the transfer) All embryos get extended culture, assisted hatching and 84% get ICSI For me, I wanted proof that it would definitely help before I exposed myself or my embryos to it That said, I still wish I hadn't caved to their pressure on ICSI and CCS

Clinic_name: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey RMANJ
Reviews: Later I realized I was missing a drug, Lupron, from my medication list My nurse stated that 8 is too late, and suggested we leave our kids in the car with my husband watching them during my retrieval and my watching them when he deposited his sample since the procedures didn't take place at the same timeWe needed IVF because my husband had prostate cancer and if we wanted to conceive together, our only option was IVF, there is no such thing as conceiving naturally or conceiving with IUI in his situation I had two follicles showing and they still refused to move to IVF I truly believe that they saw me as a person that would not succeed with IVF and it would hurt their statistics They just kept telling us that our chances of conceiving via IVF were really low and that we would waste our money trying My first attempt with IUI failed, in the second attempt I was monitored regularly I mean regularly***  by DrShastri but my cycle was cancelled despite of good sized follicles yet too many and secondly because of high estrogen level, they overdosed me it's simply frustrating! I should have listened my husband and not buy another 300 units of Gonal-F as my estrogen level was already high but my dr still wanted me to take a 50unit dose They will cut you up so much so that IVF is your only option They don't like to do multiple embryos unless it is necessary I had the meds/ needles but I was having a hard time with administering only the progesterone shots ( all others in the belly were no big deal) I couldn't reach my butt Had I known how well we would do, I think I would've gone to a lower-tech clinic and not done extended culture, ICSI, CCS, etc

Clinic_name: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey RMANJ
Reviews: Then I called to confirm a few days later I needed the Lupron in two days  They filled my prescription immediately, so I got my drugs in time  My stims took longer than usual, so my retrieval was scheduled while my mother was away)   So I can't say that RMA has worked wonders for me, or that I got pregnant there (at least not yet) because I haven't tried that part yet   I do know that almost all fertility advice is that if you're over 35 and have tried for 6 months and can't conceive, it's time for IVF I developed several complications couple of timesMy husband & I used RMA in Englewood for three rounds of artificial insemination (aka IUI) Our goal was to go to IVF, however, the doctors would never let us because I didn't produce enough follicles It stuck the first time! It doesn't matter on the age, it matters on the personThey misdiagnosed me and performed a surgery I did not need Do not, do not use them I went to RMA of Englewood a few times but decided to go to RMA of West Orange instead for most of my monitoring I can tell you one thing, I got pregnant on my first try at IVF with RMA I will say this They have a philosophy and they stick with itOur baby was born on 5/13/15 after working with Dr Shefali Shastri from RMANJJust to add an update:  we switched practices to The Institute for Reproductive Medicine at St  My son just turned 3I conceived at RMA I went, had it done left Having had her tubes tied at the birth of our little boy 2 years prior now decided to try to have a baby sibling for him Dr Scott, Dr Forman and the fellows publish the research (Personally, I didn't take the steroids or the antibiotics because I couldn't find sufficient evidence in the literature that they made a difference Many get the CCS genetic testing In the end, we had a ton of stellar embryos, so we didn't need all the interventions

Clinic_name: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey RMANJ
Reviews: My husband and I want to thank RMA for their services They only care for money They do care

Clinic_name: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey RMANJ
Reviews: I was told my insurance went through but the shipment was cancelledA duplicate of my FET meds were sent to two pharmacies, but I realized RMAs mistake and told the second pharmacy not to fill the order Only downside, if at all, we faced, is- The finance department Also, there is some lack of communication between our insurance company and finance department The first time I did have to pay because my crappy insurance got away with not having to cover me The second time, I did have to pay my $50 copay during some of my monitoring visits, but it is not RMA who sets those fees  My biggest issue with RMA is directly related to the mistakes the finance department makes Never explain allocated money and forget trying to get a refund from them

Clinic_name: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey RMANJ
Reviews: I was not informed of this by RMA My Lupron prescription was sent to the first pharmacy, not the second At 12 I called the pharmacy, and was told the prescription wasn't in but the deadline was 3:30 But as noted in other reviews, some insurance companies charge copays for ultrasounds performed by doctors, but not for ultrasounds done by technicians   Honestly I don't really care about this Everything is sorted now  They were completely uninterested in talking about other less invasive fertility treatments It is my insurance company The insurance i have now did cover the cost of my second transferI have been a patient at RMA off and on for about 2 years ( not covered by insurance= $1,000 /month) I bugged out
