She was always kind, gentle when taking blood and remembered me by name Also a huge thank you to Dr Gutman who made me feel like I was her only and most important patient during the implantation I am so thankful that my family is now complete, and I recommend RMA to anyone having trouble with fertility  She has no bedside manner and always just tells you "looks great"Castlebaum is absolutely amazing and has a wonderful bedside manner At this time we are pregnant and we thank no one else besides Dr Freedman at first the billing is tricky but no worries they are honest and care only about making us happy,, so please choose this place and stop waisting your time at these other places  She was honest, knowledgable, and thorough  I also saw Dr William Schlaff on occasion when Dr Gutmann was unavailable and he was extremely caring, sensitive, and had great bedside manner I switched to another practice and finally got to experience a truly patient centered approach They were wonderful and treated me with respect, while being honest  In each case the staff was super professional and unfailingly kind Dr Gutmann is smart, thoughtful, listens well, is unfailingly persevering, and kind

I literally was crying in his office when he told me my chances of normal pregnancy was so low I could write a book and go on and on about the horrendous experience we had there To make a long story short, after 2 failed ivf cycles, I found it appalling that once again the doctor couldn't call me himself to deliver the terrible news  I was actually quite shocked and disappointed by the contrast when I finally transferred to my OB

I remember our first visit with Dr Castelbaum My office of choice was in King of Prussia The doctor never once called personally to deliver any test results or ask how were doing You don't feel connected or welcome, it feels like they literally just go through the motions

With Dr Castelbaum's support and guidance, along with a great team; we are 8 weeks and 6 days pregnant  To be able to get pregnant from our first transfer, it's a blessing I will fully recommend anyone struggling with infertility to visit RMA of Philadelphia I am now lucky enough to have a wonderful baby boy after years of trying, including a heartbreaking miscarriage Gutman, on the other hand, can best be described as a twatI would highly suggest avoiding this corporation for fertility care After all the frustation we decided to go the best IVF doctor in town, Dr Freedman at RMA of King of Prussia/Philly and the place is high class and state of the art, it is worth it Trust me this place is the BestI love RMA of Philadelphia I love all the docs Dr Castelbaum is definitely my favorite, but Drs Freedman and Gutman are great tootwice! Love you all  I would recommend this practice to anyone  We would highly recommend RMA to anyone struggling with infertility issuesThank you inviting me to call your office I would definitely not recommend to anyone Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else

If I could give negative stars, I would  Dr Gutmann is the worstShe feels the need to belittle her patients by commenting on their socks or their childrenI will never recommend RMA to anyone She is cold and rudeDo not go here!! They only care about the money and your treatment plan will not be personalized

She gives you direct feedback about you, your health, your partner's health, and your fertility plan Learn from my mistake and don't waste your time or money I am still waiting for from a call from the DoctorSo really, go somewhere else If I could give this place 0 stars, I would If you're reading this you're considering embarking on this possibly long and winding road

Thank you to my favorite nurse HeatherI am so grateful to all the wonderful staff at RMA King of Prussia and Willow Grove I loved all the nurses, especially Jill from the willow grove location I started taking a friend there (who needed some assistance due to language barriers) about 1 She's a strong advocate for diverse families and I've heard her voice more than once on NPR as their go-to soundbite

Today, was a happy day; unlike the first visit A special thank you to Dr Castlebaum, who is smart and confident and got the job done! Jodi from finance was a huge help You're a number to them and never get a call back  The doctors are fantastic however this billing department treats you As nothing more than a revenue stream I can't say enough about the professionalism, organization and friendliness of everyone on staff Thank you for giving me my pride and joy What a wonderful experience with RMA!  From the minute you step in the door, the entire staff makes you feel welcomed, accepted, and comforted5 stars does not do RMA justice! We have been beyond satisfied with the care that we have received by the entire RMA team We haven't had a single bad experience with any of the doctors or nurses They are extremely accessible which has helped immensely during the emotionally and physically taxing experience of IVF  Again, truly disappointing The only time the doctor called me throughout process was to apologize after one of the nurses yelled (and I mean yelled) at the patient I thank my doctors, the nurses, the receptionist and all the administrative staff at the Center City and King of Prussia office for the pleasant experience Both the Jefferson and KoP offices are clean and comfortable The Jefferson office saw us so much that they would greet us by name and pick up conversations where left off  That's pretty impressive given that appointments are quick and happen super early in the morning  Good luck!

Billing is also the worst Very bad experience with customer service  We stopped visiting them since The billing department was very rude and made me realize how money centered they areThis place is terrible The nurses were rude, the staff unorganized, a huge mess The most impersonal experience for such a personal thing For such a personal topic, this place makes it so impersonal It absolutely stinks

They subcontracted our appointment process, took 2 times to have our appointment booked for our first visit, first time they didn't have our record at all Let me numbers speak for themselves The highly individualized treatment we have received here is incredible In fact, the nurse that called me wasn't the nurse I even normally worked with- some random lady I don't think I've even met And sometimes that's not even done properly

Do not forget we got pregnant within 6 months YAY I should've trusted my instinct, because I had nothing but problems from the beginning Then my hubby convinced me to try one more time so I gave RMA a try I also saw Dr Freedman, Dr Gocial, Dr Kallen, and Dr Schlaff According to statistics, at 35 with poor ovarian reserve, I had a low chance of conceiving, but I did with God's and all the Doctors' help I wanted to transfer 3 but Dr Freedman wasn't having that so I prayed my 2 would stick, since my other 2 didn't make it to the freezer

Although I wasn't excited about the shots , the hormonal pills and the countless visits for bloodwork and ultrasound; but they got the job done and they did it right Diagnosed low AMH at age 30After suffering a miscarriage last June, I was done with IVF

I started my IVF journey in January 2019 Although this was not what my husband and I had planned, everything happens for a reason We graduated from RMA  Dr Gutmann was my primary doctor  After 5 months of office cycles, we were able to conceive naturally and we are now expecting our first child But we proceeded anyways My main RE was Dr Guttman I only ended up with 4 embryos and transferred 2, one of which wasn't close to being a blastocyst We worked with Dr Gutmann on two pregnancies that involved IUI and IVF After seeing my developing embryo up close for the first few weeks, I couldn't believe that the OB office had so little technology

After numerous attempts at IVF with places like Abington and Cooper Institute and tons of money spent and a total of 4 years on those places They talked through all of our options (medical, financial, legal) with great patience and detail

After the visit we were sent a bill after 2 month said we have to pay 200 sth even though we took our insurance info, after I disputed they re sent it with $10 copay RMA: pregnant 0/6 cycles (4iui 2ivf) and about 30k in debt Cooper reproductive: Pregnant 3/7 cycles (3rd is 4m/o baby boy I am holding right now) about roughly 2k in debt (that could be an over exaggeration)

I had to tell the billing office they didn't submit 3 claims for my IUIs and when they did bill my insurance, they did not submit my referral so now they are sending me bills Plus your plan is dependent on whether or not you have coverage Their success rates are so high because they essentially say they can't help you anymore after 2 unsuccessful ivf attempts if you don't have insurance When I left here/got kicked out at 31 I was told my only option was donor egg/embryo I have been waiting to hear back since mid-June5 years ago

embarrassed, the only way to learn is talking about infertility! So, two gals told me about Dr Orris, how he help get them pregnant via IUI; he didn't push them into doing the IVF procedure since he thought it wasn't necessary and all they needed was an IUI to get pregnant I was past the IUIs and went with Dr Orris' protocol and had a healthy baby at 41!! I am now 44 and had a healthy baby because of him and his team! Dr Orris is the BEST!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I always felt that I was under exceptional care Dr Glassner was very confident and direct with his plan of action pending my test results Dr Glassner laid out the options for my care and based his recommendations on my family planning goals  I appreciated the way the options were presented to my husband and me with our needs in mind  Thank you MLF!  We are so fortunate to have a beautiful baby girl thanks to Dr Glassner and his excellent team Three successful pregnancies later, we express our gratitude to Dr Glassner and his staff everyday He helped us through each pregnancy and never lost hope His office staff is warm, welcoming and so pleasant Thank you, Dr Glassner and staff, for making our family complete I was treated with such kindness thereMy experience at Main Line Fertility with Dr Glassner and staff was amazing From the beginning of my IVF treatment I was told everything looked good and was going fine Dr Brasile went over all possible options regarding medications and answered my questions regarding other "natural" remedies thoroughly and honestly and discussed side effects and potential plans going forward depending on many scenarios Not once did I feel rushed through an appointment, or like I had unanswered questions I've even gotten to appointments early and bumped into the Dr in the parking lot and she recognized me by face and name and pleasantly chatted as we walked to the office together

I couldn't believe how dismissive they were as well about my experience  Dr Glassner lied to my face about the course of action we were taking, and ended up starting an argument between my wife and I because someone was lying and I had no way to ascertain who it was until after work We were confused due to the many meds that we started and Nikki and Dr Bloom took so much time to explain things to us Dr Glassner spoke with me right away to ease my fears of a full miscarriage This was my first experience with anesthesia and I was nervous  After we had 2 failed transfers, we met w Dr Glassner for next steps We were intimidated at first, we had no idea of what to expect The minute Dr Glassner introduced himself and shook our hands, we knew we were in the right placeI was a patient of Dr Deanna Brasile's for about 8 months (due to PCOS) and would recommend her and the office at Main line Fertility to anyone who is scared, unsure or nervous about TTC issues

MLF helped make the IVF process as painless and easy as possible! Thank you for everything!Dr Glassner is hands down one of the best doctors in the area Super fast and amazing that he called himself We'll definitely keep going I strongly recommend this office for growing your family! Best of luck to you!  This is an absolutely reprehensible practice in the vein of Sam Beauregarde, but never a doctor that I am supposed to be able to trust  He is genuine, kind, and ultimately concerned about my wellbeing I will be returning when we are ready for our 2nd child From everyone on the fertility treatment side to the IVF monitoring team- you will not be disappointedFalse promises made and $14,000 out the window I know no one can guarantee anything, but you trust your doctors Just be careful before jumping to IVF Explore you options and what is best for your situation Dr Orris and Dr Bloom are amazing We are in early stages but feel so confident with our choice of the Orris and Bloom team Dr G is great at developing a plan that works and is specific for and to YOU He treats everyone as an individual and doesn't apply the same global treatment plan to everyone Rachel is a wealth of knowledge - ask her anything, really, anything! Don't be embarrassed or shy, she's seen it all! Sue is a doll, but a little rough at first - get to know her, ask her questions - again, a wealth of knowledge My doctor doesn't seem to even remember who I am, and I often have to remind him of certain conditions that he forgets I have Don't worry, she did this to the insurance company agents as well What I did expect was that I would receive the appropriate time and care that I deserve as a patient at this practice I believe that Dr Glassner is most likely talented serving patients who are the 'toughest' cases- the ones he finds especially interesting, unique or challenging This is a large practice,  so you must expect to be treated like a number- therefore, you need to demand attention to receive the appropriate care that is best for you and your family You need decide how comfortable you feel with this approach Dr Glassner has a quirky sense of humor once you get to know each other  She gets down to business right away and doesn't waste any time  Dr Brasile is energetic and her enthusiasm and positive outlook rubs off on you when you may be at a very frustrating point in your journey NEVER let the odds deter you from doing what you know in your heart you should do Also, talk about this with your friends, family, and any one who will listen, because you will LEARN you are not alone NEVER let the odds deter you from doing what you know in your heart you should do  On my initial visit, Dr Glassner assured me that I would be able to get pregnant within the year, with some work  The second round of IUI, we achieve success!  The billing can be difficult to understand   Ensure you know the billing POC and where to contact her He is an amazing and compassionate man They are optimistic and celebrate every positive sign with you I enjoyed visiting their office  After a year of hoping/trying -we are expecting a baby in August:-)  I would recommend them to anyone!! I am sincerely disappointed in Mainline They get your hopes up and then squash them Lots of heartache and lost hope

If I could give a negative star rating, I would  I have still not had an opportunity to speak with the Doctor  I still have no idea what the process is, how much it's going to cost, the risks, the next steps if the this unknown first step doesn't work, etc  Luckily, Women's healthcare is offering fraud protection When it was not successful we asked what could have went wrong Everyone else- coming in with 'unexplained infertility'- may find themselves trying harder to get his attention, or, unfortunately, having their case mishandled by his  lack of attention to detail Don't be satisfied with sloppy answers that don't quite make sense- make them do their jobI cannot thank him enough for what he did  I suggest letting your partner worry about the finances so that you can concentrate on getting pregnant Are they kidding me? Now I have to again be emotionally traumatized as I attempt to fight this fee I didn't know about Unfortunately these are only a few of my grievances with Mainline, but you get the idea So disappointed

We met with him and his PA I am more than satisified; this is not my first fertility doctor Would go back to this team in a heartbeat!  You rarely see the doctor  If we decide to go through egg donor again, we are not using them - the emotional stress is absolutely not worth it His opening line was, "If you follow my directions, you will be pregnant I recommend Dr Glassner to anyone that I meet that has difficulty in conceiving a child They are not straightforward with you I regret ever choosing Mainline and I wish I hadn't

Everyone from the front desk, nurses and other staff went above and beyond the call of duty Wait times were short, front desk always answered the phone or returned calls promptly

The absolute best team you could ever ask for!!!  Everyone on staff is so kind, helpful, and happy!  The physicians are excellent! As is the entire staff!  All team members will spend an unlimited amount of time with you to ensure you understand how to take your medications, calculate timelines, help with financials, anything!  We switched clinics to MLF and couldn't be happier with our IVF results and overall experience The doctors are straight shooters, the appointments might be quick with not a lot of "fluff" But when you need it, the compassion is there Wait times can tend to be long, but there are so many unforeseen emergencies that I cant imagine its easy to plan the schedule perfectly Overall, the quality of care I have received has been excellent In addition, the staff at main line is top notch All the nurses follow-through, call when they say they are going to call and have great experience Someone always answers the phone and is able and willing to help They definitely made up for the wait! Also, the Dr called a few hours after we left with test resultsA little on the pricey side and a tad robotic but the trade off is expertise and efficiency Fertility is always a touchy subject and I would go up to complete strangers that looked 40'ish and ask them if they received fertility help to conceive their child  I found it very easy to schedule appointments There are early morning appointments at 7 am which made it easy for me to balance work and my frequent appointments  Reaching the office by phone was never an issue  The office is run extremely efficiently, which I truly appreciate since I was often there 3 times a week  The Ultrasound techs and nurses are experienced, knowledgeable and empathetic I was glad that all of my procedures were done in the BM office and I did not have to go elsewhere  I was well trained in the self-injections The nurses are unbelievable and they made it very easy I was impressed with their positive attitude and empathy The staff was wonderful  They made the experience a pleasant one  I have never been to a physician's office that was so well run from the front desk to the clinical staff I never had a difficult time with scheduling and was always greeted with smiles and even hugs! This office deserves the best reviews DrGlassner and Rachel were such a god sent! They were always there for any questions I had, called me with blood results the SAME day (which is unheard of)! The nursing staff was amazing! In turn I ended up getting pregnant, and was monitored here until my 9th week of pregnancy Not only was it amazing to watch my baby grow - it was a piece of mind to know I would be monitored every week to make sure everything is going smoothly! Thank you Dr Glassner, Rachel, Dr Orris, Nurses and the entire staff at MLF for everything!! Ill be back for baby #2 :) I have moved on but they keep re-injuring me emotionally by giving me collection calls I can't believe that a doctor who ruined my chances of having children now wants me to pay for the storage I never agreed to! ZERO compassion The staff is very friendly, helpful and accommodating and everyone is sensitive to your personal issues I've never been to any doctors' office with that level of personal care and attention and as thrilled as I was to "graduate" to a regular ob, I was sad to leave this office

applied the used car salesman mentality where they would get us separated and try to  pressure my wife to make a decision on what we were going to do at a visit before we could discuss it  I was told, well I will never do business with them nor would I ever suggest them, even to my worst enemy

The experience I had in this office, to this day effects every internal exam I have Two nurses joined the one who was helping and my husband was panicked  My first issue with their level of serviceWe couldn't even get through the consultation with these folks  The doctor only works in the mornings on Monday and Wednesday and could not accommodate a 2:00 appointment  Since when was 2:00 "evening"?  When they were unwilling to accommodate our schedules, I was asked if we could have two separate consultations, one for her and one for me  They were unwilling Was also told my AMH was a certain level and when tested at another clinic very shortly after, it was much lower  We were told from our new clinic that the lab Main Line uses is not as accurate with AMH levels as other labs that are used by other clinics We feel so much more informed at Main Line  I've gotten a crazy amount of spam calls daily and I am sure it's from this hack as the timeline fits They got us in within a week for our first appointmentThey are always running very late The doctors seem very rushed, and seem like they want to get you out of their office as soon as possible, even if you don't feel comfortable with the treatment plan  MLF has the following going for it: In Philadelphia area, they have the most amount of donorsTheir attitude and service is deplorable  During these lab visits she did not see a provider, they only drew blood2) They were constantly late for their appointments, even if you were signed up for the very first appointment of the day3) The nurses do the monitoring, not the doctors  Other places you see a doctor more often (e They really are the ones who have to keep things running, and deal with whatever the doctors aren't saying to patients  Billing is a different story I'm currently unable to get anyone in the billing department to call me back Everyone seemed knowledgeable and always answered any questions I had  The front desk is very accommodating They never told me about any paperwork at that time that had to be filled out I NEVER told them to store that sample and they never mentioned any fee to me when I was there I rearranged my schedule for a 7am appointment and arrived to find the doors locked I had to stand outside in the rain for 20 minutes before someone could let me in despite numerous calls to the center which went unanswered

are incredibly happy we switchedI just wanted to update my review A few month ago we started treatment again with a different Fertility Doctor and were initially told that not only do I suffer from PCOS (which we knew from the beginning), but that my Husband's sperm was not where it needs to be to conceive naturallyI was a former patient of Dr Glassner's,  and had two successful pregnancies via IVF in 2006 and 2009  Earlier this spring, we went back to MLF in the hopes of conceiving our third child using frozen embryos  Dr Glassner spent approximately five minutes with me during the initial consultation to determine the 'plan' (and I use that term generously) I didn't start this process expecting any guarantee of a pregnancy  Nonetheless, I still recommend them I could not have asked for naturallyAt age 36, through intercourse, I got pregnant and had a healthy baby My sixth IVF (first time with Dr Orris) resulted into healthy baby We initially chose to be aggressive and go straight to IVF We utilized PGD and we were very glad that we chose to get the embryos tested Tiffany was extremely helpful in our decision to go with PGD I saw my gyn for a follow up and they brushed me off like it was no big dealWhen I went to Main Line Fertility, I was a perfectly healthy 38 year old woman with NO reproductive problems I gave up hope and told them to donate the sperm sample

So the first review I did was negative because it took forever to get through my first appointment During my tube test I hyperventilated I was in so much pain But this further validates my negative thoughts on this place As we were both upset we decided to take a break to decrease our stress in trying to conceiveMy wife and I were not able to benefit from IVF, so ended up going through the egg donor process Long story short, the subsequent transfer resulted in a chemical pregnancy, and we have no embryos left to try again I cannot recommend MLF more fully I had 10 failed IUIs at RMA of Philadelphia, then three failed IVFs with Dr El-Roeiy at Crozer, then two failed IVFs at Dr Check's office in Marlton, NJ My husband and I were recommended to his practice after trying to become pregnant for a year unsuccessfully The problem was not on my end The doctor refused to let me try a natural insemination and insisted that I go on Clomid in order to "assess my fertility" although the doctor knew that I did not have any reproductive problems" Well, that did not last long, because guess what? He made me continue on Clomid and after the second round which was just one round after the "assessment" round,, I suffered a rare side effect from the drug which is a thinning of the uterine lining Then two days before my surgery they tell me I haven't been responding to the medication and that my cycle is cancelled

I went to MLF after not being able to conceive for 4 years After this we decided to switch to Dr GlassnerThis isn't even the biggest issue we hadHaving owned cattle, I wouldn't have even sent them there for an artificial insemination I also will be back the next time we decide to conceiveUpdate:We are continuing down the path with MLF We did one round of IUI and one round of IVF This was NEVER mentioned during our time with Main Line If I had known what I know now I would have left the practice long before we spent so much money and time  Within three months I had gone through all the diagnostic testing, and two rounds of clomid + progesterone and now I'm pregnant I was a patient of Dr Glassner's starting July 2013After trying to conceive naturally for 15+ months, my husband and I went to Main Line Fertility  Just under 3 months of testing and treatment, we are now entering the second trimester of pregnancy with our first child Here is my story Then from ages 38 through 41, I had secondary infertility  We did 3 cycles of drugs and 3 egg retrievals At that time, we decided to take a step back and try IUI We did two rounds of IUI, the second round in combination with acupuncture" After a few cycles of clomid, he was rightI came to mainline fertility after 8 months of trying to conceive In the time I was trying, I had one miscarriage At that point I had decided to switch my gyn office In fact, after one round of Clomid, the doctor told me and I quote, that I was a "very fertile 38 year old This only occurs on about 1% of women who take Clomid, or so I was told I went off the drug, but then when I went back to get tested, my uterine lining was still too thin It never recovered after many months Right after that my periods became very light and only lasted about two days

My insurance company explicitly told me they would cover (via flexplan) - they just needed certain informationDr Glassner had me talk to Eileen the study coordinator who was able to put me in a study study that saved me a lot of money, and he was right, it worked! They work very hard to help reduce the very expensive costs of IVF through studies, or referring you to other places that would help with financingI was under the care of Dr Glassner for 11 months in 2014 We submitted this to our insurance after the procedure and to our surprise,  insurance covered the PDG minus the currier fee  I would suggest that you keep on top of the billing department to ensure all claims are submitted and paid

Was told not to do Shared Risk where I would get my money back if it didn't work out because ivf would work for me the first time, and again, obviously we lost all our money After losing my $14,000 within 24 hours, I was then charged $25 for my records That was a low blow but I understand it's policy When going through IVF if we were told this we probably would have paid extra to have the manual insemination of the sperm into my egg  They would refuse to fill out the insurance provided documentationon top of that, MLF accused the insurance claims agent of trying to get MLF to commit insurance fraud! Why would the insurance company want a doctor to do this is beyond me  In the end, after almost a year, my insurance company gave up, and DID pay the flex plan claim ($1,800)

However, they have made up for it  My wife has had tests done and I have provided a semen analysis This info would have changed our entire plan Our experience so far exceeds our expectations since leaving this place I was informed my medical records were compromised They've done more in one visit for me than previous providers have combinedMy Husband and I went to Main Line Fertility a few years ago to begin our fertility journeyThe fees are much higher than at another place I went to in another state WHen typically going to a lab you pay co-insurance, not co-pay, RMA), where you talk to your doctor and ask questions4) They are adamant the egg donor fee is not covered by any insurance  I spent close to a year going back and forth with them and the insurance company I was referred to Main Line Fertility I went to be inseminated with a sperm sample I had purchased from a sperm bank That has not changed since I went to Main Line Fertility

She was extremely kind and generous, professional and thoughtful She had performed a procedure for me two years ago and remembered me, and took time with my partner and behaved in a compassionate way Best part of during the consultation he sat there bewildered by my wife's chart and not understanding what the fuck Penn was trying to do I have received successful top-notch fertility treatment in Japan and I felt that my experience here was merely so-so at best She was knowledgeable and very compassionatelong story short I asked her if am I gonna be able to have a healthy baby from our own?do we have everything normal? and she said my husband morph is abnormal but just a little bit We were well aware of the odds against us, and he basically acted like he was doing us a favor by even trying to treat us because chances are it wouldn't work We truly felt like the staff was rooting for us instead of treating us like we were a burden due to our circumstances I had ridden the train for god sake! My main takeaway from this experience - do not go alone to an HSG! My husband and I were then told on our next visit that our absolute only chance of conception was IVF My husband and I left stunned with disbelief that creating life has come down to this type of commercialization  I will always remember their cheers when I finally "graduated" with my successful pregnancy  But always, once I was seen, I was treated with professional courtesyI've had a good experience with Dr Barnhart and his nurse after switching from Main Line Fertility due to canceled cycles Although my IVF pregnancy ended in miscarriage, he was a pleasant RE to work with His nurse showered me with compliments and sympathy after the lossDr Coutifaris performed my retrieval and showed his sense of humor by writing the number of embryos retrieved on my hand  In my experience, the fellows are thorough, communicative with me and the attending physician and compassionateThis is meant to be scathing, and not meant for Dr Butts, whom I wish was our assigned doctor, and a few very kind nurses We could almost never get in touch with a doctor or nurse when we wanted to, and the times we could were rushed off the phone Go to a clinic with human decency during this incredibly emotional, trying time My main Dr was Dr Barnhart who was wonderful, but I received care from Dr Butts, Dr Dokras, and Dr Coutafaris (name misspelled), who's the head doctor Keeba the biller is also very approachable and helped me with wrongly filed bills  Dr G was also a gem when helping us work through some less than typical situations that arose  That was incredibly appreciated during what is a very emotional processMy interaction with one of the doctora as this practive left me feeling dismissed and unvalued  While I could have been more comfortable with this arrangement if I felt that I had easy access to my nurse or doctor in other ways, I felt disconnected from my care and without power to ask simple questions and get feedbackPenn Fertility Care has been knowledgeable, informative, and flexible with my husband and I as we navigated a very tricky fertility process

Poor communication and disappointing experience overall I saw Dr Divya Shah at Radnor several times  as we were having trouble conceiving our second As opposed to one of the doctors at Shady Grove who was extremely pessimistic and basically said there wasn't much he could do to help me and that I had a 'really tough case' In fact we changed fertility clinics to Penn because our previous doctor (who shall remain nameless but let's just say he was based at Bryn Mawr Hospital) didn't have a very good manner of explaining this to us I have never  been treated with such disrespect and lack of compassion during what is a very stressful and painful time We had a terrible experience with Dr Dokras The majority of Penn Fertility staff, however, treated my husband and I terribly during a really difficult time  His bedside manner was unprofessional;  upon a pelvic exam, he never advised me of inserting the speculum , or his fingers  When I told him i had to visit ER two days prior due to an unusual discharge, he first told me to stop taking the antibiotics, then told me to keep taking them, have intercourse that night, and call them to let them know if the issue persisted  Having come from another fertility practice where I saw a doctor during each visit, it was a shock to never see my doctor, a doctor, or my nurse during most visits

For 14-16 months we discussed treatment plans with a revolving door of nurses Edwards who we saw once in 16 months and another doctor we never even heard ofMy wife has to go through the ordeal of going to Penn Fertility frequently to have her follicles checked so she knows when to take the trigger shot to release the egg  In that time, I met almost every doctor, but as I was considered a patient of Dr Edwards, it was he who I mostly saw (and he who followed up with me when necessary) When I called the office with numerous questions a nurse always answered Dr Dokras performed my transfer and was very thorough talking me through everythingMy husband and I went to see Dr Dokras for infertility treatment She was uneducated and unsympathetic to our needs  She barked at me almost every time I came

I promise you will never see "your" doctor, you will probably never see the same doctor If you are gay, or single, you will most definitely be explicitly or implicitly discriminated against, and will be asked what your husband's name is on multiple occasions If you disregard reviews and decide to go anyway be very sure to ask every question you can think of about every step of the processRun, seriously run I have never dealt with a more incompetent group of people in my life Makes you feel real confident But it gets better  He's supposed to be the best in this area  I'd steer clear of Penn unless you want your appointments to be more like dealing a salesman at the gym While we do like our Dr, you rarely get to see your Doc This is not our first negative experience with Penn Fertility I highly recommend going someplace else if you can I sincerely regret not going to a different clinic with better reviews I wish I had read these reviews instead of trusting other people's opinions Look into other places with a better reputationTo be fair I fortunately did not have to go too far along in the process She did a fertility work up and although I have some major potential issues she remained optimistic I guess that's what happens when your more focused on your job and helping precooked and not just the bottom lobe You see, there is a way to explain these things in a realistic manner, yet do it in a positive way to encourage instead of discourage One good resource is natural-fertility-info Trust your intuition and make sure you feel completely comfortable with the course of action the doctor wants to take, otherwise you will be left with complete disappointment The doctor seems that he cares about only money, gave me unnecessary surgeryI would recommend them  On most visits you will see a fellow, but you will also see your own doctor as well  I always have detailed instructions and a plan  (something that is also very important for fertility patients)Before you dismiss this office due to the previous review, please check it out yourself  You may love it, like me!  We cannot be happier and are over the moon with our little bundle of joy  Other than thatm he said  I was fine, he was pretty sure I'd be fine, and to keep him posted  You should wait and you better not ask questions  I am a quiet, follower typer personality and I am happy to do what you tell me to, as long as I'm not being mistreated  While this may seem like a small thing, she is the guard dog for the office and it is nearly impossible to see or talk with anyone without getting past her

If you do, the person will have no familiarity or concern for your case They will not help you, they will not advocate for you, they will not go the extra mile Mind you we're operating under the assumption that she can't get pregnant if she's right side dominate Told us they're not sure why they would have to bill us twice for once visitHorrible experienceEven more frustrating is that we sent/left multiple messages over the weekend to inquire how did this happen, and does it affect our chances this cycleI should've search and read about this all bad review before I went to penn fertility clinic  I searched the medicine online, as one of these side effect happens, patients should notify the doctor and stop the medicine immediately This practice is a disgraceI have to leave a review for this practice, because my experience has been nothing like the previous reviewerPenn will abuse and try rob you They will completely forget you are coming fro your initial appointment, and casually show up 45 minutes past scheduled time, having not reviewed your chart They will occasionally give you a wrong dose of the med -- i  While the doctor (DrButts) is very knowledgable, you will barely get to see her ever, and when you do, she will rush through the interaction and leave you with questions and concerns afterwards You will be run through lengthy trials that are known to fail, before they finally prescribe correctly  This place is a complete waste of time Avoid if possible  I asked to try fertility meds one month (they didn't recommend them or even mention them to me) and the nurse gave them to me without any explanation

2018 update: Have been back for a quick consultation with Dr Butts Which, by the way, will not be updated with current information We waited 3 months to get an appointment with Edwards There goes another 120 dollars Have had 4 visits and every-time I see the actual doctor  Were taking our business else where  If you are considering Penn Fertility, don't do itI feel like they just want to get the money first and don't care about our feelings I have complete respect for any path a person takes to parenthood, but I want to let people know that sometimes these fertility clinics do not have the best intentions or are just not informed of all ways possible for women to become mothers  My doctor is Dr Dokras  You can also request to only see your doctor if that is preferred I looked up the report and researched every unfamiliar medical term until I interpreted the report myself  We plan on using Penn again to make him a big brother soon  During the next conversation his reply was - so you're just going to go with nature's course  Not at Penn Fertility  If you have a choice, I suggest that you RUN to another practice!  (Try RMA)

First thing I'd like to say is that anyone looking for fertility intervention should read 'Making Babies' by Sami S David & Jill Blakeway I have integrated supplements, diet changes, acupuncture (Cara Frank is amazing), mayan massage (Jennifer Harrison is awesome), and a few other things into my life  But the empathy and personal attention from Gloria, Brooke, and (I am so sorry that I don't recall her name) the other woman who were the ultrasound team at the 8th/Walnut group was amazing  I have had WONDERFUL, compassionate, timely care at this office (3701 Market Street)  (Two heads is better than one!)I always get a call from the nurse (nurse Susan you ROCK!!) on the same day that I call or visit, and there is always follow-through with my care People I liked: Drs Shah, Kalra, Garcia; nurses Erin and Rie (both VERY professional), US tech -- I think her name is Julie? The receptionist actually treated me very nice and was very accomodating of my needs (I had to take an early train and thus cut the line a coupla times)  It was a GREAT day when she was away from her desk or out of the office and someone else stepped in and possessed common courtesy

i called and asking for explanation but no one call back until I emailed the embryologist she said I have to talk to dr  I will never forget Gloria holding my hand and crying with me when I had a loss  She singlehandedly made my visits incredibly frustrating and unpleasant (which were already stressful b/c I was undergoing FERTILITY treatments - duh!)

Last week she went in on Friday, her follicle was 17mm, Nurse Nicole told her to take the trigger shot that same day/night My wife asked the nurse to confirm this since she normally takes it at 18mm, the nurse confirmed 5:15  PM she gets a phone call from a different person "confirming her instructions" (which they have never done before), and those instructions are to take the shot on Saturdayafter she respond my email, nurse called the next day and we set up a meeting for the explanation  She made herself very available throughout the processes as we needed her

Individually, many of the nurses, doctors, residents, and receptionists are extremely competent and kind, however as a system, the place is run like the DMV in the 1980's (Fun Fact her tubes not blocked, these goofs can't apparently figure out their own test) So for months they would have my wife come into office 4-6's times a month to monitor the size of the follicles The nurse looks at us and says, well come back into 2 more days and we will check again My experience at Penn Fertility was very mediocre at best Funny how I was pregnant without any assistance within 2 weeks of that consultation The doctors we dealt with at Penn were excellent at this The first chapter is all you need to read to understand what is happening at Penn Fertility CareI first would like to say that I mostly went to the 8th/ Walnut offices (except on holidays or weekends when I went to 3701 Market St)  I felt like they were compassionate and empathetic, and their support staff was excellent The blood draws were always painless at 8th/Walnut, and the nursing staff was professional and compassionate  You can train people to do their jobs efficiently, but you cannot train people to be as loving and caring as those women were to me  I loved how honest the doctors and nurses were- at some fertility practices, they are all "sunshine and roses", and while I appreciate that some people need a team that will tell them gentle lies to make them feel better, I needed a team who was going to be honest about my chances, and cut to the chase  Although, I really only went there on holidays and weekends, so they may have had a staff during the week who was also fabulousThey are not helping, they are destroying your reproduction system with a lot of bills too They tell you a sample must get there within an hour so why is that not the case this time???!!!! On another occasion I had a nurse laughing when we were talking about my infertility We were referred by Penn Fetal Medicine who we had a fantastic experience with We have had an amazing experience at the other fertility center There are many great facilities out there that will treat you with the respect and care you deserveThere are actually two head receptionists, Madeline and Teresa- both who have been incredibly kind to me in my many interactions in person and over the phoneYes- I have waited over 25 minutes on occasion, but that is NOT the norm  These fellows are all currently physicians in the field and they have wonderful bedside manner- something that is EXTREMELY important if you are a fertility patient  However, I have found that seeing more doctors has been great for me, as they are working as a team to care for me At that, my husband and I went to Shady Grove Fertility and are thrilled with the switchI've switched from MainLine Fertility to here and it was a wise choice I would've given 5 stars if the wait time was better and they offered 7 aI received respect and superb care from the front desk staff to the doctors Some of them actually contain valuable points, now that I am a patient there myself With that, they are pleasant, their heart is in the right place, and their system is overall effective That means, that my airhead nurse just did not bother to check until it was less than one day before the procedure, on a Sunday afternoon Honestly, that was a bit too much to take With that, they still achieve results, and are the closest group for Center City people geographically which becomes important when you do US and bloodwork every other day And they are amazing!!! I never have to wait more then 5 minutes in the waiting room The nurse that takes my blood is AMAZING!!! I never feel it in or out and never get a bruise! They treat you with the most respect and care I have never experienced doctors actually take the time to get to know you and really care about you! I have had NO health problem after donating!!! Love them  The third-party coordinator was amazing at helping us coordinate all of the moving pieces for our surrogacy journey, even when there were some kinks thrown in unexpectedly  One comment was - well even if there is something we can fix, at your age, you just may not get pregnant And to top things off, if you are expecting results, you basically have to call/bug themFirst, I should be clear that my experiences were almost exclusively at 3701 Market Street, not the other locations  I did have one initial visit at Radnor, which is where I had wanted to do some of my care (and per their website, locations are interchangeable - yeah, right!)  My doctor and nurse were fine, and if I was reviewing them, I would have given 3 1/2- 4 stars I'm in the middle of my treatments with them so am not pregnant yet, but I have never considered going anywhere else-- I don't get the sense that they are all about numbers, I think they care about individual patients and cases, and they try to develop a protocol that will work for you as an individual The doctors are all excellent-- we've gotten treatments during some very inclement weather meaning that doctors had to switch around schedules-- and they were always available for us My nurse communicates via text when I need to, and although I didn't realize that so much of the process would be done with nurses, it's very important that you feel comfortable with your nurse, which I do

So the first unpleasant surprise Then I started noticing they were charging us 2 co-pays per visit, from 2 separate doctors So every month we're looking at close to 500 dollars in co-pays for these constant ultrasounds Then the final straw The nurse walks in celebrating apparently not knowing that my wife's right side tube is blocked (once again it wasn't, but unfortunately we had no clue thanks to the medical experts at penn) Incredibly frustrating Just awful customer service in an already tough situation Very discouraging Top it off with the errors his staff were making during our care there, and our experience stunk at that location I had no issues with their staff, everyone seemed very professional and actually a bit rehearsed The results were given to me right after it was done as I was sitting in front of 4 strangers (not sure why 4 people needed to be in the room) I was obviously completely devastated and very little compassion was doled out The worst part was I had come alone as I was told I could because it was a simple outpatient service However it was the upsetting results and the massive amount of bleeding following the procedure that told me that I really should have had someone bring me This time it hurt unbelievably bad, but showed that both fallopian tubes were completely open! Even though I had done the work to get them open, I still had a hard time believing it  But I always waited for ages at the Market St location- including one day when I was completely forgotten about when I was there for a monitoring appointmentThey are not that great as I thought They are so unprofessional The nurses there are not friendly at all as I want to know the ultrasound results as the clomid mess up my uterus and ovary, they said why you wanted to see the ultrasound results, go home, a nurse will call you and tell you everything This place needs some serious sensitivity and professionalism training We were shocked and disappointed with the lack of knowledge, attention and sensitivity that we experienced here The receptionists were often rude, unintelligent and unhelpfulThe final straw: A test showed that a Fallopian tube might have a blockage, meaning the the procedures we had done were quite possibly a complete waste of time, tears and money: and the doctor NEVER told meIt is just cute how all negative reviews of this practice are dismissed under "Not recommended" Prepare to a lot of stress and omissionsAbsolutely horrible The wait here is simply unprofessional and uncalled for  To deal with unpleasant receptionists, and then sit in rooms alone for 30-90mins waiting for a doctor or nurse is  incredibly frustrating If you can, avoid The center city location at all costs  I felt completely alone and unmonitored  Why?  The wait can be terrible - never less than 25 minutes and sometimes up to an hour  At my previous clinic, I usually waited less than 10 mins and my worst wait in 4 months was 30 minutes (for which they were very apologetic) The other reason for my low rating is the receptionist  The main receptionist at 3701 Penn Fertility Care is one of the nastiest women I have ever met

You will call and not receive calls back If you have specific medical concerns, you will need to remind every single medical "professional" of them, because they will not read your chart That's the first and last time I've ever seen that doctor Now once again with the revolving door of nurses I work in sales for a living, I never go into a meeting with a client not knowing every piece of info we have on them  They are primarily sales pl not likeDocs normally are There was nothing to rave about at this clinic The communication at this place just isn't what it needs to be barnhart and apparently I only spoke couple times before I start the ivf program and after that everything is all nurse The words "you get 5 doctors for the price of 1" actually came out of the mouth of Dr Butts  Over all of my treatments, I got to know the women who did the ultrasounds, the blood draw staff, and the nurses  The only reason that I didn't give it 5 stars, by the way, is because I didn't feel the same amount of professionalism at the Market St location In fact, nobody will tell youDO NOT GO HERE!!! I went for an IUI only to be told 20 minutes later that a doctor was not there and that I needed to go to the city  I have been a patient at the office for two years  On most visits, including visits to get blood work, I have only waited about 5 minutesThe reason you do not always see the same doctor is that UPenn is a teaching hospital and this office has a fellowship program for doctors who are becoming instructors They ran the standard battery of tests, charged us twice for most, and never explained anything lab time in their officeThe overall level of service there is VERY uneven "Stay on 450 units", when your dose is actually 300 units, so PREPARE TO DOUBLECHECK their every step Especially when you have to do this multiple times in a week  We went there for about 8 months and they barely ran any tests on me or my husband  I only saw the doctor once or twice, usually it was the nurse, and the dr  Very little oversight But, since they really didn't have much sway in my regular visits with this office, I had to give 1 star  Maybe this isn't a big deal for most doctor's offices, but for fertility testing that occurs every other day, you need to be able to get in and out quickly  In most cases, I was only getting blood work done (that took less than 2 minutes) They have also been individualized in their billing approaches-- they explain bills and ask you in person about them when you come in rather than just receiving a random disconnected bill The nursing staff is the same way

My wife comes in and yay follicle on the left side Well this is interesting because 2 days prior she apparently had no follicles on the right side  That was our last visit We chose a different fertility clinic, one that's highly recommended Also figures out my wife's tube wasn't blocked  I definitely wouldn't return to Penn fertility Dr Shah had a MUCH better understanding of how to approach diminished ovarian reserve Despite the odds against us, our healthy son was born last month due to the care we received from Penn I did feel a bit like a science project as on my first visit I had a ton of blood taken for testing and a transvaginal ultrasound and was scheduled for an HSG the next day I will have to say the procedure was actually done very quickly and smoothly with no pain, which it is apparently rare not to have pain, which I would later learnI looked into other options on my own and proceeded with many types of natural therapies Now it has been a couple months and we are crossing our fingers and toes for a positive test result As I want to know what the polyps are, no body would like to tell me Dr Barnhart switched my protocol, which was successful I was treated like just a number - get the tests then straight to IUI I'm expecting a positive pregnancy test next week At first, I gave the place the nickname "Hot mess with a happy ending"We are very pleased with Penn Fertility  We ultimately had a successful pregnancy on the first try and had a baby within a year of our first visit to the clinic  Even though I am not prusing IVF, and I will believe that the practice is one of the best in the country, I would not recommend Dr Sondheimer

My wife chose Penn and unfortunately I didn't read the google and yelp reviews At no point was this explained that it would essentially be billed as a surgery or a procedure So after the HSG, they determined that my wife had a blocked tube She doesn't have a medical history that would lead to this happening and they offered no explanation how this would occur 2 days later and now the right side is dominate So now my wife is apparently right side dominate this month So 2 days later back in the office and now magically the left follicle has disappeared and they don't know if my wife ovulated Then the nurse thinking my wife's right tube is blocked says, hey maybe we try the iui this month So we should waste a procedure that we have a limited number of that won't work???? Also you don't even know if she already ovulated is a huge disappointed for us, we just done with eggs retrieval on september 2017 but the embryo didn't last to blastocyst that's mean no embryos to transfer and no partial refund either according  they policy agreementWithout going into too much detail, let's just say that due to our age and due to the nature of our problem, we probably had around a 20-30% chance of carrying a pregnancy to full term The HSG performed showed that both of my fallopian tubes were blocked  I went for almost three years- multiple IUIs, and several losses actually the doctor is lack of the basic knowledge and scripted clomid he should not since I have thyroid disorder and fibroid, Then, as I took the clomid twice, got heavy bleeding, two cys (one is very big 3 cms), and no ovulation waited for three months to get my period back, and fibroid grew crazily after took clomid, FSH is doubled, My AMH is dropped by 60% (clomid speeded up using my egg reserve) As I called the nurse to notify the severe side effect, heavy bleeding and belly pain) and asked if I could stop the clomid, she said continue and take some ibuprofen if feel pain In fact, the doctor should not script the hormone for me because levothyroxine  for my thyroid disorder should not be taken with clomid, which won't lead to ovulation and actually result in heavy bleeding We would not recommend this facility Unfortunately, this is not the one of them We had three failed IUI procedures with them; each time Penn charged us a co-pay and $150 for a "specimen thaw" which is part of a co-pay at other fertility clinics Though we left the practice in December, we received several harassing, enormous bills, which we have just resolved With severe endo, and issues with high estrogen and low ovarian reserve at 34-yrs-old, Dr Dokras transferred 2 grade 1 8 cell embryos Or so I thought when less than 24 hours before my last retrieval they told me they have no donor sperm prepared for me  We interviewed several fertility clinics and ultimately chose Penn and could not be happier that we did  We are already extremely distraught after experiencing miscarriages, and failed IUI'sPenn fertility is absolutely terrible

I've bumped up my star rating to 3/5 as a result They make my wife take a HSG test They tell us come back 2 days later so we can measure the follicle again  WeHave an appointment at Mainline fertility w Dr GlassnerMy wife took the shot at 5 PM Zero responsewhat!! I mean if I knew it from the beginning I would not start my ivf program, we gonna fix our issue first and continue after that We researched and decided to switch to Penn I had mostly normal other results, but because I was 38 I should hurry into the process We stayed for the IVF lecture that night I could feel the changes in my body and my period This past February (1 year later) I scheduled another HSG with my gynecologist When I didn't return for a 7 week ultrasound, she checked up on me I've also worked with Dr Butts before for my laparoscopy Especially to those with endometriosis We had and continue to have a very high opinion of Penn Fetal Medicine After our initial appointment with her, we decided to go to another fertility center in Philadelphia I'm 4 days past my 3 day embryo transfer Dr Dokras let me view the screen during my transfer and explained everything step-by-step Again, in the very end, they found the sperm and did the procedure, but until the last minute, gowned up and with the IV in, I did know if the procedure is still happeningI am an egg donor there  We are a same-sex couple that needed an egg donor and surrogate  Whenever the discussion of IVF came up, and I informed this dr that it was not an option for me- he would shut down didn't even call me after I had an HSG  They do not do blood tests or ultrasounds throughout the month
